description: Citing concerns over New York State's spending and accounting methods, one of the nation's leading investment services lowered its rating of state bonds yesterday by a half grade. to AAminus.

title: 2 Fellow Novelists: Isaac Singer and God
description: ISAAC BASHEVIS SINGER speaks of God with a sense of collegiality, as one author of another; there is compassion and perhaps an edgy maneuver or two toward oneuomanshin.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: SOME questions are inevitable in a professional chef's life and one them is, Do you ever invent a dish? The inevitable reply Yes. In fact, life would be pretty boring if you stuck to the invariable, classic recipes. A very simple, recent invention in my home came about simply on a day that I found myself with an oversupply vegetables that had, the day before, been the basis for a traditional potage garbure, a soup made with vegetables in season: cabbage, turnips, carrots and onions. The result was the kind of dish most people, on reading recipe, would be skeptical about, feeling it too simple to be so delicious.

title: Chrysler Unionists Reject Wage Freeze
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Local leaders of the union representing Chrysler workers today rejected the proposed legislation  even if it means bankruptcy for the company  that would tie Government aid to a threeyear wage freeze.

title: Aides Feel Bush Is Propelled Into Seeking Spotlight
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Dec. 4  George Bush's campaign is attracting attention trifle earlier than his staff had counted on, and as a. result his managers in the fourstory redbrick headquarters here have decided to go back on Boston television to keep his face in front of New Hampshire and Massachusettes Republicans.

title: Events Today
description: BETTET DIVINE MADNESS, starring Bette Midler, at the Malestic Theater, 44th Street west of BroadWAY.

title: MALPRACTICE RULING ISSUED BY JUSTICES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Courtappointed defense attorneys are entitled to no greater immunity from malpractice suits than are private attorneys, the Supreme Court ruled today.

title: ABCTV Show Held Exempt on Providing Equal Political Time
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The Federal Communications Commission ruled today that appearances by political candidates on Good Morning America, an ABC network production, did not require that equaltime access be provided to other candidates.

title: 2 Top Financial Officials Quit Chicago School Jobs
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4  The top two financial officers of the Chicago Board of Education resigned late today, bringing to four the number of school officials who have stepped down in the financial crisis that has left the $1.4billion school system almost broke.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 4, 1979

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: The letter of Nov. 27 from Alfred F. Dougherty Jr., the Federal Trade Commission attorney in charge of the socalled shared monopoly case against Kellogg, General Mills and General Foods, fails to refute the criticisms of that case which were so well expressed by Peter Passel! in his Editorial Notebook of Nov. 13, but it does demonstrate once again the absurdity of the entire proceeding.

title: Knicks Top Suns, 118114, As Cartwright Collects 36
description: Bill Cartwright, the 7foot1inch rookie center, scored a careerhigh 36 points as he led the Knicks to a 118114 victory over the Phoenix Suns at Madison Sauare Garden last night.

title: Mets Chief Vetoes Swan Trade
description: TORONTO, Dec. 4  Just as the Mets were on the verge of trading Craig Swan to the California Angels today, Lorinda de Roulet arrived in town and vetoed the swap.

title: Western Union Quits Mail Project
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) The Western Union Telegraph Company, impatient with regulatory delays, is withdrawing from its contract with the Postal Service to help set up a new electronic mailing system, Postmaster General William Bolger said today.

title: German Banks Back Telefunken Rescue
description: WEST BERLIN, Dec. 4  A.E.G.Telefunken, West Germany's ailing electrical products giant, unveiled today a wideranging, privatesector rescue program intended to return the company to profitability by giving more funds, fewer workers and a new chief executive officer.

title: Russian Defects in Hamburg
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, Dec. (Reuters)  A Soviet interpreter from Leningrad has asked for political asylum here, the police said today. The 41yearold interpreter, identified only as Iosif B., reported to a police station and asked for asylum yesterday, the last day of a weeklong Leningrad cultural, sporting and culinary festival, a spokesman said.

title: Business Group's Shift
description: EAST HARTFORD, Conn., Dec. 4 (AP)  In a policy change, the National Alliance of Business will urge companies to cooperate more with the Federal Government in programs to train the unemployed the group's new president said. John H. Filer, chairman of the Hartfordbased Aetna Life and Casualty Company, told a conference of Government employment specialists today that he had committed the alliance to take part more fully in the Federal Comprehensive Employment and Training Act program and similar efforts.

title: Gingerbread Houses A Snap to Make
description: Eager to make a gingerbread house for the holidays and unable to find one of the conventional molds usually needed to bake one? There are alternatives, possibly the only ones, since most sources for molds report that they have sold out their supplies and have no hope of getting new supplies in time.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TURKISH BLEND Humor and irony pervade the cartoons of Salih Memecan. In one abstract drawing a man peers curiously into a box forming the dot of a huge question mark. In a cartoon, a severelooking figure pries open a world globe, clasping a handmixer. A monthlong exhibition of Mr. Memecan's sketches begins tomorrow at the Turkish Center, 821 United Nations Plaza. The mainfloor gallery is entered on First Avenue at 46th Street.

title: Market Moves Ahead As the Dollar Picks Up
description: A slight rally in the dollar helped the stock market to move ahead yesterday across a broad front. Energy and defense issues were the standouts, but selected glamour stocks also posted good gains.

title: Nov. 2130 Car Sales Down 27.1%
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4  The Big Three domestic auto makers reported today that sales plunged 27.1 percent in the final third of November and 26 percent for the month as a whole, compared with the 1978 periods. The tumble made November the worst selling month of 1979, in spite of continuing salesincentive programs at all three car makers.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: The shape of the securities markets of the future will be determined in part by a 35yearold lawyer named Douglas S. Scarff. After several months of searching for a new director of market regulation, the Securities and Exchange Commission named Mr. Scarff, its associate director of the Office of SelfRegulatory Oversight, to that influential staff position yesterday.

title: 29 Bids Are Received for Cable TV in 4 Boroughs
description: Twentynine bids for cabletelevision franchises for the boroughs of Queens, Brooklyn, the Bronx and Staten Island had been received by the city's Bureau of Franchises by the filing deadline Monday. Some of them were from major national companies, such as Teleprompter and Cox Cable, and some were from smaller cable operators in the area.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. 9 (AP)  Mary June Meredith, the wife of the Mississippi civil rights figure James Meredith, has died at a Jackson hospital after a heart attack at their home. She was 41 years old. Mr. Meredith, the first black to enroll at the University of Mississippi, said today that the heart attack occurred yesterday morning. The Merediths have three children. Funeral services are to be held in Jackson and Kosciusko on Saturday, with burial in Kosciusko.

title: Careers
description: WITH energy costs so high and continually rising higher, many boat lovers have turned their attention from eneines to sails.

title: OreIda's Geothermal Gamble
description: ONTARIO, Ore.  This small town  just a few miles from the Idaho border  smells like french fries. More than two million pounds of raw potatoes are processed here each day by OreIda Foods Inc., a subsidiary of the H.J. Heinz Company, one of the nation's largest diversified frozenfood processors.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: COMMODITIES
description: An unexpected rebound in the dollar yesterday sent gold futures down by $3.80 to $5.30 an ounce on New York's Commodity Exchange. But silver futures found enough steadfast buyers to close substantially higher.

title: Mayor Byrne Bypassed In Award of Federal Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)  Transportation Secretary Neil E. Goldschmidt, who last month threatened to deny Federal funds to Chicago after Mayor Jane M. Byrne endorsed Senator Edward M. Kennedy, today announced a $24.8 million grant for projects in the city.

title: Key Witness Recants In Sanjay Gandhi Case And Accuses Premier
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 9  The chief prosecution witness in a court case against Sanjay Gandhi has recanted his testimony and asserted that he made his charges against the son of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi at the urging of Charan Singh, the current Prime Minister.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: NOT everyone revered them, the cabbies of yesteryear. But we miss them, a little. The cigarchompers who railed against things like the United Nations have yielded to General Assembly of new arrivals from Russia, Greece, Yugoslavia, the Philippines and the broiling cauldron of the Middle East. One such voyageur just gave the gift of his company to our Taxi and Limousine Correspondent, Tom Ferrell. Here is his report:

title: Carter Believers Gather in Iowa To Pay Tribute to Image on TV
description: AMES, Iowa, Dec. 4  With all the friendship, wine and check writing, the Jimmy Carter house party almost overlooked Jimmy until someone remembered to snap on the TV set. There he was, already talking.

title: G.O.P. Assemblymen, Wooing Voters in City, Find Their Van Stolen
description: Squads of Republican Assemblymen invaded the overwhelmingly Democratic turf of New York City yesterday as they opened their battle to cut into the Democrats control of the city's Assembly delegation in the 1980 elections.

title: 7 Get Rockefeller Award for Work in Public Interest
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) Rockefeller Public Service Awards were oresented tonight to seven Americans.

title: New Law Directs Property Owners To Clean 18 Inches Out From Curb
description: As of April 1, city property owners will not only have to keep their sidewalks clean, but also will be required under bill signed yesterday by Mayor Koch to keep clean the area 18 inches out from the curb.

title: John Frasca, Reporter Who Won Pulitzer for Helping Free Convict
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 4 (AP)  John A. Frasca, a Pulitzer Prize winning reporter, died yesterday in his apartment of heart attack. He was 63 years old.

title: The City
description: Cleveland Davis went on trial a second time in the murder of two policemen while he was on parole in 1978.

title: Dance: Bohemian Debut
description: ALL Brooklyn, it seemed, turned out Saturday night to see the New York debut of the Bohemian Folk Ballet of Prague at the Brooklyn Center for the Performing Arts at Brooklyn College. And the 50member Czechoslovak folk dance and music group, directed by Vlastimil Cap, did not disappoint its capacity audience. The stage was alive with broad strokes of color, comedy and a showstealing eightman orchestra.

title: WASHINGTON Khomeini And The Koran
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  In an effort to liberate the hostages in Iran, President Carter has mobilized with the utmost care every temporal and political force in the world  from the United Nations and the World Court to the Kremlin. which is quitea distance What is odd is that Mr. Carter, deeply religious man, has not yet mobilized the spiritual leaders of the world to appeal to Ayatollah Khomeini in the name of Islam and the principles of the Koran.

title: BACKING ON MISSILES IS ASKED BY SCHMIDT
description: WEST BERLIN, Dec. 4  Chancellor Helmut Schmidt declared here today that no pressure from the East would impel West Germany to abandon its support of plans to strengthen the missile arsenal of the Atlantic alliance in Western Europe.

title: Milwaukee Line Pact With Union Pacific
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (AP)  An agreement to sell certain properties of the Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul & Pacific Railroad Company to the Union Pacific has been reached by officials of the two companies, the Milwaukee announced today.

title: British Gold Reserves
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (Reuters)  Britain's gold and foreign currency reserves fell $81 million in November after declining $253 million in October, the Treasury said. Reserves at the end of last month totaled $22.48 billion.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Broken clouds stretch from New England through the lake region Into the Northern Plains States. Overcast clouds cover the Gulf of Mexico and most of southern Texas. Thick multilayered clouds are visible over the northern Rockies and the Pacific Northwest. Clear skies prevail In the rest of the country.

title: House Panel Hears of Starvation In East Asian Area of East Timor
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Witnesses before a House committee today described conditions of starvation and suffering in East Timor comparable in intensity if not in scale to those in Cambodia. They differed in assessing the causes of the situation, however.

title: World News Briefs
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (UPI)  A Patriotic Front guerrilla leader warned today that Britain could find itself embroiled in a new colonial war in Africa if Lord Carrington, the Foreign Secretary, tried to impose a settlement in Zimbabwe Rhodesia before reaching agreement on terms for a ceasefire.

title: Best Buys
description: THANKS to an abundance of greens, pork and chicken, food prices dropped last week, with the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City down $1.16 from the previous week. According to the Department of Consumer Affairs, the 41item market basket cost $88.76, a 1.3 percent drop. Still, shoppers paid 6.3 percent more for food last week than at the same time last year.

title: Two Jockeys Hurt in Spill During Meadowlands Race
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec.  Two jockeys, Doug Thomas and Anthony Maita, were injured tonight in twohorse spill at the Meadowlands.

title: Jersey Will Take Over Dozen Private Agents Handling Car Licenses
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4  New Jersey will take over 12 of the 54 privately owned motor vehicle agencies across the state next year to test whether all such agencies should be phased out. The agencies sell motor vehicle registration certificates, license plates and driver's licenses.

title: Korean Court, After a Brief Session, Suspends Trial of Slayer of Park
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 4  A military court today suspended the trial of the former chief of the Korean Central Intelligence Agency and six others charged in the murder of President Park Chung Hee and his bodyguards on Oct. 26.

title: India Calls Effort to Curb Nuclear Arms a Hindrance to Development
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 4  Prime Minister Charan Singh charged today at an international meeting of nuclear experts that efforts to limit the spread of nuclear weapons thwart the peaceful development goals of poorer countries while leaving the nuclear powers free to add to their arsenals.

title: Met Opera in Black 3d Year in a Row
description: For the third consecutive year, the Metropolitan Opera has met its expenses through operating revenues and contributions, according to Frank E. Taplin, president, and Anthony A. Bliss, executive director.

title: Personal Health
description: The new mother looked lovingly, gratefully, yet somewhat anxiously at her pink, squalling daughter, her firstborn. The baby had the requisite number of fingers and toes, nice little nose, flat ears and a healthy cry. But what's that ugly red patch on her forehead? she asked worriedly. How did it get there? Is she marked forever? Her hospital roommate, an experienced mother of three, examined the inchwide, salmoncolored mark and offered reassurance: That's just an angel's kiss. Lots of babies have it. Don't worry, it'll go away.

title: Atom Power:
description: STORRS, Conn.  During the debate on nuclear power, at least four fallacies seem to have attained the status of truth. What is disturbing is that there is ample information that dearly refutes them and that is available to anyone who. like me. is an amateur in the field but who is concerned about the future of nuclear power. I've been interested in nuclear power since 1967 and I offer the following four fallacies and responses.

title: The Season of Giving
description: There are just three weeks until Christmas, and shoppers packed the sidewalks and the aisles of shops big and small yesterday.

title: DIPLOMATS DUBIOUS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 4 The United Nations Security Council unanimously adopted a resolution today urgently demanding that Iran immediately release the American hostages in Teheran.

title: The U.N. Today
description: The U.N. Today

title: Member of Iranian Minority Says Khomeini Charter Is Not for Us
description: TABRIZ, Iran, Dec. 4  It was the hour when customers are few, so Ahmad Safai, a craggy, 42yearold Azerbaijani fruit merchant, took time out for a glass of hot dark tea and a bit of reflection on the day's business. Today, he seemed trouhtml.

title: Hughes Given Satellite Task
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)  The Federal Communications Commission has hired Hughes Communications Services Inc. to build and launch four space satellites for use by the American military services.

title: Olympic Torch to Burn for Hostages in Iran
description: Saying they feared violence, city officials in San Antonio said last night they would not allow Iranian students to stage a protest march against the presence of the deposed Shah of Iran at Lackland Air Force Base.

title: Eleven Months Away
description: President Carter did not in fact begin anything with his kickoff announcement yesterday. His candidacy for reelection has been obvious since his campaign committee was established last March. But at least his formal declaration did, as they say, end the beginning. All the major candidates have now announced. The long, coy preliminaries are finally over.

title: Harold L. Cowin, a Lawyer, Dies; Specialized in Negligence Cases
description: Harold L. Cowin, a partner in the law firm of Corcoran, Amabile & Cowin of Brooklyn, died Monday at Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn. He was 78 years old and lived on Staten Island.

title: Q&A
description: Q. Some years ago I dined on a dish in Italy that resembled a pizza. It was very simple, though without tomatoes, mushrooms, anchovies and so on. The name sounded something like scotcha. Have youever heard of it?

title: Article 1  No Title
description: THREE KILLED IN CALIFORNIA TANK FARM EXPLOSION: Firefighters were dwarfed by 11111foot flames yesterday as they fought a fire that killed two workers at a Mobil Oil tank farm in Torrance, Calf., near Los Angeles. A third person was killed when her car was engulfed in a fireball as she drove by the refinery. About 300 people were evacuated from area homes. Four other persons were Injured. Portions of the refinery not affected by the fire remained in operation as firemen allowed the blaze to burn itself out.

title: Notes on People
description: A nephew of President Carter who has been in and out of California prisons for a decade will be paroled on Christmas Eve.

title: Private Waterway Is Upheld
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Privately financed development that turns isolated bodies of water into navigable waterways does not automatically create a public right of access, the Supreme Court ruled today.

title: Trade Surplus Cut in Canada
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 4 (Reuters)  Canada's trade surplus narrowed to $326 million in October from $754 million in September, the Government's statistics agency said today.

title: Chess:
description: The most surprising showing by an outsider at either of the two Interzonal tournaments this year was that of Jaime Sunye, a Brazilian international master who tied for fifth place in Rio de Janeiro with Borislav Ivkov, the veteran Yugoslav grandmaster. His six victories, seven draws and four losses put him ahead of eight grandmasters.

title: Nuclear Power's Costs
description: WASHINGTONWith fullpage advertisenients In newspapers, the nation's electric companies seem determined to rewrite the story of the nuclear accident at Three Mile Island.

title: Where the Stores Are
description: Here are the names and addresses of stores that are listed in the article on Christmas food gifts:

title: Jody Powell and Nodding Carter Relish Daily Sparring With Press Over Iran
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Squinting through his cigarette smoke, Jody Powell looks faintly exasperated. Look, you can construct just about any theory you wish to construct, leading to just about any theory you choose, he tells reporters at the White House. I'm just not going to get into it

title: Accord at Flushing Hospital
description: Agreement on a tentative twoyear contract between Flushing Hospital and Medical Center in Queens and its house staff of 70 doctors was reached yesterday, according to The Associated Press. Philip A. Palese, executive director and chief negotiator for the 424bed voluntary hospital, said the accord was subject to ratification by the board of trustees and the house staff. Details of the agreement were withheld.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: The Elder Craftsmen shop is walltowall Christmas right now and crammed with delightful things made by men and women older than 60. The tree ornaments are especially charming: a tiny mouse in a walnut shell cradle ($3), an array of clothespin dolls dressed as angels or choir boys or Little Orphan Annie ($3.75) and the Sesame Street characters made of felt ($7). The shop is especially good for children's presents. There are lots of rag dolls, including one of Grandma, spectacles and all ($40). There are also handknitted sweaters ($27) and Snoopy mittens ($7.50), handsmocked dresses for little girls ($39 to $60) and hangers for baby's wardrobe with organza and lace covers ($6). The shop's most special thing is a hooked wall hanging depicting Mystic (Conn.) Seaport, done in delightful primitive style by a woman who used a drawing of the area as model ($485). The shop is at 850 Lexington Avenue (between 69th and 65th Streets).

title: L.I. Town to Honor Slain Marine
description: CENTEREACH, L.I., Dec. 4 (AP)The Brookhaven Town Board has voted to change the name of Village Green Memorial Park in Port Jefferson Station to Steven J. Crowley Memorial Park, honoring the marine corporal slain Nov. 21 by a mob that attacked the United States embassy in Islamabad, Pakistan. At a town meeting today, Councilman Edward Reynolds told Corporal Crowley's mother, Georgene, that dedication of the park would take place early next year. The 20yearold marine grew up in Port Jefferson Station.

title: Inventories Up 0.9% in October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)  New orders for the nation's factories dipped fourtenths of 1 percent in October after rising 3.1 percent in September, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Iran Foreign Chief Says Students Will Try Hostages
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Wednesday, Dec. - Foreign Minister Sadegh Ghotbzadeh said yesterday that the hostages held at the American Embassy would be put on trial as spies and judged by their student captors, Pars, Iran's official press agency, reported.

title: Islanders Beaten, 51, By Canucks
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Dec. 4  Things got even worse tonight as the Islanders returned to Nassau Coliseum after nearly three weeks on the road. They lost, 51, to the Vancouver Canucks for their eighth defeat in 11 National Hockey League games, and they lost Denis Potvin for six to eight weeks and Stefan Persson for five or six days.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Home for Indigent Cancer Patients
description: On Jackson Street in Lower Manhattan, St. Rose's Free Home for Incurable Cancer stands as a source of help for the poor with terminal cancer, providing medical care and a comfortable environment in which to die with dignity  something every human being deserves, says Sister Mary David, a spokesman for the home.

title: Iranians Say Records Show Shah Diverted $1 Billion
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 4  Iranian officials charge that documents uncovered in an investigation into the finances of the deposed Shah of Iran show that over $1 billion in identifiable funds was diverted or misappropriated by the Shah and his family from Iranian banks and other institutions.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, the nation's largest chemical concern, announced yesterday the sale of its paper dye business to the Mobay Chemical Corporation of Pittsburgh and an agreement in principle with three other companies for the sale of other segments of its dye business.

title: House Passes $426 Million Bill for Nuclear Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The House of Representatives today approved a $426.7 million authorization bill to fund the Nuclear Regulatory Commission for the fiscal year that began Oct. 1.

title: Question Mark Over Portugal
description: LISBON, Dec. 4  A group of rightist parties has won a majority of seats in Portugal's Parliament, but the triumphant coalition is possibly a volatile one and Portuguese and other Europeans who had roles in its victory are watching to see how it will use its new power.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Allied Chemical Corporation, Morris Township, N.J., has elected to its board James A. Krumhansl, professor of physics and applied physics at Cornell University. Mr. Krumhansl was also elected chairman of Allied's newly created scientific advisory committee.

title: Excess XRay Radiation Found
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)  More than a third of dental Xray machines and almost half the breast Xray machines examined by the Food and Drug Administration in a 45state survey emitted unacceptable levels of radiation, the General Accounting Office said today.

title: Economic Scene
description: NOBODY seems to know when the term stagflation was first used or who coined it. The earliest publication of the term, as found in bassador to this country and now a visiting scholar at the Brookings Institution in Washington. But Mr. Jay insists that he did not invent the term. He thinks it originated in the United States.

title: Kennedy Assails Carter in Appeal to Women Voters
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  As President Carter announced his plans to run for reelection, Senator Edward M. Kennedy denounced the  President's domestic policies today and made a special appeal to women voters, a group that will make up half the delegates to the Democratic National Convention next summer.

title: The Region
description: SYRACUSE  The construction of the NiagaraMohawk Power Corporation's newest nuclear plant has been slowed dramatically, and 1,100 workers face an indefinite layoff this month because of what a utility spokesman yesterday called regulatory uncertainties in the nuclear industry.

title: A Smorgasbord of the Latest Food Research
description: TWO rabbits in every pot, barrelburgers and superchickens. For people who smack their lips over tidbits about food, these are some of the latest offerings from the smorgasbord of news.

title: Poor Aided In Getty Settlement
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The Getty Oil Company, in a precedentsetting settlement of Government complaints about energy overcharges, agreed today to donate $25 million to a new fund of corporate contributions to help pay heating oil expenses of the poor.

title: THREATS REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The White House accused Iranian militants today of having threatened to kill some of their American hostages if they failed to cooperate in such activities as signing petitions asking for the Shah's return to Iran.

title: St. John's Trounced By Tennessee 9780
description: KNOXVILLE, Term., Dec. 4 (AP) Howard Wood, a reserve, scored 18 points in the second half, leading Tennessee to a 9780 victory over St. John's in the Volunteers basketball opener tonight.

title: Money
description: TUESDAY. DECEMBER 4. 1979

title: Argentine Junta Member Retires; Names Moderate to Replace Him
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 4 (AP)  Gen. Roberto Viola announced today that he will retire as army commander and a member of the ruling military junta and named an ally to succeed him in both posts.

title: Hindsight in America, Foretaste in Iran
description: The Iranian questions are becoming tangled again. Edward Kennedy thinks Americans owe nothing to a venal Shah and would do well to keep denouncing him. Henry Kissinger thinks the country is being pushed around by radicals because it failed to save the Shah give him asylum. Jimmy Carter thinks it useful show he is eager to dump the Shah, and then wonders why other countries won't have him.

title: 100,000 on Carter Card List
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)  One hundred thousand Christmas cards will be mailed this year by President and Mrs. Carter, courtesy of the Democratic National Committee. The greeting will read: With best wishes from our family for a happy holiday season. The cost of the card and the mailings, paid for by the committee, was not immediately disclosed.

title: Stage. Wanshel Musical
description: THERE are punks in the parlor and a countrywestern combo peering in the front window. Holeville is a musical comic strip that strives to be uptodate and colloquial. The evening is arduous, although I must admit that I have an aversion to shows in which grownup actors play adolescents and puppydogs.

title: Letter: On Rising Medical Bills
description: To the Editor: Your Nov. 21 editorial suggesting that insurance companies are the prime culprit behind rising medical costs and that insurers have little incentive to economize and simply pass along higher costs to faceless customers is inaccurate and does not reflect the reality of the situation.

title: France Reportedly Ends Its Ban on Spot Oil Deals
description: PARIS, Dec. 4  The French Government, in a turnabout, has quietly indicated to its oil companies that they may buy oil on the highpriced spot market in Rotterdam, the Netherlands, to meet an expected shortfall this winter, according to oil industry sources.

title: PhillipsNorth Sea Output
description: BARTLESVILLE, Okla., Dec. 4 (Reuters)  The Phillips Petroleum Company said its Norway subsidiary had started production of oil and gas from the Eda field in the Norwegian sector of the North Sea. Phillips said production at the field was about 26,000 barrels of crude oil and 40 million cubic feet of natural gas a day. Phillips said 10 development wells will be drilled in the Eda area by mid1981.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: How a Cheese Store Became a SoHo Institution
description: The word venerable is generally applied to institutions of impressive dignity and age. In the world of food it could most certainly be applied to Fauchon of Paris, which has been around since 1886. It could equally well be applied to the spectacular food market in Harrods of London; Harrods came into being before the turn of the century, in 1894. And to Dallmayr's of Munich. That temple of gastronomy had its beginning in the late 1600's.

title: Iran Ends Dollar Payment
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 4 (UPI) Iran stepped up its economic warfare with the United States today by officially forbidding foreign companies to pay for oil with dollars and announcing that it will raise oil prices in 10 days.

title: Market Place
description: AFTER insisting since 1933 on settlements in part or in full on defaulted foreign bonds, the United States is now ignoring its obligation to the holders of these bonds to encourage settlements by foreign governments.

title: Saudis End Mecca Mosque Siege
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Dec. 4 (UPI)  Saudi Arabia said today that its troops killed or arrested the last of the religious fanatics who seized the Grand Mosque of Mecca two weeks ago.

title: Dollar Gains Slightly; Price of Silver Eases
description: The dollar rose slightly yesterday, recovering some of its losses of Monday, while the price of gold continued to rise in Zurich but fell elsewhere.

title: FRENCH GET RESPITE IN 41DAY AIR STRIKE
description: ATHISMONS, France, Dec. 4  This used to be farm country and there are still plowed fields among the nondescript singlestory houses and discount centers along the main roads. The town is only dozen miles south of Paris, but it is unlikely that many Parisians have ever been here.

title: Billy Carter Sees Error In Letting Shah in U.S.
description: AMERICUS, Ga., Dec. 4 (UPI)  Billy Carter said today he felt it was a mistake to admit the exiled Shah of Iran to the United States. He said, however, that Mohammad Riza Pahlevi should now be allowed to remain in the country if no other nation will give him refuge.

title: TV: Jean Stapleton as Manager of a Baseball Team
description: 'TIS the season to be heartwarming and, if at all possible, inspirational  at least on television. This evening's prime slice of sentimentality, on CBS at 9 o'clock, is Aunt Mary, starring Jean Stapleton.

title: Letters
description: To THE LIVING SECTION: Ann Barry's article, Searching for the OldFashioned Doughnut [Nov. 7], prompts me to comment on another of the species, which might be called the newfashioned doughnut. I refer to the tasteless product, dusted with powdered sugar, which used to be the Bunker's favorite at roadside diners. It was the product that gave the World War I Yankee the nickname doughboy.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: AT this season of luxurious indulgence, what could be more appropriate than a lavish gift of something wonderful to eat? In my opinion, and not too surprisingly, the answer to that question has to be nothing. And with that in mind, here are some delectable candidates among which you should find something to delight everyone on your gift list.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (AP)  The late Mayor Richard J. Daley supplemented his income with a second salary of $25,000 a year as chairman and treasurer of the Cook County Democratic Central Committee, it was disclosed today.

title: Private Lives
description: AFRIEND writes  a book here, an article there, the occasional postcard  trying to bring into some kind of approximation the demands of the culture and the back roads and byways of her secret self. At the moment, she is between projects. This parenthesis, or hiatus, might have been a yawn; instead, she populates her pause with other people, busy friends. She follows them to work. She spends the day, on location, in their classrooms or studios or laboratories. She sits in on their fodder and folderol. She heckles their colleagues.

title: Real Estate
description: IT WAS not the intent of Abramson Brothers, owners and managers of Manhattan commercial properties, to pioneer when they bought the fully tenanted 16story building at 62 West 47th Street, the heart of the diamond district, in 1971. They boxed on it as an investment, one that might bring a 9 or 10 percent return to those who bought interests in the syndication.

title: Farmer Shunned by Mennonites Is Acquitted of Wife's Abduction
description: CARLISLE, Pa., Dec. 4 (AP)  Robert Bear, a farmer shunned by his family since he was excommunicated by the Reformed Mennonite Church seven years ago, was acquitted today of abducting his estranged wife.

title: Text of Appeal From Council
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 4 Following is the text of the resolution adopted today by the United Nations Security Council:

title: Rockefeller Foundation Fails to Pick a President
description: Trustees of the Rockefeller Foundation, after a sevenmonth search for new president, ended their annual meeting yesterday without making a selection.

title: N.H.L. Sabres Going Electronic
description: BUFFALO  Captain Video was on the walkietalkie. Down below, on the ice in the Memorial Auditorium, a Buffalo Sabre had just made a mistake. Usually when that happens, the coach yells across the bench. Not Captain Video. He watches games from the press box and does his talking through an electronic device similar to walkietalkie. He has a specially licensed channel in the United States and Canada.

title: ABC Tops TV Ratings
description: With three nights given over largely to professional sports events  two football games and a boxing tripleheader  ABCTV was the top network in last week's Nielsen standings with a 21.1 ratings average. CBS was second with 20.3 and NBC last with 16.9.

title: The Arts Emboss Tweed Courthouse
description: Boss Tweed died in disgrace in 1876, two years before completion of the notorious Tweed Courthouse  planned cost, $350,000; final price $12 million to $16 million. But the building, fittingly enough, now ds his death certificate in the Municipal Archives.

title: G.E. Chief Calls for Tax Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The chairman of the General Electric Company, Reginald H. Jones, today called for a $25 billion tax cut as early as possible in 1980.

title: Original Burlesque
description: CANTERBURY TALES, as performed by the Equity Library Theater, is exuberant, funny and happy. It is also knockabout, bawdy and imaginative. You may credit Chaucer for part of this  he was probably the true father of burlesque  but give a cheer for the people at the Equity Library Theater, too. See Canterbury Tales if you can.

title: Arabs Split On Size of Oil Increase
description: KUWAIT, Dec. 4  Arab oil ministers meeting here today agreed that an increase in the price of oil at the meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries later this month was inevitable, but they split sharply on how large it would be.

title: Ship Freed in the St. Lawrence
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 4 (AP)  The Algoma Bay, a vessel owned by Algoma Central, has been freed after having run aground in the St. Lawrence Seaway on Dec. 2, a Transport Department spokesman said today. Defective steering gear caused the vessel to run aground on Cross Over Island, on the American side of the Seaway near Brockville, Ont.

title: BROWN IS AWAITING FORUM WITH 2 RIVALS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4  Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California today welcomed the opportunity to appear with his two Democratic Presidential campaign opponents and criticized Senator Edward M. Kennedy for his recent comments on Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, the deposed Shah of Iran.

title: Judge Weighs Challenge to Crackdown on Iranians
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The Justice Department, defending President Carter's crackdown on Iranian students who are in the United States illegally, argued in court today that it was a fundamental element of the President's effort to obtain the release of American hostages in Iran.

title: Kennedy Remarks on Shah Cause County Leader to Shift to Carter
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (AP)  A county Democratic leader said today he was defecting from the campaign of Senator Ed. ward M. Kennedy and offering his aid to President Carter because of the Senator's statements on the Iranian crisis.

title: Main Break Puts Subways Awash In Morning Rush
description: The motorman on the 4:48 A.M. Broadway local from Van Cortlandt Park spotted the water pouring into the Varick Street tunnel in downtown Manhattan when his IRT subway train arrived there shortly before 8 A.M. yesterday.

title: Title IX Guidlines Announced
description: H.E.W. Secretary Patricia Harris announced a new set of guidlines for compliance with Title IX, the Federal law banning sex discrimination in intercollegiate athletics. Page B11.

title: Arkoff, Noted Producer, Quits Posts at Filmways
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 5  Samuel Z. Arkoff, a pioneer of independent movie making, resigned today as chairman, president and chief excutive officer of American International Pictures Inc., which was acquired by Filmways Inc. in July for $30 million.

title: Breathing Room for Business, in a Bubble
description: Hard times can be especially hard on the environment. When jobs are at stake, the stench of dirty air can seem sweet. That is why regulatory reforms just announced by the Environmental Protection Agency are especially timely. By embracing the socalled bubble concept, the agency is offering private enterprise a new way to control air pollution effectively at far lower cost than standard regulatory techniques.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Theater: Bette! Divine Madness
description: HOW far can you get on overkill? All the way to Hollywood and the Majestic Theater on Broadway if you're Bette Midler, who opened her latest Broadway run at the Majestic last night, hot on the heels of her screen debut in The Rose. Like Delores Del Lego, the Toast of Chicago, who makes an appearance near the end of the first act, Miss Midler has lots of lungpower and an underwhelming amount of taste. Unlike Miss Del Lap (who's essentially Miss Midler spoofing herself), the real Miss M. also has talent.

title: Nuclear Parley Bars South Africa
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 5  South Africa was barred today from participating in the current general conference of the International Atomic Energy Agency as 49 nonaligned, Eastern bloc and developing countries outvoted 24 Western and industrialized nations, including the United States.

title: Italy Raises Discount Rate
description: ROME, Dec. 5 (Reuters)  Italy will raise its discount rate, effective tomorrow, to 15 percent from 12 percent, the Treasury announced today. The increase is expected to help curb inflation and support the lira.

title: Bridge:
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 5  Playoff matches to determine the 1980 United States team for the World Team Olympiad, scheduled in the Netherlands next September, begin here tonight. The favorites, however, will be on the sidelines and happy to be so.

title: Edmund Wilson's Shelf
description: In a splendid posthumous victory for Edmund Wilson, a series of compact editions of American classics is finally going to be published, and with Federal aid. A decade before his death in 1972, the great critic argued for just such a fivefoot shelf, patterned on France's Editions Pliads. His campaign brought him into memorable combat with the Modern Language Association, the academic keeper of sacred literary texts.

title: Envoy Tells Uneasy Americans In Saudi Arabia They'll Be Safe
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Dec. 5John C. West, the United States Ambassador, flew here this morning to assure leaders of the large American business community that they had nothing to fear as a result of recent turmoil in the country.

title: Chambliss Is Traded to Braves
description: TORONTO, Dec. 5  Chris Chembliss, who was traded from the New York Yankees to Toronto five weeks ago, was traded again today without ever having set foot in Canada when the Blue Jays sent him to the Atlanta Braves.

title: Ashe Did Not Suffer Second Heart Attack
description: Arthur Ashe, the 36yearold tennis star, entered Memorial Hospital in Jacksonville, Fla., on Tuesday after feeling some discomfort in his chest, but word was yesterday that he definitely had not suffered a second heart attack.

title: Jersey Plan to Reclassify School Districts Delayed;
description: EWING TOWNSHIP,, N.J., Dec. 5 The State Board of Education Voted today to delay action on a plan to classify New Jersey's 613 school districts and 3,100 schools. The vote came at a meeting here at which parents, teachers and school administrators opposed the labeling of their schools under a system proposed by the state's Education Commissioner.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The Treasury sold oneyear bills yesterday at an average discount rate of 10.818 percent, down nearly one percentage point from the peak rate set four weeks ago, as fixedincome securities rose in price and declined in yield for the second consecutive day.

title: Hers
description: EVERY time I saw a Katharine Hepburn movie my imagination ran amok. Seeing that flare of spirit borne with such wit and style over a rivet of will, I would imagine something wonderfully subversive: Katharine Hepburn as President of the United States.

title: Man Accused of Strangling Wife
description: A 25yearold Queens man was charged yesterday with homicide in the strangulationbeating of his wife. The suspect, Joseph Johns, who surrendered at the 112th Precinct, was accused of killing his wife, Anne, 23, during an argument Tuesday afternoon at their home in the Little Neck section, the police said. She had been strangled and beaten with a malletlike instrument. they said.

title: Theater: Dostoyevsky
description: THE version of Dosto'evsky's Notes From Underground that Norman Sample is performing ThursdaytoSunday through Dec. 23 at the Classic Theater is not a dramatization of Dostoyevsky's novel of volatile and spiteful passions and of rejected friendship and rejected love. But it is not strictly a reading either.

title: Unrest Raises Doubts on Iran Oil
description: ABADAN, Iran, Dec. 5 The Islamic revolution has afflicted Iran's oil industry with continuing unrest and work stoppages, throwing into question whether the National Iranian Oil Company has more than tenuous control over its own operations.

title: Chemical Bank Blocks Iran Assets
description: The Chemical Bank announced yesterday in London that it had won a high court injunction in Britain restraining the Iranian Government and the Bank Markazi, the Iranian central bank, from removing any assets in the jurisdiction of British courts.

title: Salvadoran Leftists Burn 6 Planes, Seize Church
description: SAN SALVADOR, Dec. 5, (UPI) Armed leftists today burned six private planes and killed a night watchman in a continuing campaign of violence against the junta that overthrew President Carlos Humberto Romero.

title: Pianist: Firkusny at Carnegie Hall
description: ASan allaround master pianist, Rudolf Firkusny from Czechoslovakia does not concentrate on the music of his homeland, though through the years he has played a good deal of it. But last night, in addition to Schubert and Mussorgsky, he did program two Czech pieces, neither of them well kown. One was Bohuslav Martinu's Fantaisie and Toccata, composed in 1940 and dedicated to Mr. Firkusny. The other was Dvorak's Suite in A (Op. 98).

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: WALKERVILLE, Ontario, Dec. 5 (AP)  Hiram WalkerGooderham & Worts Ltd., Canada's secondlargest distiller, said today that it planned to offer the equivalent of about $174.2 million for the Highland Distilleries Company, the Glasgowbased Scotch whisky bottler. The offer amounts to about $2.83 for each of Highland's 61.4 million shares.

title: Routine Swiss Election Of the Cabinet Is Upset
description: GENEVA, Dec. 5  The usually routine election by the Swiss Parliament of the Federal Cabinet was upset today.

title: The OldSouth Treasure Hunt
description: WINSTONSALEM, N.C.

title: Technology
description: IS the microwave oven, long considered a stepchild of the kitchen appliance industry, finally coming Into its own? Apparently the people who make frozen foods are beginning to think so.

title: Fuqua to Buy Its Stock
description: Fuqua Industries, the Atlantabased diversified concern, said yesterday that its directors had authorized the purchase from time to time of up to three million shares of the company's common stock.

title: Insider Reports for Exchanges
description: The New York and the American stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchanges.

title: CARTER IS RENEWING;DIPLOMATIC EFFORTS;TO FREE AMERICANS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  President Carter has decided on a renewpc1 diplomatic effort to gain the release of the 50 American hostages in Teheran and has authorized planning for economic sanctions against Iran if diplomatic moves fail.

title: The New York Times/ Fred R. Conred
description: MONDALE AND MRS. CARTER ARE HECKLED IN HARLEM: Vice President Mondale gesturing forcefully at Salem United Methodist Church last night. He and Rosalynn Carter were shouted down by about a dozen hecklers In an audience of 800 from various Harlem churches. Page BM.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE LETTERS OF KARL MARX. Selected and translated with explanatory notes and an introduction by Saul K. Padover. Illustrated. 576 pages. PrenticeHall. $19.95.

title: Acting Seoul Leader, by Big Vote, Wins Endorsement for Presidency
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Thursday, Dec. 6  Running unopposed, Acting President Choi Kyu Hah was proclaimed President of South Korea today by an overwhelming vote of a 2.560member electoral college.

title: Queens Man Convicted of Slaying Wife and Stepdaughter With Ax
description: A 47yearold Queens man, Joseph Rose, was convicted yesterday in State Supreme Court in Kew Gardens of killing Ms wife, Jessie, and his stepdaughter, Crystal Lugo, 29, in a hatchet attack at their home in Hollis two years ago.

title: Deaths
description: CANCOChristopher J. The New York Times records with deep sorrow the possIng of Christopher J. Canco associated with The Times since 1939.

title: Going out Guide
description: MEET THE MAESTRO Schirmer Music's recent move into the Fifth Avenue premises of Brentano's was festively marked by a weeklong array of lectures and performances by New York musicians, from classical exponents to Broadway contributors. Today's personalappearance guest covers both orbits.

title: Top MGM Film Job May Go to Begelman
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 5  David Begelman, who left the presidency of Columbia Pictures two years ago in the midst of a scandal over his alleged embezzlement of $61,000, is negotiating to become president of MetroGoldwynMayer's film division.

title: Bronx Shares Its Traditions Of the Season
description: Christmas began yesterday for Billy Marrero on Southern Boulevard in the Bronx.

title: House Sets Back a Plan;Dr. King'S Birthday U.S. Holiday
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 As the widow of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. watched glumly from the galleries, the House of Representatives dealt another setback today to a bill that would make Jan. 15, his birthday, a national holiday.

title: C.A.B., Ending a Study, Urges More Competition
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  The Civil Aeronautics Board today concluded its 18month investigation of the pricing practices of the International Air Transport Association by reconfirming the Government's commitment to competition.

title: Slowdown Seen On Meat Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP) Consumers can expect nearrecord supplies of meat and poultry next year and a substantial slowdown in price increases at supermarket counters, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Bell Testifies on Vesco
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  Former Attorney General Griffin B. Bell testified yesterday for about 90 minutes before a Federal grand jury investigating allegations that Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier, tried to get the Carter Administration to use its influence to solve his lewd nroblems.

title: Banks Providing Misinformation, State Study Says
description: A survey of bank branches in New York City by the State Attorney General's office has found that service representatives in almost half of the branches offered potential depositors savings accounts with interest rates lower than other available accounts.

title: Notes on People
description: Ashe Hospitalized

title: Unions to Begin a Drive To Attract More Women
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  The trade union movement is about to undertake major drive to organize women workers, labor officials announced today.

title: Novelist's Widow Dies
description: Vifvan Borg Shellabarger, widow of Dr. Samuel Shellabarger, professor, biographer and novelist, died Tuesday at Memorial Hospital in Worcester, Mass., after suffering a heart attack while visiting her daughter, Marianne Jeppson of Worcester. She was 88 years old and, lived in Princeton, N.J.

title: Springfield Unice/Don Fontaine via United Press International
description: BREATH OF LIFE FOR YOUNG FIRE VICTIM: In Chicopee, Mass., Paul Leranger gave mouthtomouth resuscitation to Aime Paulo, 3, overcome by afire in her home. She was reported in critical condition last night.

title: Union Reelects Simpson
description: Donald Simpson, president of the independent Uniformed Bridge and Tunnel Officers, won a second twoyear term. He defeated a former president, Anthony M. Mauro, 234 to 149 and carried his entire i slate to victory.

title: Joan Kennedy Tells of Plans For Aiding Husband in Race
description: BOSTON, Dec. 5 (AP)  Joan Kennedy said today that she admired her husband for seeking the Presidency even though it meant reviving questions about the acci dent at Chapaacmiddick.

title: Hostages Relatives Flying to Briefing at U.S. Expense
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 5  The State Department announced today that it had invited one member of each family of the 50 hostages in Iran to visit Washington tomorrow at Government expense for a briefing by Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance on Friday.

title: Student, 15, Is Beaten Over Iranian Heritage
description: CHAPPAQUA, N.Y., Dec. 5 (UPI) A student of Iranian descent was beaten unconscious today by another youth in a fight at Horace Greeley High School that witnesses said began with taunts about the student's heritage.

title: Mrs. King Is Defeated
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 5 (AP) Billie Jean King was knocked out of the $100,000 Women's Tennis Classic by Betty Ann Stuart in a heat wave that sent temperatures over 100 degrees this afternoon. The scores were 75, 64.

title: PEKING PLANS TESTS FOR RESEARCH POSTS
description: PEKING, Dec. 5  In a move to depoliticize social research and reward academic excellence, the prestigious Chinese Academy of Social Sciences announced plans this week to select next year's research fellows by conducting competitive examinations throughout the nation.

title: Christmas Table Settings Benefit Theater
description: SAN FRANCISCO

title: Saudis Cut Oil for Italy In Scandal
description: ROME, Dec. 5  Saudi Arabia suspended a large part of its oil deliveries to Italy today because of charges in the Italian press that huge commissions were being paid to Saudi and Italian of ficials and politicians.

title: Knicks Defeat Bullets, 107104, As Richardson Scores at Buzzer
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 5  A driving layup at the buzzer by Michael Ray Richardson, who went around Jim Cleamons, his teammate until late yesterday, enabled the New York Knicks to defeat the Washington Bullets; 107104. tonight at the Capital Centre.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5 (Reuters)  A Soviet commentator said today that the Afghan Government could count on Moscow's help in fighting rebel tribesmen.

title: Declare War on Iran, Without Attacking
description: WASHINGTON  Pressure is building on our Government to do something drastic about Iran. There is talk of the possibility ot a military attack either to force the Iranians to return the American hostages or as retribution if they kill or try some or all of them. One alternative to a military attack that deserves careful consideration, although it may seem a bizarre idea, is to declare war on Iran without initially  or possibly ever  launching a military attack.

title: Nonesuch Chief Ousted
description: Teresa Sterne, who has guided Nonesuch Records, a widely known classical record company, alsmost since its formation 15 years ago, has been discharged.

title: Queens Woman Slain And Mbther Wounded
description: Eager for a reconciliation with his estranged wife, a 56yearo1d Burns guard had an amiable supper at his former home last night and then ended the visit by shooting his Wife to death and wounding his motherinlaw, the police said

title: Left in Iran Split by Stand Over Khomeini
description: TABRIZ, Iran, Dec. 5  In all parts of Iran, including this northwestern Azerbaijaini region where autonomy is a particularly sensitive issue, the Tudeh, or Communist, Party has taken a firm position behind Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini's Islamic leadership.

title: Gov. Brown Chides Kennedy
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 5 (Reuters) Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California said today that Senator Kennedy's remarks on Iran probably stemmed from his watching President Carter's emergence as a leader and from concern about his decline in public opinion polls.

title: Home Improvement
description: New stationary power tools are now portable.

title: COMMODITIES Rumors On Iran Crisis Feed Gold Futures Rise
description: Gold futures prices rose yesterday on unfounded rumors that Iranians had killed several American hostages. Although Washington strongly denied the rumor, at the close of New York's Commodity Exchange, gold was still up $5.50 an ounce. The most widely held delivery, the near February, finished at $444.

title: Marine Corps to Provide Seagoing Units in Rapid Deployment Force
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Secretary of Defense Harold Brown has decided that the Marine Corps will provide the main seagoing force and the Army the airborne troops for a rapid deployment force designed to enable the United States to apply military power rapidly in the event of a crisis in underdeveloped nations in the 1980's.

title: Clippers Remove Walton From Injury List
description: Bill Walton, former pride of the 197677 champion Portland Trail Blazers and current hope of the San Diego Clippers, was removed from the injuredreserve list yesterday, just prior to the league's trading deadline.

title: Coppens Will Start for Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. Dec. 5  The Giants will have a new starting right tackle Sunday in St. Louis, and it won't be Gordon King.

title: IRAN SAID TO OFFER HOPE OF DISCUSSIONS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 5 Foreign Minister Sadegh Ghotbzadeh of Iran reportedly held out some hope today that negotiations might soon begin on the release of the United States captives in Teheran.

title: The Jokes Don't Matter in Hoboken
description: HOBOKEN, N.J. Dec. 5To paraphrase the hapless comedian Rodney Dangerfield, Hoboken don't get no respect.

title: Kaufman Says Lack of Good Spokesman Hurts Courts
description: A Federal appeals court judge warned yesterday that the absence of an effective spokesman for the courts threatened the preservation of the prestige and charisma that are the wellsprings of judicial authority.

title: Jockey Guarded Following Spill
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec. 5  Anthony Malta, a 29yearold jockey from Staten Island, suffered internal injuries and a shoulder separation in a spill at the Meadowlands last night.

title: Hedberg Adjusting to Life as a Ranger
description: Through most of last season Anders Hedberg felt out of place.I knew I wasn't playing as well as I could. He said. Motivation had never been a problem. He had known what he wanted to do since he was a boy, and doing it still excites him. When the lights come up over the ice at Madison Square Garden, I am always ready.he says.

title: U.S., Vexed by Libya On Embassy Assault, Curtails Relationship
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The United States announced today that it was suspending operations of its embassy in Tripoli, a step short of breaking relations, and warned of further steps if Libya continued to refuse to accept responsibility and to pay damages for the storming of the American Embassy by 2.000 people.

title: Printing Colors of Plants to Come
description: PORTLAND, ORE.

title: Deaths
description: ANDORSAnna, beloved wife of the late Victor. Devoted mother of Sophie Smith, Judith Lennon, Lillian Sobele and Sylvla Epstein. Adored or andmother, great grandmother and great, greatgrandrnother. Services Thursday, December 6. 12:45PM The Riverside, 76th St and Amsterdam Ave. In lieu of flowere, contributions may be made to Temple Israel of The City of New York, 112 East 7S St

title: Money
Auctions
description: Rugs fit for nomad or sheik.

title: ESSAY Moment Of Falsity
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  We're going through one of those inexplicable moments in the nation's capital: a change in atmosphere is regarded as a shift in climate.

title: Soviet Tank Unit Quits East Germany
description: WITTENBERG, East Germany, Dec. 5 Soviet troops and tanks began rolling east from here toward home today, leaving behind a message for the West.

title: Ohira Arrives in Peking to Complete Loan Accords
description: PEKING, Dec. 5  Prime Minister Masayoshi Ohira of Japan today began a fiveday state visit to China during which he and Chairman Hua Guofeng are expected to complete loan agreements worth more than $1.5 billion for energyrelated development projects that are vital to China's modernization program.

title: Scientologists Seek to Remove Judge Presiding Over Their Case
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI)  On the eve of the scheduled sentencing of nine of Its members, the Church of Scientology today asked a Federal judge to withdraw from the case on the ground that he may have received a death threat that would bias him against the church.

title: Dividends
description: Opayable In Candina funds.

title: Rolls Engine Deal Reported
description: TOKYO, Dec. 5 (AP)  Three Japanese companies will sign a contract with RollsRoyce of Britain for the joint development of jet engines, Japanese officials said today.

title: Two Iranians Are First To Be Deported by U.S.
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 5 (Reuters)  The United States immigration authorities said today that they had deported the first two Iranians since President Carter ordered a crackdown last month.

title: Topics Dropping Charges, and Names
description: The good news from Israel is that its Government knows how to admit a mistake. The Palestinian Mavor of Nablus, Bassam alShaka, is back home and on the job, released from detention and the threat of deportation. He had been provoked into making an ambiguous private remark in which some Israelis perceived sympathy for Palestinian terrorism. When that charge rang hollow, a Government that had too hastily arrested him toyed with an even more dubious indictment, charging association with terrorism. Two dozen other West Bank mayors quit in protest. Worse, the world was left to conclude that the Begin Government was doing everything possible to discourage Palestinians from ever trusting in negotiations for their promised autonomy.

title: Iran Hopes Send Stocks Higher
description: Stock prices moved moderately higher yesterday amid hopes for a peaceful resolution of the Iranian crisis. The dollar's continuing firm tone in currency trading also helped investor sentiment.

title: Harry Bloomfield Is Dead at 72; Play Producer and Restaurateur
description: Harry Bloomfield, a theater producer and New York restaurant operator, died of a cerebral hemorrhage on Nov. 28 in Las Vegas. Nev. He was 72 years old

title: Hospital Silent on Shah
description: New York HospitalCornell Medical Center, where the deposed Shah, Mohammed Rim Pahlevi, spent 41 days until he was discharged on Sunday, said yesterday that it would have nothing further to say about his health because he was no longer a patient there.

title: Corporate Earnings
description: For periods as shown. (N) Indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: City Maps $9 Million Heat Emergency Plan
description: New York City officials are working on a plan to put $3 million in city funds and $6 million in Federal funds into a program for apartment buildings in poor areas that have heating emergencies this winter. The city's funds would come from its Emergency Repair Program.

title: 30 Jazz Groups to Perform in Benefit
description: More than 30 wellknown jazz groups will take part in a benefit on Tuesday to defray the cost of an operation undergone last week by Clifford Jordan, the jazz saxophonist. A week before he was hospitalized, Mr. Jordan had organized a successful threeday benefit for the family of the late Wilbur Ware, the bassist.

title: Growing Deficits Peril Entire program
description: Nearly a quarter of a century ago, when the fiscal crisis was a thing of the distant future and grandiose government plans were as commonplace as the talk of cutbacks is today, some political, civic and business leaders came up with an idea to help middleincome families afford housing that might otherwise be beyond their budgets.

title: Evelyn M. Suarez, 91, Sought Improvements In U.S. Maternity Care
description: Evelyn Marshall Suarez, a pioneer in improved maternity care in the United States, died Tuesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 91 years old.

title: Sears Forming A New Group
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company said yesterday that it was forming a new business group to manage its real estate development and financial services operations to capitalize on our existing assets.

title: Black Hawks Tie Rangers, 33
description: For two and a half periods, Steve Baker, the Ranger goaltender, played almost perfect hockey. For two and a half minutes, he faltered. The result was a 33 tie with the Chicago Black Hawks that left the 22yearold goaltender a little disappointed.

title: Order by T.W.A. Solidifies Boeing As Top Producer
description: Trans World Airlines.announced yesterday that it would buy 10 Boeing 767 aircraft, the first model of a new generation of jets that will go into service in the early 1980s. The airline will spend $500 million over the next four years for the planes and parts.

title: New Play at Jewish Repertory
description: Benya The King, a new play by Richard Schotter based on Isaac Babel's Tales of Odessa, will open next Thursday at the Jewish Repertory Theater, 344 East 14th Street. Directed by Roger Hendricks Simon, the show features music by Ken Collins and design by John Schaeffer. Performances will be at 8 P.M. on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, and at 2 P.M. on Sundays. Previews began yesterday. Theater Development Fund vouchers will be accepted. For information and reservations: 6747200.

title: Cosmos Get Hulcer and DiBernardo in 4Player Trade With Aztecs
description: The Cosmos yesterday acquired Larry Hulcer, a midfielder who was last season's rookie of the year in the North American Soccer League, and Angelo DiBernardo, a forward, from the Los Angeles Aztecs.

title: Giscard Is Again Facing Charges He Accepted Jewels From Ruler
description: PARIS, Dec. 5  President Valry Giscard d'Estaing was embroiled yesterday In new charges that he had accepted gifts of diamonds from the head of an African nation he later helped to depose. The charges were made in Le Canard Enchan, the investigative and satirical weekly, which first reported last October that the President had taken a gift of diamonds from JeanBedel Bokassa, the former Emperor of what is now the Central African Republic.

title: Henrietta Seiberling, 91, One of Founders of A.A.
description: Henrietta Buckler Seiberling, a key figure in the founding and development of Alcoholics Anonymous, died yesterday at her home in New York City. She was 91 years old.

title: BRITISH AND REBELS;kGREE ON CEASEFIRE;IN THE RHODESIA WAR
description: LONDON, Nov. 5  Tentative agreement was reached tonight on a ceasefire in the guerrilla struggle in Zimbabwe Rhodesla, raising hopes for a peaceful conclusion to 19 years of bitter racial conflict in a strategically significant part of southern Africa.

title: House Panel Votes Cities Aid Bill;;New York Could Get $50 Million
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  A municipal assistance bill that is likely to provide as much as $50 million to New York City cleared a committee of the House of Representatives today, representing a victory for the city and other hardpressed municipalitie,s.

title: Layoff at Inland Steel
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 5 (Reuters)  The Inland Steel Company said today that it would lay off 1,570 workers for oneweek periods this month at its Indiana Harbor mill because of a decline in orders for steel products.

title: Deaths
description: DORFMANSeymour. Bronx Chapter of Hadessah mourns the passing of Seymour Doriman, beloved hue. band of our employee, Zelda Dorfman, and laving father of Barry of 115 East Mosholu Parkway, Bronx, New York. Services Thursday, 10 A.M., Riverside Memorial Chapel, Bronx, NY.

title: Gasoline Inventories Up; Demand Remains Low
description: Gasoline inventories climbed 5.1 million barrels last week to 224.3 million, the American Petroleum Institute reported yesterday. The increase pulled gasoline stocks out of the Department of Energy's designated danger zone.

title: House Rejects Bid to Suspend Retirement Rule for Pilots at Age of 60
description: WASHINGTON; Dec. 5  The House refused today to order an 18month suspension of a Federal rule that requires commercial airline pilots to retire at the age of 60 years.

title: State Foreclosing 3 Projects Of MitchellLama Housing
description: New York State has begun mortgage foreclosure proceedings against MitchellLama projects, opening a new phase of its battle to salvage the troubled middleincome housing program.

title: Q&A
description: Q radiator in the bathroom on the second floor of my house stays cold even when the heat is coming up. I tried opening the vent valves on all the radiators but very little air came out and this did not seem to help much. Then I opened the vent on the bathroom radiator and let the water run until I had taken out about three to four gallons. The radiator warmed up a little at the bottom, so I drained several more gallons of water out, but only the bottom stayed warm. Later this, too, became cold. How can this be corrected?  F. V., Philadelphia.

title: The City Lookalike Freed In Murder Case
description: Acting Justice George Roberts of State Supreme Court in Manhattan dismissed murder charges yesterday against a Manhattan man who was the apparent victim of mistaken identity.

title: Bishop in Florida Asks Asylum for Haitians
description: MIAMI, Dec. 8 The Roman Catholic Archbishop for South Florida has urged the Government to grant political asylum to thousands of Haitian refugees who he says are victims of discrimination.

title: Bahrain's Boom in Banking
description: MANAMA, Bahrain, Dec. 3  The Security Pacific National Bank of Los Angeles threw a party here the other day to introduce one of its new boys to the banking crowd.

title: U.S. Would End Punitive Measures
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  Administration officials said today that if a durable political settlement for Zimbabwe Rhodesia was agreed to in the London negotiations, the United States would lift sanctions against the African country within a few days of the arrival of a British Governor in Salisbury.

title: Le Canard Enchan Is a Duck That Bites
description: PARIS, Dec. 5  For 64 years Le Canard Enchan, or The Shackled Duck, has been poking fun, usually with ferocious humor, at the pomposities and pecadilloes of French political life. In the process, it has become one of the best investigative journals anywhere.

title: Mormon Church Excommunicates A Supporter of Rights Amendment
description: STERLING, Va., Dec. 5 The Mor. mon Church today formally excommunicated Sonia Johnson, 43 years old, who has been in conflict with church leaders over her outspoken advocacy of the proposed equal rights amendment.

title: Price Violation Laid to Sun Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (Reuters) The Department of Energy said today that it had begun enforcement action against the Sun Oil Company for alleged petroleum pricing violations totaling $332.4 million.

title: IRISH PRIME MINISTER WILL RESIGN MONDAY
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 5  Prime Minister John Lynch of Ireland announced today that he would resign on Monday, throwing the political situation here and in Northern Ireland into confusion.

title: ABROAD AT HOME Act Now, Pay Later
description: Of all the energy bills sought by President Carter since last summer, one is approaching the end of the legislative process. That is the bill to create an Energy Mobilization Board with broad power to hasten the approval of energy projects. The legislation has passed both House and Senate, and conferees have been appointed to work out the differences.

title: Swiss Victor In Downhill
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 5 MarieTherese Nadig, who always races well here, opened the World Cup skiing season today by winning the women's downhill, comfortably beating two other veterans and two youngsters.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: In Case Nuclear Combat Erupts in Europe
description: How many Europeans would be killed  10 million, 50 million or 100 million? Would tens of millions of reftigees make Atlantic alliance defense impossible? Is the urbanization of Western Europe barrier or an advantaee to attackine Soviet armies? Could the North Atlantic Treaty Organization withstand the strains that would result from a Soviet threat to use nuclear weapons?

title: Brown's Ads on Radio Assert Oil Companies Are Backing Kennedy
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 5  Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr.'s campaign strategists today unveiled a New Hampshire radio advertising blitz which maintains that Senator Edward M. Kennedy Is the favored candidate of the oil comoanies.

title: RIFLE OF SOVIET TYPE TIED TO BUS AMBUSH
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 5  Federal officials said today that a Sovietdesigned AK47 automatic rifle was among the weapons used to fire on a bu:sload of saiI ors outside a Navy base near here.

title: Venezuela to Cut Oil Production
description: PARIS, Dec. 5 (Reuters)  Venezuela's Mines and Energy Minister, Humberto Caldern Berti, confirmed today that his country will cut back oil production by 150,000 barrels a day, or 6 percent, beginning Jan. 1.

title: Deaths
description: ROTHENBERGMurry J. The officers and employees of Monet Jewelers express their deep sorrow on the passing of Murry J. Rothenberg, our retired Vice Chairmen of the Board. Murry Rotherterg played. key role in our organization for more than 40 years. All of us are proud of his devotion to, and deep Involvement with, humanitarian causes. His many friends and colleagues in our company and throughout the community will miss him. We wish to extend our deepest sympathy to his wife, Ellia, his son, Marc, and to all his family.

title: Watch on Rhine to Be Revived
description: Watch on the Rhine, Lillian Hellman's antiFascist play that won the New York Drama Critics Circle award in 1941, will return to Broadway in a revival by the Long Wharf Theater of New Haven. It will open Jan. 3 at the Golden Theater.

title: South Africa Plans to Move Town of 50,000 Blacks
description: GARAMOKGOPA, South Africa From his house atop a rock, Chief George Ramokgopa can look out on his people and reflect on their experiences since his greatgrandfather brought them here a century or more ago.

title: Gullikson Upsets Nastase
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 5 (AP)  Tim Gullikson of the United States upset Ilie Nastase of Rumania, 61, 26, 64, in openinground play of the $325,000 World Championship Tennis Challenge Cup last night.

title: Letters Acts of Affirmation
description: To THE HOME SECTION:

title: Recalling Iranians, Indians  Friends
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.  This past month has been painful for me. My dreams are full of faces nearly forgotten  Moslem faces  faces from Iran, from Hyderabad and Lucknow.

title: Rev. Arthur Shea, 84; Fordham Prep Teacher Had a 40Year Career
description: The Rev. Arthur Vincent Shea, a Jesuit teacher and dean of boys at Fordham Preparatory School in the Bronx for 40 years, died yesterday at St. Joseph's Hospital in Yonkers after a long illness. He was 84 years old.

title: Art Dealers Revel in Boom From Amulets to Photographs
description: Happy days are here again for the artdealing business, in a slump for some years after the recession of 1973. Now, there's a bull market affecting every category of art from ancient Egyptian amulets to Polaroid photographs, and spreading jubilation from the upper reaches 01 Madison Avenue to the wilds of downtown TriBeCa. According to estimates by the Cultural Assistance Center, formed to promote art and culture in the city, art transactions of $1.6 billion will have taken place this year among leading galleries in New York City, generally acknowledged now as the world's sales center for modern art. And those who sell it give highly upbeat individual reports.

title: Duke Five Crushes Princeton by 8145
description: DURHAM, N.C., Dec. 5 (AP)  Unbeaten Duke, helped by Mike Gminski's 17 points, routed Princeton, 8145, in college basketball tonight and raised its record to 40.

title: Shipping/Mails Outgoing
description: SAILING TODAY

title: NBC Reworks Lineup
description: NBCTV announced midseason changes in its primetime schedule yes terday. They involve five new pro grams  three comedies and two con temporary, or real life, comedy dramas  and three cancellations, two of them detective dramas.

title: U.S. ENVOY RESUMES HIS DUTIES IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 5  The United States Ambassador returned here today after an absence of two months during which the Carter Administration announced retaliatory moves against Chile on charges that it had refused to cooperate in the investigation of the 1976 assassination of a Chilean exile in Washington.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Companies

title: Sonia Delaunay, Artist, 94, Dies; Influenced 1920's Fabric Designs
description: Sonia Delaunay, one of the foremost painters of her day and one of the last survivors of the Parisian art world before 1914, died yesterday in Paris. She was 94 years old.

title: Guitarist: Jay Rothman
description: JAY ROTHMAN, a guitarist from Denver who has performed here previously, came to Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night to play a program that consisted chiefly of 20thcentury music. On the face of it this was a laudable idea, but because Mr. Rothman had assembled works by composers who could scarcely be said to represent either the modernity or the vitality of this century's music, the program was not successful. It failed not only to arouse interest in the composers whose works were performed but also to elicit from Mr. Rothman performances of expressive impact.

title: Carter Held Strong in Minnesota As Party Prepares for Caucuses
description: ST. PAUL, Dec. 5 President Carter appears to be in a very strong position as activity is stepped up for February's precinct caucuses in Vice President Mondale's home state.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: IF you have old steel or aluminum windows, you may find that needed replacement parts are no longer manufactured.
