title: Post Trounces Molloy
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I., Dec. 8  Patrice Walker tallied 21 points and grabbed 12 rebounds to lead C.W. Post women's basketball team to a 7555 victory over host Molloy College last night.

title: Gas Lines Form and Hotels Fill As Travelers Make Their Plans; Longest Lines Since Summer It's Going to Be a Mess
description: Lines of cars formed at many gas stations on Long Island and hotels rooms in Manhattan began to get scarce yesterday as commuters made their plans for getting to work tomorrow without the strikebound Long Island Rail Road.

title: For an Aging Jock, Soul on Ice Forever; Intimations of Ferocity The Mean Pelican
description: THE leaves are gone, the winds are blowing and winter's gray skies are here. I reflect on summer; gin and tonic, women in bathing suits and not wearing a tie to work. It's getting colder, darker and the weather is rotten. But I don't mind one bit. It's hockey season.

title: The Giving Game; Charity
description: CHARITY has not been spared the ravages inflation. Driven out of current usage by rampant wordpuffery, it survives, just barely, in Section 501 (c) (3) of the United States Tax Code, where it animates the peculiarly American tradition of voluntary generosity.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS; Taylor Branch
description: Taylor Branch

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THE long golden days of outdoor living have been eclipsed by dark and cold, and the action, unless you are getting ready for iceboating and slippery days on the Expressway, has moved indoors. It is the season for dinner parties, for rearranging the clothes closets, for breeding tropical fish, for crocheting, for pulling together the stamp collection, for making model boats.

title: Millicent Fenwick Remembers
description: BERNARDSVILLE COME Jan. 1, and Representative Millicent Fenwick of the Fifth Congressional District again will be New Jersey's only female legisator in Washington, a role she has held since Helen Mevner's defeat in 1978.

title: Bristol Hits the Big League in Sports TV; SPORTS Sports TV Station Strikes Gold
description: By PARTON KEESE

title: Houston; ...Houston Has All Those Cars
description: HOUSTON  In its role as energy consumer, Houston has some cause for reassurance. Its historic attachment to natural gas as a fuel for heating homes and generating electricity is its big advantage relative to the Northeast. Natural gas is not only far less expensive than oil, it is supplied almost totally from wells within the United States. No threat of a cutoff or largescale price increase exists.

title: Sarah Coffin to Be Bride Jan. 13
description: Sarah Douglas Coffin, an assistant vice president with Sotheby Parke Bernet, and George Klebnikov, director of Interpretation Services at the United Nations, will be married on Jan. 13 at the Russian Orthodox Cathedral on the Lower East Side.

title: JapanChina Meeting Strengthening Economic Ties; Joint Effort on Oil Deposits
description: TOKYO, Dec. 8  Relations between Japan and China are expected to grow warmer and more fruitful for both countries following discussions in Peking this week between Prime Minister Masayoshi Ohira and Hua Guofeng, the Chinese Prime Minister and Communist Party chief.

title: Britain Moves Indirectly to Slow Trade with Iran; Effect of British Move
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 8Lord Carrington, Britain's Foreign Minister, has sent Iran what he calls an Oriental message, delaying deliveries of spare parts and other goods as a mark of displeasure, it was learned today.

title: Own Woods? 'How to Do It' Help Is Free; 'How to Do It' Help for Woodlands Owners
description: There are almost 300,000 private owners of forest land in the state and an estimated 50,000 of them live in New York City, according to James P. Lassoie, assistant professor of natural resources and forestry extension at Cornell University in Ithaca.

title: Ore Freighters Granted More Time To Ply the Great Lakes in Winter
description: SAULT STE. MARIE, MICH., Dec. 8 The locks on the St. Marys River here will be closed Jan. 8, plus or minus a week, under a compromise between the state of Michigan and the Army Corps of Engineers that gives freighters a few extra weeks to carry iron ore between the mines on Lake Superior and the steel mills on Lakes Michigan and Erie.

title: How to Be a Holiday Loser
description: FARMINGTON N Nov. 20, two days before Thanksgiving, the participants in the Weight Control Program at the University of Connecticut Health Center met to plot a defensive plan for the calorieladen holiday season.

title: Rusk Backs ReElection of Carter And Assails Kennedy's Character
description: ATHENS, Ga., Dec. 8 (AP)  Former Secretary of State Dean Rusk endorsed President Carter for reelection today and said Mr. Carter's chief rival for the Democratic Presidential nomination, Senator Edward M. Kennedy, was unqualified for the Presidency.

title: Therapy Is Closer to Home; Outreach Program Offers Chemotherapy
description: SMITHTOWN NANCY DENTON remembers being sick every day for two months in the back seat of the car as her mother drove home to Port Jefferson from Memorial Hospital in Manhattan, where Miss Denton was being treated for Hodgkin's disease.

title: DINING OUT; An Original Off to a Promising Start
description: RESTAURANT BRIAN in Oyster Bay shows what can be done with a little imagination. The exterior retains the unmistakable look of a 1930's bar with its glass brick front. Instead of neon beer signs in the windows, the garish pink logo, Brian, serves as a beacon over the door.

title: Small PrizeWinning Newspaper Getting Back to Normal; A Problem but Flattering Purely a Local Story
description: POINT REYES STATION, Calif., Dec. 8 (AP)  The Point Reyes Light, a Pulitzer Prizewinning newspaper, is still down the road a piece from Toby's Feed Barn. Snapshots of smiling children clutching their prize zucchini still grace I, its front page. Right alongside are articles about Synanon.

title: SAVING A SPACE WITH GRACE; Design
description: To divide the loft without destroying its spaciousness, the designer used platforms that raise the living room (inset, right) and the studio to windowsill height; the kitchen

title: GARDENING; Care and Feeding of the Poinsettia
description: HAVE you noticed that poinsettias are much more rugged than they used to he? There once was a time when it was considered an achievement to be able to notse one through the holiday season without having it drop all its leaves.

title: KEY SEOUL DISSIDENT, RELEASED BY REGIME, ASKS AN EARLY VOTE; Rival of Park in 1971 Election Bids Government Honor Promise 68 Others Given Freedom No Reason to Delay Some Still Held Under Other Laws Foe of Regime, Freed in Seoul, Asks Early Election
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 8  Kim Dae Jung, a South Korean dissident whose challenges to the Government were taken so seriously that he once was kidnapped by agents in Tokyo and returned here, was released from house arrest today, and 68 students and other dissidents were released from prison.

title: Woman Rabbi Sees A Long Way to Go
description: ELIZABETH IN JUNE 1972, Sally Priesand was ordained by the Hebrew Union CollegeJewish Institute of Religion in Cincinnati, thus becoming the first female rabbi in the United States. Last August, Rabbi Priesand took the pulpit at Congregation Beth El on North Avenue here.

title: An Elderly Woman Not Quite Alone
description: A small woman with softly waved blond hair sat in a corner at the Brooklyn Bureau of Community Service, wearing a bright green dress and brown suede shoes. She was 79 years old, but her cheerful, youthful look dis guised her recent medical and emotional difficulties.

title: LONG ISLAND JOURNAL
description: WEDNESDAY is the night for the Long Island Tourism Commission's second annual presentation of the Long Island Heritage Awards, given for outstanding contributions to the preservation of the Island's historic and cultural heritage.

title: The Lawyer Lobby Moves And Shakes NoFault Bill; A Dilemma for a Key Lawmaker
description: TRENTON  When Governor Byrne's attempt to overhaul New Jersey's automobile insurance system was nearly totaled in the Senate Labor Committee last week, it may have been a classic example of what can happen when lobbyists are at the wheel.

title: Passions & Perils An Anxious Washington Studies the Fever in Islam
description: WASHINGTON  Excited by broadcasts of the Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini's charges, thousands of chanting Libyans marched from Green Square, the traditional starting point for antiAmerican demonstrations in Tripoli, last week. They streamed down side streets to the United States Embassy where they battered down the front door as officials escaped by another exit. Once inside, the mob burned the lower floors.

title: Thailand Faces Hard Choices on Cambodia
description: Bangkok Last Week Cracked Down on Minor Warlords

title: Some Tenants Snap Up Coops At Discount Price; Some Tenants Snap Up Coops at Discount
description: At 600 West End Avenue a tenant bought his twobedroom apartment as a cooperative for $18,000  although the apartment is worth about $125,000 on the open market.

title: Marriage Announcement 3  No Title
description: Mari Normyle Is Engaged

title: How the State's Highest Court Reaches Decisions
description: LAST Sept. 10, seven men attired in black robes assembled in a windowless room on the fourth floor of the State House Annex in Trenton. The room was the robing room of the State Supreme Court, and the day marked the first oral arguments for the court under Chief Justice Robert N. Wilentz.

title: Islanders Rout Maple Leafs, 61; Surprisingly, the Islanders Led
description: TORONTO, Dec. 8  How to tell when a hockey team emerges from slump: A hot goaltender stops 34 of 35 shots, each defenseman gives a solid effort, and all four offensive lines contribute to the scoring.

title: Despite U.S. Nudges, Solar Energy Moves Slowly; Beyond Oil Renewable Sources of Energy Despite Federal Nudge, Solar Energy Moves Slowly Want Shift to Deuterium We've Grown Fast Within a Greenhouse Picking Economical Method
description: Last May the White House unveiled a showcase solar energy installation designed to supply 44 percent of the hot water used in the West Wing. Although the system cost more than $40,000, the solar lobby was ecstatic because the engineers had calculated that if such equipment qualified for tax credits, it would pay for itself in less than seven years.

title: NEW JERSEY JOURNAL
description: LAST month, a New York City court toyed with, and then discarded, the idea of trying simultaneously two men before two different juries in the same courtroom. The men were accused of murder.

title: Should the Public Take Over Lilco?
description: WESTCHESTERCounty's recent Proposition 1 for the study of alternatives to Con Ed went down on Election Day in the face of a $1.2 million campaign. Even without substantial favorable public education, the proposition still garnered 45 percent of the vote, a fairly impressive showing. Is the idea of a utility option relevant to the Island?

title: Museum Takes Funnies; Rather Seriously
description: PORT CHESTER FLASH Gordon, Snuffy Smith, Pogo and the other former or present regulars of the Sunday funnies are nothing to joke about at the Museum of Cartoon Art here, where comic strips and cartoons are serious subjects.

title: Michael Anania, Lawyer, To Wed Sheryl D. Hirsh
description: Mr. and Mrs. Warren I. Hirsh have announced the engagement of their daughter, Sheryl Diane Hirsh, to Michael Lewis Anania, son of Mr. and Mrs. A. Michael Anania Jr. of Geneva, N.Y. Plans have been made for a wedding next summer.

title: Lehigh's Eleven Reaches N.C.A.A. Division Final; E. Kentucky 33, Reno 30
description: MURRAY, Ky., Dec. 8 (AP)  Rich Andres ran for one touchdown and passed 9 yards to Mark Yeager for the clincher as Lehigh defeated Murray State, 289, in a National Collegiate Division IAA semifinal playoff today.

title: WouldBe Suicides Cautioned
description: BOURNE, Mass., Dec. 8 (AP)  Two bridges over the Cape Cod Canal have become such popular suicide spots that four billboards have been set up to urge the desperate to seek help. The signs at both ends of the Bourne and Sagamore bridges urge potential jumpers to call a suicide prevention group in nearby Falmouth.

title: Adele Pierce Married to Michael Raymaley
description: Adele Ladensack Pierce, daughter of Mrs. Norman Pierce of Middlebury, Vt., and the late Mr. Pierce, was married yesterday to Michael Edwin Raymaley, son of Dr. E. R. Raymaley of Plattsburgh, N.Y., and Mrs. Ellsworth R. Jackstadt of Lake Placid. N.Y. The Episcopal ceremony was performed in the Mead Chapel of Middlebury College by the chaplain, the Rev. Charles P. Scott.

title: Chemotherapy: Liquid Surgery
description: Advocates of chemotherapy say that surgery alone fails to cure most cancer, which by the time the main tumor is detected has spread or metastasized to other areas of the body through the bloodstream or lymph canals. Because of this, anywhere from 10 to 80 percent of patients who have undergone surgery only will experience a recurrence of the disease.

title: LETTER TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR; Employee of SACIA On Loan to Agency
description: This is to request that you correct the statement, appearing in the article on the work of the Commission on Housing Problems in Southwestern Connecticut [Assessing Fairfield County's Housing Bind) in last Sunday's edition, that I am an employee of Champion International on loan to the commission.

title: Borg and Connors Gain World Cup Final; Vitas, Mayer Beat Aussies; Miss Barker Triumphs
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 8 (UPI)  Bjorn Borg and Jimmy Connors scored victories in the World Championship Tennis Challenge Cup semifinal matches today and will meet tomorrow in the final of the world's richest tournament.

title: Campaigning India Premier Calls Mrs. Gandhi a Hungry Tigress
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 8 (Reuters)Prime Minister Charan Singh and the opposition Janata Party led attacks on former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi today as the Indian election campaign warmed up.

title: ExSpeaker McCormack, Citing  Leadership, Endorses Kennedy
description: BOSTON, Dec. 8 (AP)  Former Speaker of the House John W. McCormack today endorsed Senator Edward M. Kennedy for the Democratic nomination for President, Mr. Kennedy's campaign office announced.

title: OiltoCoal Shift Begun by Utility In New England; Cheaper Electricity Seen, With Fuel Import Slash
description: SOMERSET, Mass., Dec. 5  The nation's first major shift from oil to coal began here this week with bulldozers pushing mounds of coal onto conveyor belts at New England's largest electrical generating plant.

title: Janine A. Wolf Will Be Bride Of J.T. Hill 3d
description: Janine A. Wolf, a vice president of Salomon Bros., and James Tomilson Hill 3d, a first vice president and director of the merger and acquistion group of Smith Barney, Harris Upham & Company, will be married Feb. 2 in St. James Episcopal Church in Manhattan.

title: FILM VIEW; Reveling in; Unembarrassed; Trash
description: There are several kinds of movie ads I can't resist. They're so compelling that I've not even finished reading them before I'm standing in front of the box office asking  nay, rudely demanding  that the ticketseller take my money. The most surefire is the SEE ad, the one that inventories all of the terrifying/spectacular/unbelievable/incredible things I will SEE if I rush right out to a theater that is not always near me: earthquakes, tidal waves, infernos, lions dining on Christians, worlds in collision, unnatural twoheaded monsters (as opposed, I guess, to the more common, natural twoheaded monsters). Since producer Joe Levine went highclass to make films like A Bridge Too Far, we don't see as many of these ads as we once did.

title: Kibbee Asks Increase In State Share to Save Community Colleges; Statements Are Studied One Option Is to Close
description: Dr. Robert J. Kibbee, the Chancellor of the City University of New York, has asked the Koch administration to join with the university in asking the state to assume greater financial responsibility for the university's nine community colleges.

title: Peter Haas Fiance Of Laura B. Myers
description: Dr. and Mrs. Jerome Myers of Amherst, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Laura Beth Myers, to Peter Jay Haas, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter H. Haas of Harrison, N.Y. Plans have been made for a wedding in May.

title: Rebels in Azerbaijan Bar Governor From Gaining Access to Statehouse; Two Planes From Teheran Barred
description: TABRIZ, Iran, Dec. 8  Supporters of Ayatollah Kazem ShariatMadari in this center of Iran's large Azerbaijani minority repulsed the provincial governor today when he attempted to regain control of his statehouse and barred the landing of two planes reportedly carrying troops loyal to the Teheran regime.

title: CRIME; Author's Query
description: By Newgate Callendar

title: What's Doing in VENICE
description: THE QUIET MONTHS  From now until Easter, as at no other time of year, Venice belongs to the Venetians.

title: $98 Million in Back Wages Paid To HalfMillion Workers in 1979
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP)  Employers paid a record $98.7 million in back wages in the fiscal year 1979 to more than a half a million workers who were underpaid in violation of Federal law, the Labor Department has reported.

title: Timothy Spurr And Miss Ault Will Be Wed
description: Mrs. George Gilmer Meredith of Palm Beach, Fla., and Bromwell Ault Jr. of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Leslie Cameron Ault, to Timothy Lynn Spurr, son of Mr. and Mrs. Reuben Edson Spurr of West Palm Beach, Fla. The wedding is planned for Jan. 12 in Palm Beach.

title: Operetta: Penzance
description: It was just 100 years ago this month that The Pirates of Penzance was given its world premiere in New York. To celebrate the anniversary, one of the most prominent local purveyors of Gilbert and Sullivan operettas  the tireless members of the Village Light Opera Group have mounted a joyous, eyefilling production of the work that is, quite simply, irresistible. It is being presented at the Fashion Institute Theater.

title: Will Races Be at Odds In the 80's?; Racial Relations: Signs for the 80's
description: ALTHOUGH New Jersey has not been plagued with crossburnings, as Long Island has in recent months, it has not been without outward signs of racial uneasiness.

title: Pine Replacing Spruce as State ResidentsChristmas Favorite
description: NOT too long ago, a spruce Colorado blue or Norway was the favorite Christmas tree of those New Jersey residents who preferred a tree freshly cut from the hills and fields of a tree farm to one cut in mid or late November and then hauled in from Canada or Maine for retail sale.

title: Health Bill Strategy Unites; Candidates Carter and Long Going Beyond the Catastrophic
description: WASHINGTON  Over the last several weeks, loose partnership has evolved on Capitol Hill that could have an important effect on the politics of 1980. One partner is Jimmy Carter; the other is Senator Russell B. Long, chairman of the Finance Committee. They share a desire to see a national health insurance bill enacted in time for both of them to use the issue in their reelection campaigns.

title: Three Novels; THE FIRST LADY
description: THE FIRST LADY

title: Alison Howard, Designer, Wed
description: In St. James Episcopal Church yesterday afternoon, Alison Barr Howard, daughter of Mrs. David Muss of New York and Frank Atherton Howard Jr. of Tuxedo Park, N.Y., became the bride of Robert Mark Blumenfeld, son of M. E. Blumenfeld of Savannah, Ga., and the late Helen Davidson Blumenfeld. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Hays H. Rockwell.

title: JOURNEY TO TIBET: HIDDEN SPLENDORS OF AN EXILED DEITY
description: When the Dalai Lama fled the holy city of Lhasa after the abortive rebellion against the Chinese in 1959, he left behind some of the world's most priceless relics. These exclusive pictures of the sacred temples of the City of Sun reveal some of the extraordinary treasures concealed in the shrines. Photographs by Audrey Topping.

title: Choo, Choo...Choo...Choo...Ch...C...
description: The Metroliner. It was conceived in 1962, hit the rails in 1969 under the aegis of the Penn Central Railroad and is Amtrak's allfirstclass answer to yearnings for the good old days of efficient but genteel train travel.

title: FollowUp on the News; Vanishing Vulture Medieval Project Training Drinkers
description: Warning that it may already be too late, the Federal Fish and Wildlife Service announced a program last June to save the California condor from extinction. Only 30 of the vultures were left, the agency estimated. It said it would trap and breed four in captivity.

title: Top 2YearOlds Picked By Trotting Association
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 8 (AP) Unbeaten Niatross has been named the top 2yearold pacing colt of 1979. Niatross was the unanimous choice in the United States Trotting Association's annual poll of 237 racing secretaries and harnessracing writers that was announced today.

title: TWINS REARED APART: A LIVING LAB
description: When identical twins James Arthur Springer and James Edward Lewis were reunited last February, after spending all but the first four weeks of their 39 years apart, they discovered that, despite the long separation, their lives had

title: A Second Firefighter Dies on L.I. 2 Weeks After Synagogue Blaze
description: EAST MEADOW, L.I., Dec. 8 (AP) The death toll has risen to two following a fire in a Valley Stream synagogue on Thanksgiving Day, the Nassau County police said today.

title: Shipping/Mails; Outgoing
description: SAILING TODAY

title: IN THE NATION SALT On the Verge
description: WASHINGTON, Dec.7  The decision by Majority Leader Robert Byrd to delay the Senate's SALT II debate until next year means that he doesn't have the votes in hand or in sight; the arms limitation treaty is on the verge of defeat or of oblivion. Either way, national security will be the loser.

title: Other World Events; Le Canard l'Accuse; Deal Goes Awry; Curbing the Unions
description: Like the man who felt as if he were being nibbled to death by ducks, French President Valery Giscard d'Estaing was nipped again last week by Le Canard Enchain. The Paris investigative weekly, which in English means the shackled duck, printed a photocopy of a letter purporting to show that Mr. Giscard d'Estaing, as President, received gifts diamonds from JeatlBedel Bokassa, the nowdeposed ruler of the Central African Republic. Responding to earlier charges from Le Canard, the French leader had said he received the gifts only before his election.

title: A POULTRY FACILITY FALTERING IN BRONX; Processing Plant, Cited as a Spur to Economy, Has Problems on Labor and Financing
description: A large poultry processing plant in the South Bronx, hailed a little more than a year ago as a key element in efforts to spur an economic resurgence there, has run into difficulties.

title: U.N. Completes 5 Years of Work On Women's Rights Agreement
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 8 (AP)  The United Nations Social Committee completed an agreement on international women's rights, ending five years of work on the project, and sent it to the General Assembly for approval.

title: Boston; Boston Has Big Oil Bills, But ...
description: BOSTON  Each morning Frank Keefe, a 33yearold urban planning consultant, begins his daily commute from an outlying neighborhood to downtown Boston with a oneblock walk to a subway station for a fourmile ride into the heart of this 349yearold city.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The Nobel Peace Prize winner in Calcutta

title: Fear and Uncertainty Stalk L.I.'s Iranians; Fear and Uncertainty Stalk L.I.'s Iranians
description: FOR the thousands of Iranians living on the Island, the weeks following the takeover of the United States Embassy in Teheran have been a time of anger, fear and uncertainty.

title: ABOUT CARS; Answering the Mail
description: WITH the continuing uncertainty about gasoline shortages, sales of dieselfueled cars are growing by the day. And for owners of these vehicles, the coming of cold weather can signal problems that are in many ways different from those faced by drivers whose cars have conventional power plants.

title: Joan Balfe Fiancee Of James Northrup
description: The Rev. and Mrs. Robert Stanhope Balfe of Seminole, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Joan Marilyn Balfe, to James Pearson Northrup, son of Dr. and Mrs. Herbert Roof Northrup of Haverford, Pa. The wedding will take place on Dec. 29.

title: American Jockeys Triumph; Came From Far Back
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec.8  Thanks to Jorge Velasquez, the American team swept to a 9372 victory over a European team in the first International Jockey Challenge series tonight at Meadowlands Race Track.

title: Penney Store Evacuated in Fire
description: BAY SHORE, L.I., Dec. 8 (AP)  Hundreds of holiday shoppers were evacuated from a J. C. Penney department store in the South Shore Mall here today when a fire broke out in a storage room. Although firemen had to push shoppers out of the way to get to the fire, no one was hurt. Officials said a circuit breaker box was suspected as the origin of the fire but an investigation was continuing.

title: Aces Team Has a 130Point Lead At Midpoint in Memphis Bridge; Chicagoans Lose in Semifinal Winners Gain 11 Points
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 8  Two of the country's topranked contract bridge teams battled here this afternoon for the right to represent the United States in the 1980 world team championships. Favored by most observers was an Aces team of reigning and former world champions that has dominated the national tournament scene for the last year.

title: The Pros and Cons Of the State D. E. P.
description: WE HAVE past messes to clean up, present messes to regulate and future messes to prevent, says Diana Graves, conservation chairman of the New Jersey chapter of the Sierra Club.

title: The World; An Abrupt Switch; Gives a Hardliner; The Helm in Dublin
description: Condemning the violence of the Provisional Irish Republican Army, Ireland's Prime Ministerdesignate said last week, I regard the peaceful unification of the people of Ireland as my primary priority.

title: ManagementLabor Clash Is Old Stop on L.I.R.R.
description: The Long Island Rail Road, which carries onefourth of all the people in the United States who travel to and from their jobs by commuter railroad, has had a history of frequent conflict between management and labor during the last two decades. The conflict resulted in two long strikes, several briefer work stoppages and a number of slowdowns.

title: Refugee Says Cambodians Deport Ethnic Chinese; Family Home Vandalized
description: KHAOlDANG, Thailand, Dec. 5  A woman who escaped from Phnom Penh last month reported in a refugee camp here that the Vietnamesesupported Cambodian Government was deporting ethnic Chinese residents of the capital to remote mountain areas.

title: TV: Nile Is Studied By Costeau
description: Having exhausted, as it were, the resources of the oceans by overfishing with his underwater cameras, Jacques Cousteau has in recent years been returning to the land and its lakes and rivers.

title: The Nation; The Politicians; Take Time Out; For Regrouping
description: In Summary

title: Cowboys Defeat Eagles by 2417; Cowboys Won 2d Half
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8.  Apart from known skills, chance, risk and luck still play a part in pro football. Is that not true, Tom Landry? Of course, replied Landry, the coach of the Dallas Cowboys, who was smiling today after his team beat the Philadelphia Eagles on chance and skill.

title: He May Hold the Drosselmeyer Record; He May Hold the; Drosselmeyer Record
description: Through the years, Shaun O'Brien's portrayal of Drosselmeyer, the kindly but mysterious bearer of gifts in the New York City Ballet's Nutcracker, has become almost as much of a Christmas tradition as the production itself. And because that time of year is upon us again, both Mr. O'Brien and Nutcracker are now very much on view at the New York State Theater where they will remain through the holiday season.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
description: Jeanne Elizabeth Grant to Wed

title: Ann H. Brinckerhoff, a Nurse, Is Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard Fowler Brinckerhoff of Exeter, N.H., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ann Hamilton Brinckerhoff, to M. Scott Mingledorff, son of Mr. and Mrs. Marvin S. Mingledorff of Pass Christian, Miss. A wedding is planned in April.

title: Toy Inventor Turns To Christmas 1981; LONG ISLANDERS
description: WHILE Long Island youngsters and their parents are thinking about toys they intend to buy for Christmas 1979, Julius Cooper of New Hyde Park is thinking about the toys he hopes they buy for the 1981 Christmas season.

title: Publishers Expect Libel Decision To Have ChillingRepercussions; Spur to Suits Held Possible
description: Publishers, authors and lawyers say that a libel award that was allowed stand this week will, at least temporarily, have a chilling effect on novelists, playwrights and scenarists all over the enuntry.

title: Ski Resorts Plan More New Homes; Ski Resorts Planning More New Homes
description: Ski resorts in the metropolitan region may not inspire images of Colorado or Vermont, but they do share at least one similarity to their larger counterparts: they have become magnets for real estate development.

title: Film Makers Charge Harassment
description: THE concern over contaminated drinking water is the subject of a 60minute documentary film, Aquis Mortis, being produced by Meg Switzergable of Princeton with funds from the Center for the Analysis of Public Issues.

title: A 36Story Building Proposed In Busy Development Area; A 36Story Tower Proposed
description: George Klein, the developer who now completing a 25story office tower at 499 Park Avenue at 59th Street, planning to erect a 36story skyscraper on the northeast corner of Madison Avenue and 54th Street.

title: Soviet Plans Kuril Maneuvers
description: TOKYO, Dec. 8 (Reuters)  The Japanese Maritime Safety Agency said today that the Soviet Union planned firing drills from Dec. 11 to 15 in the waters south and north of Iturup Island, one of the Kuril Islands claimed by Japan, the Maritime Safety Agency reported today.

title: Letters; On Atriums
description: To the Editor:

title: When She Sings, the Lyric Has to Matter
description: MASSAPEQUA I WAS the youngest of five girls, Barbara Lynn of Oceanside said recently, and I had to convince my family to let me take music lessons because my four older sisters had all had them and done nothing with them. Some 30 years later, Miss Lynn entertains an attentive public five to six nights a week playing piano and singing, and is herself a music teacher.

title: A Guide To Sources Of Help
description: Originally, J. L. Barkas intended simply to compile an appendix to her book, Victims, that would guide readers to sources of help. But as a child grows taller than its parents, the appendix to the 250page volume became a separate work of 667 pages.

title: Barbara J. Griffin To Marry in June
description: The engagement of Barbara Joan Griffin to Alexander H. Roberts, son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael A. Roberts of Upper Brookville, L.I., and Palm Beach, Fla., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert T. Griffin of Nanuet, N.Y.

description: Following are emergency telephone information services set up in the Long Island Rail Road strike:

title: The Trenton School Takeover
description: A COLLECTIVE sigh of relief was heard in Trenton on Nov. 8. It arose as a result of a decision by the state's Board of Education to appoint a monitorgeneral for the public schools in the state capital.

title: Old Formula Is Upheld: Be Happy, Live Longer
description: BOSTON, Dec. 8 (UPI)  Men who are happy with their jobs, marriages and leisure time enjoy longer, healthier lives than men who are not, according to a 40year study of mental and physical adjustment.

title: A Christmas Appeal: Give to The Neediest Cases Fund; The 68th Appeal
description: The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund was established in 1912 by the late Adolph S. Ochs, then publisher of The Times. That year, 117 contributors donated a total of $3,630.88 to be distributed among three private socialservice agencies.

title: The Region; Koch Decides Two; Heads Are Needed; For the Hospitals; Mortgage Rate; Rise Must Wait; The Right to Die; Approved by Court; New London; Gets a Black Mayor; Jail for Youths; Alarms Brentwood; Love Canal Suit; Has New Targets
description: In Summary

title: THE MARKETS; Another 10Point Week
description: Stock prices continued to move ahead last week as the Dow Jones industrials posted a gain of 10.84 points to finish at 833.19. The previous week's advance was 10 points.

title: Behind the Scenes; With Carter's Team
description: States News Service

title: Food; BRING BACK CHOCOLATE ECLAIRS
description: BRING BACK CHOCOLATE ECLAIRS

title: Sue Snyder Is Affianced To Edwin E. F. Stebbins
description: John A. Snyder of Darien, Conn., has announced the engagement of his daughter, Sue Wilds Snyder, to Edwin Ellis Flood Stebbins, son of Mrs. Andrew M. Blum of New York and James Flood Stebbins of Muttontown. L.I.

title: Kissinger's Failures
description: PARIS  In the controversy that has followed publication of Henry A. Kissinger's memoirs, perhaps no one has said what one might think obvious: that Mr. Kissinger was ultimately a failure as Secretary of State.

title: Moscow Tilts Toward Qum
description: Until a month ago, Ayatollah Khomeini inveighed against the Soviet Union as second in satanism only to the United States. He and his followers castigated Communism as impious and criticized Soviet arms support for a war against Islamic tribesmen in neighboring Afghanistan. And when the student mob invaded the American Embassy in Teheran, Iran's Council of Ministers was formally abrogating two treaties of friendship  one with Washington, the other with Moscow.

title: Carter Gains on Kennedy in a Poll
description: President Carter continues to gain strength against Senator Edward M. Kennedy in a hypothetical runoff for the Democratic Presidential nomination, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: WESTCHESTER HOUSING; Leaf Composting Goes Big Time
description: HOMEOWNERS are now saying goodbye to the last of the autumn leaves that hid the lawn. But for some of them, those particular leaves are gone but not forgotten, and will be back next spring or the one after that.

title: Mari Andriessen, Dutch Sculptor Who Designed War Monuments
description: HAARLEM, the Netherlands, Dec. 8 (Reuters)  Mari Andriessen, a sculptor whose works included some of the Netherlands bestknown war monuments, died at his home here during the night at the age of 82. his family said.

title: Chinese Ask Urban Crime Effort
description: PEKING, Dec. 8 (Reuters)  A conference of more than 900 lawyers, judges and senior policemen has called for greater efforts against murder, robbery, rape and arson in Chinese cities, the New China News Agency reported today.

title: Some Are Less Incompetent Than Others; Conductors
description: THERE is a sense in which it is true to say that there are no great conductors, only great orchestras. It is a sense best understood, course, by orchestra musicians, whose generally low regard for conductors is a symphonic tradition. However, it is also true that a few conductors somehow manage to achieve secular sainthood and count their annual blessings in six figures. Even orchestra musicians, if pressed, will concede that certain conductors are less incompetent than others. So, a few in every

title: Hollywood Is Banking On the Comics
description: Live actors, not animators, will populate the many new films to be based on cartoon heroes.

title: Columbia Is Beaten In Soccer; Charles Averts Shutout
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 8  Clemson coasted to a 41 victory over Columbia after Southern IllinoisEdwardsville struggled to beat Penn State, 21, today in the semifinals of the National Collegiate soccer tournament at Tampa Stadium.

title: Advocate Pressing; WasteDisposal Suit
description: TRENTON THE Department of the Public Advocate is scheduled to file a brief with the Appellate Division of the state's Superior Court tomorrow in a suit in which it charges that the Department of Environmental Protection has failed to control statewide storage methods and landfill operations involving hazardous wastes.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide; Theater Recent Openings Bent
description: Richard Gere, David Dukes and David Marshall Grant in a play by Martin Sherman about the relationship between two homosexuals, set in Berlin in the first act and in a Nazi concentration camp in the second. Walter Kerr: Strong material ; strong performing; dramatic blows do not often strike with this force. But we  re coping with a second act that doesn  t seem a direct descendant of the first, and our interest waivers somewhat. Still, Any serious theatergoer, on the lookout for energy and originality in writing, staging (by Robert Allan Ackerman) and performing would find it necessary to see Bent.  At the New Apollo, 234 W. 43d St. (9218558)

title: Turk Asks Inquiry on U.S. Bases
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 8  A demand was made here this week for a Turkish Senate inquiry into the function and number of American military installations in Turkey, in reaction to rising tensions in the region linked to the crisis in Iran.

title: East, West; Jarvis
description: I HAVEan image in mind from the early 1970's: young man I met who wore the uniform of blue jeans and wirerim glasses. His face was open and trusting, and he carried no money and a silver

title: A Correction
description: Because of a transmission error, Elmer B. Staats, Comptroller General of the United States, was misquoted in an article on the General Accounting Office in last Sunday's Week in Review. Mr. Staats said, You can't avoid stepping on sensitive toes. We're a public critic, hopefully a constructive one.

title: Thomas J. Bryde Fiance Of Elizabeth A. Piccone
description: Elizabeth Anne Piccone and Thomas Joseph Bryde plan to be married June 14.

title: A Master of Words as Well; Mahler
description: IN view of the proliferation of studies about the composer, it is astonishing that Selected Letters of Gustav Mahler proves to be the first book of his correspondence published in English, and all the more surprising because the German edition appeared 55 years ago, 13 years after his death in May 1911. Because Mahler's known letters total some 3,000, we are disappointed with this small sampling of less than a sixth of them, having hoped for the opportunity to discover a complete image of the man as mirrored in his own words. It seems a misplaced piety to reproduce only the same selection sanctioned by Mahler's widow, whose natural subjectivity must have determined what was to be excluded.

title: Animals
Earthquake Hits Sicilian City
description: TRAPANI, Sicily, Dec. 8 (UPI)  A sharp earth tremor centered in the Mediterranean shook this western Sicilian city at 5:07 A.M. today, causing panic but no apparent damage, officials said. Professor Antonio Girlanda of the Geophysical Institute of Messina in Eastern Sicily said the tremor apparently was centered 241 miles west of Messina and measured 5.4 on the Richter scale.

title: COHALAN PROPOSING CHANGES IN SUFFOLK; Says Trend Toward Centralization Should Be ReversedPlans a Larger Role for Towns
description: ISLIP, L.I.  Arguing that the trend toward centralized county government should be reversed, Peter F. Cohalan, the Suffolk County Executiveelect, said his administration would return to the towns functions they can perform more expeditiously, such as road maintenance and snow nlowing.

title: Why the College Bonds Lost
description: THE wellgroomed business and community leaders in the Atlantic City meeting room ap plauded enthusiastically. Even the skeptics had to agree that the charts, slides and presentation had been topnotch. Those staunch supporters of Proposition 13 who attack public spending now leaned into the undecided column. Those who had been undecided now tended to favor the expenditure.

title: Cabell Smith, Jon R. Tower, FilmTV Technicians, Wed
description: Cabell Smith, daughter of Mrs. Ormonde Wilcox of Wingina, Va., and the late Lieut. (j.g.) William F. Smith, U.S.N., was married yesterday to Jon R. Tower, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel A. Tower of New Haven. The ceremony was performed in the First Presbyterian Church in Manhattan by the Rev. John MacNab.

title: FOOD; Where Eggplant Is the Fast Food
description: CEDARHURST CONVENIENCE foods and fast foods, with their preservatives and frequently high fat and sodium contents, are at odds with health foods, natural foods and vegetarian foods. This is not the case, however, at Naturally Delicious in Cedarhurst, where the quick takeout is eggplant and brown rice rather than burgers and fries.

description: THE LITTLE HOUSE COOKBOOK

title: Kennedy Opposes New Gas Tax
description: FORT DODGE, Iowa, Dec. 8 (AP) Senator Kennedy warned the Carter Administration today not to pursue Republican economic policies by seeking a 50centagallon tax on gasoline, as top Presidential advisers have proposed.

title: North Koreans Agree To Hunt for American Missing After a Blast
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 8 (AP)  At the request of the United Nations Command, North Korea helped search today for an American soldier missing after an explosion on the Communist side of the demilitarized zone. The Americandominated command apologized for one and possibly two violations of the 1953 armistice accord.

title: Headliners; Take Away One ...
description: Math can be fun  that was always one of Teacher's first fibs. All by themselves, figures are only figures. But to Herbert Bienstock they were the breath of life, and in consequence Mr. Bienstock became an influential figure in New York from the relatively obscure position of regional head of the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics. In the soaring 60's, Mr. Bienstock warned that New York was heading for a peck of trouble, and was proved right. In the 70's, he has been relatively optimistic about the 80's. Last week he became a labor statistic himself, resigning his job to join the faculty of the City University.

title: ART VIEW; Vivid Word Portraits of the Italian Renaissance
description: A lively writer rather given to anecdote. The condescension is palpable, and if one did not know otherwise, one would suppose the remark had been directed at some smalltime storyteller with an undeservedly large reputation. But this, oddly enough, is the way one recent commentator has characterized Giorgio Vasari (151174), author of the compendious Lives of the Most Eminent Painters,.Sculptors and Architects, that remains  more than four centuries after was written  unrivaled as the single greatest work we have on the artists of the Italian Renaissance.

title: New Kind of Pirate Plies the Seas With a Briefcase and Paintbrush; Banks Are Found Negligent
description: PIRAEUS, Greece  In the last two years more than 100 ships laden with valuable cargoes, plying trade mutes between Europe, Asia and Africa, have disappeared. They are the victims of a new kind of pirate, armed with briefcase and paintbrush, who has seized more than $250 million in cargoes.

title: Hints From a Christmas Tree Decorator
description: MY husband blends well into the gray blur of fellow commuters, a middleaged businessman in Brooks Brothers suit  unassuming good looks trimmed with worry lines. Nothing unusual. But ask him about his Christmas plans, and another man is revealed, along with the secrets of trimming the family tree.

description: By The Associated Press

title: Cape Cod Radar Challengers Lose Round in Court
description: SANDWICH, Mass., Dec. 8  Two Cape Cod environmental groups are considering whether to appeal a decision by Federal judge in Boston to dismiss a suit that they filed against the Air Force missiletracking station, known as Pave Paws, that is situated on the cape.

title: Papermakers Returning To TimeTested Methods
description: Papermakers Returning To Time Tested Methods

title: A State Justice Orders Creation of 750 Beds For Bowery Homeless; Suit Names Carey and Koch
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan has ordered the city and the state to create 750 new beds for the helpless and hopeless men of the Bowery.

title: Seahawks Beat Broncos, 2823; Seahawks March to 43
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 8 (AP)  Jim Zorn lofted a 43yard touchdown pass to Steve Largent with 1 minute 40 seconds to play in the game to give the Seattle Seahawks a 2823 National Football League victory over the Denver Broncos today.

title: Marriage Announcement 2  No Title
description: Mary Susan Landon Betrothed Mr. and Mrs. S. Whitney Landon 3d have made known the engagement of their daughter, Mary Susan Landon, to Peter Alan Riegelman, son of H. Alan Riegelman of Grand Isle, Vt., and Mrs. William J. Cody Jr. of Burlington, Vt. The couple are seniors at the University of Vermont.

title: Cornell Loses in Hockey
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Dec. 8 (AP)  The University of New Hampshire's hockey team rallied in the second period with two goals, and scored two more in the final period to defeat Cornell University, 63, today.

title: Miss Comaneci Has Surgery
description: FORT WORTH, Dec. 8 (UPI)  An American doctor performed surgery to drain fluids from Nadia Comaneci's badly infected left hand today. Officials at AllSaints Hospital said physicians would decide tomorrow how soon the 18yearold Rumanian gymnastic star could go home.

title: Byrd Says Arms Pact Is Very Much Alive And Highest Priority; Alive and Kicking
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8  The Senate majority leader, Robert C. Byrd, said today that contrary to recent pessimistic forecasts, the strategic arms treaty was still very much alive, had the highest legislative priority and would be voted on by the Senate early next year.

title: MUSIC VIEW; Reviving; A Puccini; Operetta MUSIC VIEW; Puccini's; La Rondine
description: he discussion here a few weeks ago about the differ. ences, if any, between opera and musical comedy can be expanded to take in Puccini's La Rondine, which the Juilliard Ameri. can Opera Center will lx presenting on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday. There are those who flatly call it an operetta. But, as with Kurt Weill and Mahagonny, Puccini called it an opera, and here he is hard to argue with. Mahagonny, for instance, has spoken dialogue. Viennese operetta has spoken dialogue. But La Rondine is sung throughout.

title: Paleontology; Making These Bones Live; Three Great Big Beasts; Fins Do Not Make a Fish
description: The Book of Proverbs tells us that the hoary head is a crown of glory. Yet, on Oct. 15, one of the most venerable of all heads suffered the ancient penalty of decapitation. Curators at Pittsburgh's Carnegie Museum removed the familiar head of Brontosaurus and replaced it with a slender skull similar to that carried by Diplodocus, a thinner and more elongate relative of the great thunder lizard.

title: MOSCOW PUBLISHES AN OFFER TO PEKING; Set of Principles Intended to Guide Their Relationship Is Released Coexistence Principles Listed
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 8 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union outlined today its plan for normal relations with China, but early acceptance by Peking looked unlikely.

title: Women Learn How To Be Delegates
description: VALHALLA HY do I want to be a delegate? Jewel Bellush, a political scientist, was speaking at a Westchester Community College workshop on how women enter the political arena, with emphasis on now to become a delegate for either of the 1980 party conventions. Dr. Bellush answered her question: Because I am a woman and because I deserve to be a delegate, she said, and, scanning her audience, added, Go. Do it !

title: Energy; The Federal Mileage Standard; Ain't What It Used to Be; No One Is in Charge, Exactly
description: WASHINGTON  The Carter Administration last week took its first steps toward what eventually may be the means by which the nation deals with gasoline shortages. The Department of Energy issued state allocation targets immediately attacked as even higher than current consumption  and proposed a standby rationing plan that would give each driver about one and a half gallons a day.

title: HOME CLINIC; How to Take Off Those Unsightly TableTop Rings
description: a white ring or watermark on finely finished table top minor disaster that seems to occur all too often at this time of year after friends have stopped by for a holiday drink  can often be successfully removed by the doityourselfer without need for completely stripping the finish off the entire piece, or even off the top.

title: Around the Nation; Congressman Backs Protest In Cleveland Teacher Strike
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 8 (AP)  Demonstrators staging a sitin at the offices of Cleveland's school board to protest a 53dayold teachers strike received support today from a Congressman while talks continued between the board and the teachers union.

description: CHICAGO, Dec. 8  Vice President Mondale did something this week that most national Democratic politicians, especially those running for election or reelection, have not done in a long time. He made fun of the Mayor of Chicago.

description: The Long Island University women's basketball team defeated Brooklyn College, 8743, Friday night at the Schwartz Athletic Center. Leading the attack was Denise Eigner with 18 points.

description: ALBANY, Dec. 8 The New York State Board of Equalization and Assessments this week fixed preliminary 1980 values on agricultural land for tax purposes, signaling the start of another struggle between farmers and the agency.

title: 16 in Old Syphilis Study Missing After Five Years
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 8 (AP)Another deadline is approaching, but the Government still has not tracked down 16 of the 600 black men who are due thousands of dollars in damages for participating in a syphilis study at Tuskegee, Ala.

title: Dance: Posin Company In Premiere of Apache
description: The Kathryn Posin Dance Company is a fitting choice for the final attraction of the Dance Umbrella moderndance festival at Camera Mart/Stage One. Miss Posin has studied, danced and choreographed for some of the leading performers and companies in contemporary dance. Some of the best young moderndance gypsies have performed with her. Her style is a kind of middleoftheroad modern dance, encompassing everything from balletic placement to the glittery visuals of rock acts in one softedged, discontinuous flow.

title: U.S. SENDS TEHERAN PLAN TO END CRISIS AND FREE HOSTAGES; FOREIGN NATIONS RELAY IDEAS Proposal, Newly Drafted by Carter, Suggests World Forum After Iran Releases Hostages
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8  Special representatives of foreign governments have begun to arrive in Iran, seeking to open negotiations on behalf of the United States to win release of 50 Americans in the 35th day of captivity, State Department officials said today.

Honan's article, The Kennedy Network (Nov. 11), I was disturbed to see that the network is composed of an allwhite male conglomerate, with no female and minority representation. Further, references to minority issues were minimal and women's issues were completely ignored.

title: CONNECTICUT HOUSING; Many Turning To Discounters For Lower Fees
description: IS it possible to buy or sell a house with the aid of a licensed real estate salesperson and yet not have to pay  directly or indirectly the full 6 percent commission fee? Absolutely yes. In Connecticut, as elsewhere in the country, more and more discount operations are springing to life, bridging the gap between the fullservice conventional broker and the doityourself, salebyowner approach.

description: FAIRBANKS, ALASKA, Dec. 8  On Tuesday representatives of the major oil companies will gather here in the half light and bitter cold of central Alaska to bid for leases on the nation's most promising unexplored oil lands, a stretch of the North American continental shelf that thrusts into the Arctic Ocean.

title: Bank Robberies Down in City After Summer Surge
description: The New York City Police Department reported yesterday that a combined drive with the Federal Bureau of Investigation, begun after an surge in bank robberies last summer, appeared to have borne fruit. Bank robberies, officials reported, are back to the frequency prevailing before this year's sudden bulge.

description: WATERBURY, Conn., Dec. 7  Environmental officials from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut concluded a twoday conference here today on a note of general agreement undercut by some specific disagreements on implementing Federal clean air standards.

title: NEW JERSEY HOUSING; The Many Lures of Franklin Lakes
description: FRANKLIN LAKES LET'S face it. This Bergen County community, as well as quite few other towns in North Jersey, is a nice place. It has quiet, semirural ambience, yet it is close enough to New York City so that residents need not feel culturally out of touch.

title: Will Giants Chant, 'Gotta Have Hart?'; Beloved by Players
description: Jim Hart, who is not scheduled to play today when the Giants meet the Cardinals in St. Louis, has become the center of attraction, for both teams may want the 36yearold quarterback next season.

title: Palestinian Delegation Is Off to Libya for Talks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 8 (Reuters)  A Palestinian delegation left today for talks in Tripoli with Libyan officials to try to defuse tension between the Palestine Liberation Organization and Libya.

title: Heat Aid Up By 1,000%; Federal Fuel Aid Up Elevenfold Over '78
description: WASHINGTON THE final formula for heating assistance under a new $1.6 billion Federal act will provide lowincome and elderly families in New Jersey with the opportunity for about 11 times as much aid this winter as under last year's modest crisis intervention program.

title: Connecticut Atomic Utility Fined
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 8 (AP)  The Nuclear Regulatory Commission is fining the Connecticut Yankee Atomic Power Company $27,500 for infractions of radiation protection regulations at the Con necticut Yankee nuclear power plant, a spokesman for the plant's management said yesterday.

title: St. Vincent Surppresses ShortLived Rebellion On Isle in Grenadines
description: KINGSTOWN, St. Vincent, Dec. 8 (AP)  Police sent to Union Island in the Grenadines to put down a rebellion have rounded up 19 insurgents, the St. Vincent authorities reported today.

title: Two Classic Plays Move Into Circle Rep Two Classic Plays Move Into Circle Rep
description: This week the Circle Repertory Company will unveil one of the most ambitious doubleheaders the New York theater has seen in many a season. On Wednesday, the Circle's production of Hamlet opens with William Hurt in the title role, followed on Thursday by Friedrich Schiller's Mary Stuart, with Stephanie Gordon as Mary of Scotland and Tanya Berezin as Elizabeth of England. Both plays, using the same company of actors wearing the same basic costumes, have been staged by Marshall Mason, the troupe's artistic director, and will play on the same basic set in rotating repertory over the next two months at the Circle's 160seat theater in Sheridan Square. For a company that has never performed in true rep before and whose solid reputation rests almost exclusively on small, tight productions of new American plays, it appears at first to be a major shift in policy or at the very least a big step in a new direction.

title: Text of Iran Minister's Statement
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 8 (UPI) Following, in an unofficial translation from French, is the text of a statement by Foreign Minister Sadegh Ghotbzadeh announcing plans to form an international board to review charges against the United States and the deposed Shah:

title: Health THE WORLD ACCORDING TO GARLIC
description: In his book on Provence, Ford Madox Ford tells a story that has become famous in the annals of garlic apocrypha. At a party one evening in London he met a beautiful young model who was an excellent cook. But she used such quantities of garlic in cooking that her own strong odor had elicited protests throughout her elegant atelier de couture. Sadly, she had resolved to quit modeling and had gone home to comfort herself with a poulet Bearnais, roast chicken stuffed with a kilo  2.2 pounds  of garhc. Then, fortified, she set out to hand in her resignation. As she buttoned her gloves she kissed an old aunt, whose protests had usually been as clamant as those of her studiomates. The old lady ... merely complimented her on her looks. At the studio, too, there was no outcry, only congratulations on the improvement, if possible, of her skin, her hair, her carriage. ... She had solved the great problem; she had schooled her organs to assimilate, not to protest against, the sacred herb....

title: Thomas Dillon Fiance Of Patricia Ann Hurley
description: Mr. and Mrs. James F. Hurley of Far Hills, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Patricia Ann Hurley, to Thomas Hardin Dillon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney G. Dillon of Oldwick, N.J.

description: NEW BRUNSWICK WELCOME to Rutgers University. Rutgers not old in terms of your country, but it is the eighth oldest university in this country. We hope your stay will be a good one for you and for us.

title: Coast Geophysicist Says Bulge Linked to Quakes Doesn't Exist
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 8 (AP)  The mysterious Palmdale Bulge, which scientists said was a swelling of the ground believed connected to Southern California's earthquakes, apparently does not exist, according to a geophysicist at the University of California at Los Angeles.

title: One Man Remains Hospitalized After Shooting Involving Officer
description: A 24yearold man was in serious condition yesterday in Bellevue Hospital after he was wounded and another man was killed by an offduty police officer who said three men had attempted to rob him on the Lower East Side.

title: Ideas & Trends; The Unthinkable Leaves 11 Dead At Rock Concert
description: The Kids Are Alright sing the Who, one of rock's oldest and most popular bands. But at their Cincinnati concert last week, eleven youths died and at least eight were injured in a stampede of thousands of ticketholders to claim the best unreserved seats in Riverfront Coliseum.

title: JumpersBounce; Into the McCarter
description: PRINCETON THE major characters on the McCarter Theater's stage talk about God, reality and symbolic logic, but five minor characters jump and one polite secretary sits still for two acts.

title: STAGE VIEW; Intimate Monologues That; Speak to the Mind and Heart
description: Until 1963, Joseph Chaikin was best known as an actor, particularly with the Living Theater in such plays as Man Is Man. In that year he founded the Open Theater, which quickly became America's most celebrated performance group. The work was created within the company by an ensemble of actors, writers and composers, although it was clearly Mr. Chaikin who was the orchestrator as well as director of the individual pieces. Using a combination of mime, dance, music, sound and storytelling, the Open Theater presented plays that were both experiential and experimental. They were all formulated around specific motifs  the Book Genesis for The Serpent, death and dying for Terminal, life changes for The Mutation Show, dreams and delusions for Nightwalk.

title: THEORIES EMERGING ON NEPHEW OF SHAH
description: PARIS, Dec. 9  The Paris police said today that a terrorist operating freely in an exclusive residential neighborhood of the city probably was responsible for the assassination of a nephew of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi on Friday.

title: Some Details Of the Strike
description: Following are the issues and other details on the strike by the United Transportation Union against the Long Island Rail Road.

title: Sun Reducing Deliveries
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8 (AP) Citing a mechanical problem at its Marcus Hook refinery, the Sun Company announced temporary delivery cutbacks of as much as 25 percent for some gasoline dealers in the Northeast.

title: G.M. Sees A Mild Downturn
description: DETROIT, Dec. 9 - The American economy is in store for a mild economic downturn during much of 1980 but a rebound will begin late in the year, the General Motors Corporation predicted today. Nevertheless, the giant auto maker is quite gloomy about its own industry.

title: City Deficit Forecasts Termed Short
description: With two days remaining before the Financial Control Board is to consider important modifications of New York City's fouryear financial plan, the special deputy state comptroller for the city has released an audit charging that it has ereatly understated its deficits.

title: Organ: Newman Plays Three Handel Concertos
description: ANTHONY NEWMAN entered into a thorny musicological thicket Saturday night at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Performing on the organ and harpsichord with the Brandenburg Collegiurn, Mr. Newman devoted the evening to Handel, offering three of the composer's organ concertos and a pair of his trio sonatas for two violins and continuo.

title: 9 Are Wounded in Rome As Two Bombs Explode
description: ROME, Dec. 9 (UPI)  Two bombs exploded in the center of Rome tonight, injuring nine people and damaging several offices, including those of Pan American World Airways, British Airways and Phil innine Airlines. the police said.

title: Denver Convention Held By Hispanic Democrats
description: DENVER, Dec. 9 - Hispanic Democrats throughout the country convened here this weekend in what was called the most extensive effort to date to unify Chicanos, Cubans and Puerto Ricans into a politically effective force.

description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Dec. 9  Hubie Brown, coach of the Atlanta Hawks, peeked from the visiting locker room toward the crowd of waiting reporters after his team had routed the Nets tonight, 12285.

title: Destiny of Olympic Facilities in Doubt
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y. Dec. 9  Tens of millions of tax dollars have been spent on building and improving facilities for the Winter Olympics here, but the destiny of the facilities after the games is unknown.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Allegheny Power System Inc., an electricutility holding company, has elected to its board Gordon L. Mills, general managerpensions of the Continental Group.

title: REPUBLICAN APPEARS VICTOR IN LOUISIANA
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 9 Representative David C. Treen apparently won election yesterday as Louisiana's first Republican Governor since Reconstruction. But, saying he was concerned that tampering could erase his 10,000vote margin in the unofficial returns, he ordered campaign workers to keep a roundtheclock watch on voting machines.

title: Two Boys, Rescued From a Fire, Die as They Return to Seek Dog
description: PLANO, Tex., Dec. 9 (UPI)  A man carried his sons to safety from their burning home yesterday, but while he was summoning help the younger child ran back inside to rescue a dog and the older boy followed in an attempt to save his brother's life. Both boys died.

title: The Diplomacy of Exclusion
description: You would think a world that despises South Africa's racism and mistrusts its nuclear ambitions would want to keep that country under the closest scru tiny. Yet a majority of developing and Communist nations, who abhor or fear the South African Government, have just thrown it out of this year's general conference of the International Atomic Energy Agency. Their theory seems to be that efforts to safeguard nuclear power projects will be more effective if confined to nations that like each other.

title: Wendy Holly Love, Executive, Married to Kurt Barnard
description: Wendy Holly Love, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Matthew Love of New York, was married yesterday evening to Kurt Barnard of New York, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Leon BarnardJeserski. Rabbi David Greenberg performed the ceremony in the Grand Ballroom of the Pierre.

title: Deaths
description: ARONOWDavid. The Board of Directors of University Settlement mourns the passing of our esteemed Trustee David Aronow. He had a lifelong devotion to our work with the disadvantaged and for many years he served with distinction as Chairman of the Board, his wisdom and spirit steering the Settlement through one of its most difficult periods. His humanitarianism and his burning concern for social lustice have been an Inspiration to all of vs and serve as an eternal memorial to his good name. We extend our heartfelt sympathy to his wife Rae, his daughter Shirley, and all of his family.CAPPSLeighton D., age 77, of Oradell, N.J., beloved husband of Margaret (nee Tiller). Religious services Tuesday, 1 PM, at the Volk Funeral Home of Oradell, 268 Kinderkmack Road. Interment following, Mt. Hope Cemetery, Hastings, N.Y. Friends may call all day Monday. The family will be present Monday 24 and 79 PM. The family requests donations be made to the American Heart Association, Stroke Research Unit of Bergen County, Englewood, N.J.KAYIrving, beloved husband of Helen. Loving father of Marvin and Edward. Grandfather of Michael, Jonathan, Mandy, Daniel and Cert. Beloved brother of Marsha and Jack. Dear inlaw of Ruth, Frank. Al, Francis and Bettye Ruth. Dear friend of John Arenaro and loving uncle. Services Monday 10am Nieberg Midwood Chapel, Inc., 1625 Coney Island Avenue (corner Avenue M)PROBSTEdward, devoted husband of Jean, adored father of Roger Probst and Fern Kaiden, cherished grandfather of Mindy and Robert. Services Monday. 10:30AM at Gutterman's Nassau Memorial Chapel', Long Beach Road at Greystone, Rockville Centre, LI.WOHLJoseph S. The Jewish people, and good people everywhere, have suffered the tragic loss of a leader whose compassion, wisdom and experience were dedicated to the advancement of every vital human cause. A man of diverse interests and talents, all who knew him mourn his departure as members of his family. Words fail us in expressing our condolence to his loving and beloved wife, Ronne, his precious children, Elinor and Stephen, Nancy and Scott, Vicki and Michael, Larry and Denise, and his darling grandchildren, Ricky and Roddy, Douglas and Dana, Elizabeth, Alissa and Tony. His was a profound understanding of, and devotion to, the Synagogue for the role it played in his daily life and In the history of our people and our faith. His memory will always be a blessing.

title: Iowa Paper Reschedules Debate By G.O.P Hopefuls to Prime Time
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)  The Des Moines Register, responding to criticism voiced by former Gov. John B. Connally of Texas, has decided to reschedule a debate that had been scheduled for the afternoon of Jan. 5 among the Republican Presidential candidates.

title: New Democratic Coalition Endorses Senator Kennedy
description: New Democratic Coalition Endorses Senator Kennedy

title: What Price Chrysler Jobs?
description: As Douglas Fraser makes clear in his letter on this page, the United Auto Workers bitterly oppose any Federal aid for Chrysler that is tied to a freeze on the members wages. This does not shake our view that Chrysler workers should contribute significantly their own rescue  in amounts sufficient to discourage other firms and unions from relying on similar help.

title: Mystery Man Sought in 2 Hotel Slayings
description: From the moment he checked into the hotel in Manhattan, the man was secretive. He registered under a fictitious name and home address.

title: Stage: Holy Places by Women's Project
description: FAMILY secrets and lies, what Big Daddy labeled mendacity in Cat on a Hot Tin Roof, are at the core of Gaii Kriegel Mallin's Holy Places, which opened last night at the American Place Theater as part of that company's continuing Women's Project. This project is designed to uncover talented women in diverse areas of the theater. In this case, the play is designed as well as directed by women.

title: China Spurring Peasant Housing
description: PEKING, Dec. 9 (Reuters)  Cement factories throughout China will take part in a drive to produce thousands of concrete blocks for peasant housing, the New China News Agency reported today. The decision follows a national conference on ways of improving accommodation in China's rural areas. Some 340 big cement plants and thousands of smaller ones throughout the country are being asked to make 20 to 30 million prefabricated concrete parts.

title: Around the Nation
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 9 (UPI)  Mayor J. Kenneth Blackwell led 75 mourners through chilling winds last night to place freshcut daisies before the doors of Riverfront Coliseum, where 11 young persons were killed Monday in a rush for seats at a rock concert.

title: Makeshift New Mexico Five Surprises Foe
description: LAS CRUCES, N.M., Dec. 9  A patchwork, sevenman University of New Mexico basketball team, missing seven players because of alleged transcript tampering, surprised everyone except its neophyte coach and athletic director here last night.

title: The Region
description: HAMILTON TOWNSHIP, N.J. The police are searching for a former campaign worker for Hamilton's Mayor who is accused of attacking a township official as he was going to meet the Mayor Saturday morning.HARDING TOWNSHIP, N.J. (AP) As 10 more deer were killed at the Great Swamp National Wildlife Refuge, protesters against hunting hanged the refuge manager in effigy.Governor Carey said yesterday that he would established a new safety task force aimed at reducing the number of deaths caused by drunken driving in New York State. The Alcohol and HighThe official, Arthur J. Julian, the township's Business Administrator, was hurt slightly when he fell while attempting to escape a man wielding a jack handle and assailing Republicans. He identified the man as Joseph Frascella, a former campaign worker for Mayor John K. Rafferty, a Republican.

title: Business Group Calls Inflation Top 80 Issue
description: Inflation will continue to be the nation's leading economic problem in 1980, with consumer prices rising 10.5 percent and producer costs up 11.5 percent, the Conference Board's Economic Forum predicted yesterday.

title: Peru Demands New Oil Contracts
description: LIMA, Dec 7 (Reuters) - The Peruvian Government today gave two United States oil companies 30 days in which to renegotiate existing contracts with the state oil concern and issued guidelines for the negotiation of future contracts with foreign companies.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Dec. 10,1979 GENERAL ASSEMBLY Meets on Namibia at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Iran Crisis Is Speeding Reforms
description: PARIS, Dec. 9  President Carter's economic confrontation with Iran is encouraging an overdue reform of the international economic system, bringing some benefits, but also immense dangers to the Western industrialized democracies, according to a panel of American and European economic experts who met here last week.

title: Russian Navy: A New Interest In Third World
description: The pattern of naval construction in the Soviet Union suggests that Russian maritime strategy is to expand naval power into the third world. The new ships are not so much designed for battles with another great power but instead would have

title: Abigail Burnham Is Wed To Roger Bloom, Lawyer
description: Abigail Burnham, a doctoral candidate at New York University, and Roger F. Bloom, a New York lawyer, were married yesterday at the Village Temple. Rabbi Dennis Math performed the ceremony.

title: Strike Brings Surge in Business at Midtown Hotels
description: Hotels in midtown Manhattan seemed to be benefiting handsomely yesterday from the strike on the Long Island Rail Road as commuters sought places to stay in the city. Several reported large increases in reservations as the strike entered its second day.

title: Notes on People
description: One hates to let the cat out of the bag, but then it might not even be a cat.

title: Flyer Streak Reaches 24
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 9 (UPI) Terry Ruskowski scored with 50 seconds left to give the Chicago Black Hawks a 44 tie tonight with the Philadelphia Flyers, who set a club record with their 24th straight game without a defeat. Philadelphia's has 17 victories and seven ties in that span. Its overall wonlosttied record is 1817.

title: Miss Comaneci Leaving Hospital
description: FORT WORTH, Dec. 9 (AP)  Nadia Comaneci of Rumania, hospitalized for surgery to drain fluid from an infected hand, will leave All Saints Episcopal Hospital early tomorrow to go home with her country's gymnastics team. Her departure from the hospital will be against the advice of American doctors, who feel she should stay an extra day.

title: A Chilly Day for Exercising in the Park
description: Joggers of the twolegged and fourlegged variety were joined by a flier of the pigeon variety yesterday in Central Park. All appeared intent in staying warm in 38degree temperature under overcast skies.

title: City and L. I. Agencies Take Steps To Aid Travelers in L.I.R.R. Strike
description: Commuters who normally travel on the Long Island Rail Road braced themselves yesterday to meet traffic problems resulting from a strike against the line.

title: 5 Children Die As Jersey Blaze Destroys House
description: Three brothers, their sister and a visiting cousin, all between the ages of 2 and 7, were found dead early yesterday after a swiftmoving fire destroyed their home in a rural section of Morris County in northern New Jersey, a mile from the nearest neighbor.

title: U.S. Marshal in Jersey Leaving
description: NEWARK, Dec. 9 (AP)  Edward R. Scheu is resigning as head of the United States Marshals Service in New Jersey. Mr. Scheu, 35 years old, said yesterday that he was seeking reassignment to the headquarters office of the Marshals Service in Washington. There has been no announcement on a successor for Mr. Scheu, who will be transferred Jan. 5.

title: Ashe to Undergo Surgery
description: Arthur Ashe, the 36yearold tennis star who suffered a heart attack last July, has decided to undergo surgery in the near future that will remove fatty deposits obstructing his coronary arteries. Ashe announced his decision yesterday at the fifth annual United Negro College Fund tennis benefit at the Felt Forum, where he was a spectator rather than a participant following two days in a Florida hospital with palpitations.

title: Outdoors: Gifts for the Sportsman Who Has Everything
description: FINDING the right Christmas present for a wellequipped outdoorsman is fraught with frustrations, because most of the major tools or articles of clothing of his avocation he prefers to choose himself.

title: Spain Advances
description: LIMASSOL, Cyprus, Dec. 9 (AP) Spain advanced today to the European Cup of Nations soccer final, defeating Cyprus by 31 in a Group C elimination match. The final games will be played among the winners of the six groups in June 1980.

title: Impasse Over the Hostages
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 9  As the captivity of 50 American hostages in their own embassy entered its sixth week today, there was little sign of any solution to the remarkable diplomatic impasse.

title: China, Japan Win In Asian Basketball
description: NAGOYA, Japan, Dec. 9 (AP) China and Japan scored victories today, gaining a firstplace tie with South Korea in the final round of the Asian men's basketball championship. China overpowered Pakistan, 11959, and Japan beat India, 9555.

title: The Dollar Value of a Housewife: Experts Strive to Figure It Out
description: How much is a housewife worth? Legally speaking, the question used to arise more in sorrow than in anger, usually when courts were asked to value a homemaker's services in cases of injury or wrongful death.

title: Marine Patrol Vehicle Is Target of Two Shots At Base in Puerto Rico
description: Two shots were fired at United States Marines on sentry duty at the Roosevelt Roads Naval Base in eastern Puerto Rico last night. It was the second shooting attack on Navy personnel there in a week.

title: J.S. Wohl, Lawyer Who Founded Seminary Brotherhood Program
description: Joseph S. Wohl, a lawyer and real estate man who founded the Universal Brotherhood Program of the Jewish Theological Seminary of America in 1951 and served as the program's president, died Saturday at Long Island JewishHillside Medical Center in New Hyde Park, L.I. Mr. Wohl, who lived in Old Westbury, L.I., was 69 years old.

title: Use of Grants By Politicians
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9  When Transportation Secretary Neil E.Goldschmidt awarded a $24.8 million grant for highways in the Chicago area Tuesday, he intentionally ignored Mayor Jane M. Byrne and held a little ceremony to mark the event in the office of Representative Dan Rostenkowski, the head of the Chicago Congressional delegation.

title: Governor Carey's Emission Bypass
description: Governor Carey's people have discovered that certain motorvehicle law, already on the books, will let New York require the inspection of vehicles to see that they're not fouling the air with emissions. So now the inspection drive can perhaps bypass the opposition the legislature. That can help, in two ways. Inspections should result in cleaner air and, since they would result in compliance, at last, with Federal rules, they would avoid a threatened cutoff of Federal transportation aid.

title: Bridge:
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 9  The last two days here have made it clear that the Aces team has no equal in North America and probably no eaual in the world.

title: Carter and Kennedy Trade Darts at Dinner
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) President Carter and Senator Edward M. Kennedy traded barbs tonight at a $1,000aplate birthday party for House Sneaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial IIst of scheduled meetings for week follows: MONDAY

title: The City
description: Fifth Avenue was closed for four hours yesterday between 50 and 53d Streets, beginning at 1:30 P.M., while nine broken windows were repaired at the Olympic Towers, which was damaged by fire early in the morning.

title: Archbishop Sheen, Who Preached To Millions Over TV, Is Dead at 84
description: Archbishop Fulton J. Sheen, who through his television ministry became one of the bestknown figures of the Roman Catholic Church in the United States, died at his home at 500 East 77th Street in Manhattan yesterday after long battle with heart disease. He was 84 years old.

title: A Fast Tan at the Shopping Center Brings Summer to Wintry Pale Faces
description: CEDARHURST, L.I.  Here it is December and people in these parts are walking around with tanned faces. Nice tan, neighbors say. Just back from Barbados? Nope, the tanned ones reply. Just back from the shopping center.

title: Plants and Organic Waste Offer Hopes of Filling U.S. Energy Gap
description: Biomass, a source of energy as old as a caveman's fire, may never fully replace the fossil fuels that two centuries of industrial society have nearly exhausted.
