description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  Robert S. Strauss, the new chairman of President Carter's reelection campaign, is drawing in old political allies like Patrick J. Cunnineham. the former New York crate Democratic Party chairman, and Charles T. Mannatt, the former California party chairman, to strengthen the organizational leadership of the Carter campaign.

title: U.S. Agencies Advise Consumers on Getting Voice in Government
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)  Federal agencies published drafts today of their plans to tell consumers how to make your voice heard in eovernment.

title: KHOMEINI REBUFFED BY RIVAL AYATOLLAH
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 10  Ayatollah Kazem ShariatMadari today resisted pressure from Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, the revolutionary leader, to dissolve the rebellious Moslem Peonle's Party, which has been active in the Azerbaijani minority region of northwestern Iran.

title: U.S. Says It Won't Accept Delay on Missiles in Europe
description: WEST BERLIN, Dec. 10  As the Western alliance prepared to decide this week on stationing new American nuclear missiles in Europe, the United States insisted that it would not accept delay in plans for the program that it said would restore a balance between East and West.

title: Advertising
description: STYROFOAM birthday cake recently flew east from the coast so that a commercial begun in Los Angeles could be finished in New York.

title: 35 Million Latin American Children Are Said to Need Food
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 10  Luis Jara arrived at the rehabilitation center for starving children here weighing seven pounds at the age of nine months, a sick, shriveled infant retarded in mental alertness and muscular control.

title: Bridge:
description: By far the strongest of the Communist countries, in terms of bridge ability. is Poland. In New Orleans last year, the Poles demonstrated that their best players could beat anybody when they took the Rosenblum Cup event, in which 64 star teams competed.

title: A Way to Produce Small Cars Faster
description: There are good ways and bad ways to bend the rules for automakers. Chrysler, for instance, needs money desperately. One bad way to help would be for Washington to guarantee it billions of dollars with few strings attached. American Motors, on the other hand, needs a waiver of the rule that counts only tnose cars produced largely in the United States in calculating the average mileage per gallon for an auto maker's fleet. The company would like to include in its average new, small, Renaultdesigned car that will be assembled in the United States from parts that for a short time will be imported mostly from France. We think the Government would be wise to give the waiver. will provide more highmileage cars in 1982 and 1983, and more jobs in American assembly plants.

title: Chrysler Lobbying for Its Life
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  Almost all 28 members of the informal ItalianAmerican Congressional caucus turned out last Thursday morning for a coffeeanddoughnuts breakfast organized by Representative Frank Annunzio, Democrat of Illinois, and Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr., Democrat of New Jersey. The guest of honor was Lee A. Iacocca, chairman of the Chrysler Corporation and Mr. Rodino's old friend.

title: Kaufman: Rate Peak Still Ahead
description: Henry Kaufman, who has been predicting higher interest rates for more than two years, said yesterday that the peaks still lay ahead.

title: Libyan Leader Sets Aside Threats To Curtail Oil Exports to the U. S.
description: BIN JAWAD, Libya, Dec. 10  The leader of Libya, Muammar elQaddafi, today set aside earlier threats to curtail oil exports to the United States and said his Government wanted to improve LibyanAmerican relations.

title: 2 Charged With Perjury in Inquiry On '73 Barbara Gibbons Slaying
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., Dec. 10 (AP) Warrants were issued today charging two men with perjury in the grand jury investigation that cleared Peter Reilly in the 1973 killing of his mother, Barbara Gibbons.

title: Books: A New Yorker
description: THIS is a novel that has all the earmarks of autobiography, such is the introspection that permeates it. Yet a brief note assures us that we should infer no relationships to real people and events, and this admonitory fillip makes one admire even more this poetic, extremely gracefully written story of a New York woman, born and raised in a welltodo refugee Jewish family in which the parents are modern and progressive culturally but still nod to tradition and clan ties.

title: CornProduct Price Fixing Charged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) Eight distributors of corn derivative products have been accused by the Justice Department of price fixing.

title: Vote in Louisiana Governor Race To Be Officially Counted Today
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 10 (UPI)  The votes in the runoff election for Louisiana Governor were to be officially counted tomorrow, and if Representative David C. Treen's fragile 10,087vote unofficial margin holds up he will become the first Republican Governor of the state since 1877.

title: 7 Buildings Destroyed in Fire
description: A threealarm fire destroyed seven frame buildings in Brooklyn's BedfordStuyvesant section yesterday before was brought under control at 6:19 P.M., according to The Associated Press. No injuries were reported.

title: MOST L.I. COMMUTERS PUNCTUAL FOR WORK DESPITE RAIL STRIKE
description: Bothered but unbowed by the first Long Island Rail Road strike in seven years, thousands of commuters struggled to work and back yesterday, flocking to special buses, jamming subway trains and crowding highways.

title: Free Agents Taking New Route to N.B.A.
description: Stan Pietkiewicz earned about $10,000 playing for the Anchorage Northern Knights last season in the Continental Basketball Association. He received a $15 per diem for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and he flew tourist class  when he flew. Most of the teams in the league traveled by van their game destinations were less than five hours away.

title: Construction Worker Convicted Of Murder in Foreman's Plunge
description: Joseph Papagni, a 51yearold construction worker from Brooklyn, was convicted yesterday of murdering his foreman by pushing him out of a 56thfloor window of the Chrysler Building on New 21 1978

title: New South Korea Premier Named
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 10  President Choi Kyu Hall today named an economic expert, Shin Hyon Hwack, as Prime Minister and the nomination is expected to be confirmed Wednesday by the National Assembly.

title: 3 G.O.P. Chiefs Threaten To Oppose Davits at Polls
description: Three major downstate Republican county leaders yesterday threatened to sponsor challenges to United States Senator Jacob K. Javits in the Republican primary next year if he seeks a fifth term.

title: Search in Atlantic Continues
description: The Coast Guard said yesterday it had searched 10,000 square miles of ocean without success while looking for two men and two women who abandoned their sinking sailboat, Shadow, last Friday 360 miles southeast of New York. The search was to continue through the night and today. The boat was en route from Manhattan to Bermuda.

title: A Westchester NeimanMarcus
description: The NeimanMarcus Company, the Dallasbased specialty store chain, will make its first appearance in the metropolitan New York area next fall by taking over the White Plains site occupied by Bergdorf Goodman.

title: 2 L.I. Doctors May Face Charges
description: The Nassau County District Attorney's office is considering criminal charges against two psychiatrists who last week granted a furlough to a mental hospital patient who allegedly killed his former wife while he was at large, a spokesman for the office said yesterday.

title: U.S. Warns Teheran on Parading Of Hostages Before Any Tribunal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  The White House warned Iran today that the United States would regard the parading of American hostages before an Iranianappointed international tribunal of inquiry with the same gravity as it would view any trial of the Americans.

title: Peril Seen In OPEC's Cash Glut
description: PARIS, Dec., 10  An influential American banker has warned here that Western commercial banks will be unable to handle the huge increase in OPEC's assets that is likely to result from oil price increases. He said the world monetary system must be reformed to prevent a crisis.

title: Regency to Show 24 Best Films
description: Out of the five series and 240 films it has run during 1979, the Regency Theater, has chosen the 24 most popular and will show them in a grouping of double bills for six weeks starting next Sunday. Called The Best, the series is the second such annual that the theater has presented. The opening bill, running from Sunday to Dec. 18, consists of A Night at the Opera with the Marx Brothers, and Forbidden Planet with Walter Pidgeon and Anne Francis. The Regency is at Broadway and 67 Street, and the box office number is 7243700.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article on the Mennonite Church in The Times on Dec. 3 incorrectly identified the man regarded as the founder of the church. He was Menno Simons.

title: Music: Chester Quartet
description: THE Chester Quartet, an ensemble in residence at the Eastman School in Rochester, made a fine impression Saturday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. Its members the violinists Peter Matzka and Susan Freier, the violist Melissa Matson and the cellist Thomas Rosenberg  are all young, vital players, and they offered a balanced, absorbing program: Haydn's Frog Quartet (Op. 50, No. 6), Mendelssohn's Quartet in D (Op. 44, No. 1), and Karl Weigl's Quartet in A (Op. 4).

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: William E. Lamothe, 53 years old, president and chief executive officer of the Kellogg Company, was elected last Friday to the additional post of chairman, effective at the end of this month. He will succeed Joe E. Lonning, who will retire at the age of 62.

title: Belridge Oil Holders Vote Sale to Shell Oil
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 10 (AP) The shareholders of the Belridge Oil Company, a littleknown California company largely owned by descendants of three of its founders, approved today the $3.65 billion merger of their company into the Shell Oil Company. Almost all the dissenting votes were cast by the Mobil Corporation and Texaco Inc., which together own 34.9 percent of Belridge.

title: CREDIT MARKETS Economy's Gains Depress Bond Prices
description: Bond prices dropped yesterday in response to additional evidence that the economy is not weakening as fast as expected.

title: World News Briefs
description: SAN SALVADOR, Dec. 10 (AP) Three men were killed and several persons were wounded today when about 2,000 leftists broke up a demonstration by about 8,000 women demanding the Government end political violence in this Central American republic, hospital officials reported.

title: ADMINISTRATION SAYS JAPANESE UNDERCUT U.S EFFORTS ON IRAN
description: PARIS, Dec. 10  The Carter Administration charged today that Japan had undercut American efforts to use economic pressure against Iran to gain the release of the 50 hostages being held in Teheran. The charge came as Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance began a fournation West European tour to seek support for actions on behalf of the hostages.

title: David Aranow, 87, Dies; City College Benefactor
description: David Aranow, a retired manufacturer of knitwear in New York City and a major contributor to City College and other colleges, died Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 87 years old.

title: New Envoy to Norway Named
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (Reuters) President Carter today nominated Sidney Rand, president of St. Olaf College in Minnesota, as the new United States Ambassador to Norway. If confirmed by the Spate, Mr. Rand will succeed Louis A. Lerner, who is resigning.

title: Iran Demands Expulsion Of Reporter of The A.P.
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 10 (AP)  Alex Efty, a reporter of The Associated Press, was ordered expelled today for reporting on fighting between rival political groups, the foreign press chief of the Ministry of National Guidance said.

title: 20 Nations Tightening Curb on Oil
description: PARIS, Dec. 10  The major oilconsuming nations tightened their energy conservation plans today by agreeing for the first time to divide up among themselves the amount of oil they expect the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries to sell next year.

title: Muddying the Waters
description: As if things weren't bad enough on the international scene, we now hear that the recent goodwill tour of Japan by two teams of American baseball allstars created some bad will on both sides of the Pacific Ocean.

title: Kennedy Outlines a Foreign Policy Similar in Approach to President's
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10  Senator Edward M. Kennedy, in his first speech on foreign policy since he announced his Presidential candidacy, today outlined a general approach to international and military affairs quite similar to that of President Carter.

title: Text of the Message From Iran to the World Court
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 10 (AP)  Following, in translation from the French, is the official text of the message sent to the International Court of Justice by Foreign Minister Sadegh Ghotbzadeh of Iran:

title: 2 Arab Nations Lift Gas Prices
description: BAHRAIN, Dec. 10 (Reuters)  Kuwait and Saudi Arabia have again raised the price of butane and propane, liquefied gases that already cost twice as much as a year ago.

title: Theater: Cass McGuire By Friel at Three Muses
description: THE time is the present; the setting, Eden. Not the biblical Eden, mind you, but Eden House  an old folks rest home at the end of town where the workhouse used to be. But no matter: the fictions the residents here tell one another have the palpable effect of transforming their dingy reality into a facsimile of paradise. And in the revival of Brian Friel's The Loves of Cass McGuire at the Three Muses Theater through Dec. 19, the bittersweet tex ture of their dream life is lyrically and effectively  conjured.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: A large selloff in Tokyo sent the dollar plummeting against the Japanese yen yesterday, and the dollar was generally weaker elsewhere as well. The price of gold rose.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Strict Jersey Abortion Law Voted, But the Governor Considers a Veto
description: TRENTON, Dec. 10  The New Jersey Assembly gave final passage today to a  bill that would require women seeking abortions to sign a consent form and wait at least 24 hours before the abortion.

title: New York State Orders Job Cuts Totaling 3,000
description: Governor Carey's administration has ordered that 3,000 employees be cut from New York State's payroll of 172,800 people through attrition by March 31, the end of the fiscal year, aides to the Governor said yesterday.

title: Corporate Earnings
description: For periods as shown.(N) indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: Cosmos Make Ebert No. 1 Draft Selection
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 10  The Cosmos made Don Ebert, a forward from Southern Illinois, Edwardsville, the first selection in today's North American Soccer League draft here. The 20yearold Ebert was the first of 95 players selected and one of eight who went to the Cosmos.

title: U.S., in World Court, Calls for Quickest Possible Action on the Hostages
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 10  The United States asked the International Court of Justice in a hearing today to take the quickest possible action to insure the release of American hostages in Teheran. but Iran sent a telegram saying that the court had no jurisdiction.

title: Learning From The Crisis
description: Not since Vlad III, Prince of Wallachia (otherwise known as Dracula), nailed the Turkish envoys fezzes onto their heads in the middle of the 15th century has diplomatic immunity been so flagrantly violated as by the Ayatollah Khomeini and his student followers during the last month. The analogy does not stop there. Khomeini has been using his American prisoners as instruments to arouse emotional support for his fanatical hostility to the United States, just as Dracula welcomed the Ottoman ambassadors in his own peculiar way to demonstrate his disdain for the Sultan.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Gold and silver futures skipped higher in late trading yesterday amid worries over currency market turmoil and the Iranian situation.

title: 3 Forecast A Dip in 80, Gains Later
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10  Three prominent Chicago economists, addressing an economic forecast luncheon for the 19th year in a row, predicted a roller coaster ride for the economy in the years ahead.

title: 41 Mt. Sinai Nurses in Sickout
description: More than a third of the scheduled surgery at the Mount Sinai Hospital was canceled yesterday when 41 senior operating room nurses called in sick to nrotest what they called excessive overwork because of nursing staff shortages. A hospital spokesman said that all elective surgery was canceled and that other nurses staffed the operating rooms for the 30 patients who underwent surgery. The hospital said it would respond to the nurses grievance, and the nurses said they would return to work today.

title: High Court Refuses to Hear Clifford Trust Tax Case
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  The Supreme Court refused today to take Government appeal in a case involving the deductibility of rental payments made to a socalled Clifford trust, shortterm trust frequently used to reduce taxes by transferring assets for the benefit of the taxpayer's children.

title: Music: A Violin and Piano Partnership
description: THE number of violinists who play the instrument as sonorously as Erick Friedman belong to the Fingers of One Hand Club, meaning you do not have to count very high to run out of members. Mr. Friedman, who has been performing in public for 25 years, has long been outstanding for the sheer beauty of the sound he can draw from an ordinarily recalcitrant little fourstringed box. His recital at Carnegie Hall on Sunday night, with Nadia Reisenberg as pianist, demonstrated his continued mastery of the purely technical aspects of his craft.

title: Yields on Bills UP at Treasury
description: Yields were up on Treasury bills in the weekly auction yesterday in both the 91day and the 182day maturities.

title: Evicted Mother Threatens Child
description: A woman who was being evicted from her thirdfloor apartment in Astoria, Queens, yesterday threatened to throw her 8yearold daughter off the fire escape, but the police stopped her, authorities said. They said a city marshal had gone to the apartment at 3006 33d Street to evict the woman, and she took refuge on the fire escape with her daughter. The police said they broke into the apartment and talked to the woman until they could approach and seize her.

title: Police Strike in 7 Spanish Cities
description: MADRID, Dec. 10 (Reuters)  Municipal policemen in seven southern Spanish cities began a 24hour strike today to press for better negotiation procedures on wages, official sources said. Involved were Seville, Granada, Huelva, Almeria, Malaga, Cadiz and ardoba.

title: Exploring The Inside Of a Cell
description: SAN FRANCISCO HERE, said the scientist, we are standing inside the nerve cell, looking outward toward its surface. The visitor. standing in a darkened chamber and wearing polaroid glasses for their threedimensional effect, could easily believe this to be true. The pictures on the wall screen took the viewer into a bizarre world of caves, tunnels, netlike veils, translucent spheres, massed arrays of little cubes that looked like molar teeth and pyramid structures girded by rods and knobs  like a child's building set.

title: Oilers Hold Off Late Steeler Rally and Triumph by 2017
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 10  The Houston Oilers defeated the Pittsburgh Steelers, 2017, tonight before a loud and delighted crowd in the Astrodome. The Oilers led by 10 points late in the final period and had been the dominant team throughout the game.

title: Off the Street. Out of Court
description: Anyone who has ever bought a lemon of an appliance, which the seller refused to fix, has probably known the frustration of suffering silently. Why? Because it costs so much to sue and, in any case, takes so lone. For similar reasons. complainants often don't bother to call the police about minor arguments over noise, money, trespassing. Or if they do call the police, an arrest can begin a long court process when all they wanted was immediate relief.

title: Bank Board Nominee
description: President Carter announced yesterday that he would nominate John Dalton as a member of the Federal Horne Loan Bank Board. Mr. Dalton, a former president of the Government National Mortgage Corporation, has been finance director of President Carter's reelection committee.

title: New Homes Sales Decline
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)  The Commerce Department reported today that sales of new, onefamily homes occurred at an annual rate of 724.000 units in October, down 1.8 percent from the 737,000unit rate of the previous month and nearly 20 percent below the 900,000unit rate of October 1978.

title: A Restive Islamic World
description: With resentment to Americans appearing to spread through the Islamic world. The Times invited seven scholars representing varied disciplines and viewpoints to discuss recent events that have baffled and alarmed many Westerners. Excerpts from the symposium are on pages A16 and A17.

title: Payroll and Campaign Allegations Against Rep. Wilson Are Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  The House Ethics Committee is investigating charges that Representative Charles H. Wilson engaged in a payroll kickback scheme and diverted campaign funds to his personal use, a source familiar with the case said today.

title: Sam Church Displays Strong Hand as Convention Opens, Hinting at a Consolidation Drive
description: DENVER, Dec. 10  The United Mine Workers of America, facing two of the most crucial years in its 89year history as the oldest industrial union in the country. opened a nineday national convention here today with an impassioned plea  and a quick display of the fast gavel by its new president, Sam Church Jr.

title: Theater: Feydeau Farce Is Playing in Stamford
description: STAMFORD, Conn BEGINNING its fifth year, the Hartman Theater Company has moved into a new home, a former movie theater that was itself a former legitimate house once headlining such stars as Maude Adams and Humphrey Bogart. In its eclectic series of plays, the Hartman, under the direction of Margot and Del Tenney, has been trying to reinstitute live theater here. This season, Hartman audiences can see everything from Agatha Christie to Anton Chekhov.

title: Carter's Rail Mediation Refusal Tied to Subway Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  President Carter's refusal to try to head off the Long Island Rail Road strike by appointing a Federal mediation board was depicted today as a result of his concern for forthcoming labor talks in New York and organized labor's support of his reelection. It was not seen as an attempt to punish Governor Carey for his neutrality in the Presidential campaign.

title: ABOUT EDUCATION Special Education In Regular Classes
description: ONE of education's major thrusts in recent years has been toward meeting the needs of the handicapped, needs that were thought by some to be radically different from those of other students. Now experts are starting to think that perhaps all students might benefit from the instructional approaches that have been developed for this group.

title: New Books
description: A Lion for Love, by Robert Alter with collaboration of Carol Cosman (Basic, $13.95). Critical biography of Stendahl.

title: Travel Agents' Rates Studied
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  The Justice Department is urging the Civil Aeronautics Board to withdraw its earlier approval of agreements fixing the commission rates paid to travel agents for the sale of domestic transoortation.

title: Q&A
description: Q. How far into space can we see with the unaided eye?

title: Violinist: Mark Kaplan
description: PERFORMERS are sometimes spoken of as having an enormous technique but scant interpretive abilities, or vice versa. Actually the links between those facets of a musician's art are consider ably more tenuous than that, as suggested by Mark Kaplan's violin recital Sunday night at the 92d Street Y.

title: Langley Air Force Aides Question CombatReadiness of F15 Fighter
description: LANGLEY AIR FORCE BASE, Va. Dec. 10  Senior sergeants and rnaintenance specialists here say that only 35 percent of the First Tactical Fighter Wine's new F15 Eaeles. the leading fighter plane in the Air Force today, are fully capable of flying combat missions on any given day.

title: Market Place
description: IS American Cyanamid about to announce a merger with a major oil company? Wall Street considers it the most unlikely rumor making the rounds, but some in the Street do not entirely discount the possibility because of the strength of Cyanamid shares in a generally dull market.

title: Mother Teresa, Receiving Nobel, Assails Abortion
description: OSLO, Dec. 10 (AP)  Mother Teresa, Calcutta's Saint of the Gutters, accepted the $192,000 Nobel Peace Prize today in the name of the poor, the sick and the unwanted children. She also denounced abortion as the greatest destroyer of peace.

title: Lance CoDefendants Drop Bid to Move Trial
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 11 (AP)  Bert Lance's codefendants have abandoned efforts to have their trial on bank fraud charges moved from Atlanta to Rome, Ga. The trial will begin Jan. 14.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The Gulf Oil Company and Chevron U.S.A. were accused Energy Department investigators of overcharging by $550 million between 1973 and 1976. The complaints bring to more than $8 billion the face value of charges brought by the department against major refiners this year. The department also announced it had signed consent orders with the two companies for $23.3 million. [D1.]

title: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY HE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS UNTIL 2.30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFF's ES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) ARKET 33900, WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO (516) 66911300, CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY HE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS UNTIL 2.30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFF's ES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) ARKET 33900, WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO (516) 66911300, CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Italian Terrorists Shoot 10 Students
description: ROME, Dec. 11  Leftwing terrorists stormed the Business Administration School of the University of Turin today and shot 10 carefully selected victims in the legs at close range.

title: Q&A
description: Q. I have developed a tremendous appetite for feta cheese. I use it in salads and in some baked dishes. Can you tell me what it is made from?

title: Temperatures of 60 Pleasant in December As They Were in May
description: People who couldn't believe forecasts of temperatures in the 60's in midDecember ended up carrying their coats on their arms yesterday afternoon when the temperature reached 63 degrees in Manhattan at 2:45. The reading was just short of the record of 64 degrees for the date, set in 1879.

title: CONNALLY TO FORGO U.S. CAMPAIGN FUNDS
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 11 John B. Connally has decided to forgo Federal matching funds in his bid for the Republican Presidential nomination, according to campaign sources.

title: COMMODITIES Futures Up For Gold And Silver
description: The prices of most major commodities traded on United States futures markets rose yesterday as gold breached $450 an ounce.

title: Wang Labs Selling Bonds
description: Wang Laboratories, a computer and office products company with headquarters in Lowell, Mass., is selling $50 million of 25year convertible debentures today through an underwriting syndicate managed by Merrill Lynch, Pierce. Fenner & Smith. The debentures, rated Ba by Moody's and B by Standard & Poor's, will carry a 63/4 percent interest rate and will be priced at 100 percent of their face value. The debentures will be convertible into Wang Laboratories common stock at price of $38.50 a share, 20.3 percent higher than yesterday's close of $32.

title: Where to Buy Game for Dinner
description: Numerous shops in Manhattan sell both fresh and frozen game, and the selection varies from store to store, depending on the season. Some feature fresh game, some frozen game and some both. Now is the peak season for fresh game.

title: School Board Monitoring Approved
description: A stringent plan to monitor the Board of Education's finances was approved yesterday by Mayor Koch and City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin. The plan includes a request that the school system absorb a projected school deficit of at least $48 million for the 198081 school year.

title: The London That Comes to Life at Midnight
description: LONDON Harry's Bar opened here recently, not as an informal watering hole reminiscent of its Venetian namesake but as one of those private clubs that are extending the city's night life into the wee hours. They are fashionable restaurants, discos, gaming establishments and status symbols, and they are a far cry from the musty, allmale preserves where members snooze by the fireside.

title: $1 Billion Bid on Beaufort Sea Leases; Sale Also Introduces Profit Sharing
description: FAIRBANKS, Alaska, Dec. 11 joint stateFederal oil lease sale of 800 square miles of the Beaufort Sea floor produced bonus bids today of more than $1 billion.

title: EARNINGS Seagram Net Up 63.4%; Vornado Has a Loss
description: The Seagram Company, the world's largest distiller, reported a 63.4 percent rise in profits for the first fiscal quarter ended Oct. 31 on a sales gain of 10 percent. The company attributed the surge in net income partly to foreignexchange gains of $11.2 million, in contrast to a loss of $6.9 million from this source in the yearearlier period.

title: Deaths
description: SCHWARZAnn. Beloved mother of Paul. Devoted daughter of Samuel Schnelber, loving sister of David Schnelber. Services were held Tuesday, December 11. Shiva at Schwarz, 7002 Boulevard East, Guttenberg New Jersey, apartment 111.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Clear skies cover most of the Eastern Seaboard but thick snow clouds cover northern Maine. Middle and high level clouds stretch across Florida. Clouds are streaked across the Mississippi Valley and the Plains States and heavy snow clouds cover the central Rockies. Shower clouds cover the Pacific Northwest.

title: Loved Ones Remembered in Donations to Neediest
description: Each Christmas I like to make a memorial payment to some fitting cause to remember my nephew, Lieut. Richard D. B. Shepherd, killed in Vietnam in 1976. He was a boy of great compassion, possessor of a brilliant mind, and his unfulfilled wish was to live in New York City.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Beneficial Corporation, Wilmington, Del.based financial services holding company, has appointed George R. Evans, vice chairman, to the additional post of chairman and chief executive officer of its Western Auto Supply Company subsidiary, Kansas City, Mo.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BLITHE SPIRIT Poetry by Noel Coward? Yes indeed. Few American fans of the master of sophistication realize there are two volumes of his verse. From Not Yet the Dodo, published in the 1960's, and from other poems in British journals, an hourlong show has been shaped by Playwrights Ink. The title is A Little Known Side.

title: Children and Allergies: Some Misconceptions
description: DENVER, Dec. 11 (AP)  Many children thought to be allergic to various foods are not and some are needlessly malnourished because they skip foods like milk, according to allergy researchers at the National Asthma Center.

title: Sirhan Seeks Cut in Prison Term
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11 (AP)  Sirhan B. Sirhan, convicted of the 1968 assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy, today asked a Federal court to cut his California prison term. On Nov. 8, the state Supreme Court denied a similar request without comment.

title: Deaths
description: CERBINIFrancis M. On December 10, 1979 after a short Illness in Rome, Italy. Father of Achilles and Innocenzo. Interment In Saracen Calabria, Italy December 14,1979.

title: St. John's Subdues Columbia Five, 9175
description: The 9175 victory St. John's scored over Columbia before a crowd of 3,175 in Alumni Hall last night could have been billed as a grudge match. Columbia was one of the teams that defeated St. John's last season before the Redmen went on to the regional final of the National Collegiate tournament.

title: Pavarotti Recital Dec. 31
description: Luciano Pavarotti will give a recital on New Year's Eve at 8 o'clock in Avery Fisher Hall, accompanied by the pianist John Wustman. The Italian tenors program will include arias by Mozart and Cilea, religious numbers and a sizable selection .of songs by Tosti. Priority in seating is being offered to subscribers to Lincoln Center's Great Performers Series. Remaining tickets will go on sale at the Avery Fisher Hall box office on Sunday at noon.

title: Ruth L. Stinson, Executive Aide To Minority Leader of Assembly
description: Ruth L. Stinson, executive assistant to the New York State Assembly minority leader, James L. Emery, died of an apparent heart attack Sunday while visiting the home of her mother, Mary E. Dolt, in Philadelphia. She was 53 years old and lived in Delmar, a suburb of Albany.

title: Advertising
description: WHEN Walter J. Wright said, It's the first time anyone has advertised hair styling on a national basis, nobody disputed the claim. Richard J. Wall certainly didn't. But then, he's a confederate.

title: Bachrach
description: Wayne Fickinger, who some where along the line wandered from the straight and narrow path of journalism, has been named president and chief operating officer of the J. Walter Thompson Company. The 53yearold executive, at Thompson since 1963, previously had the same two titles in the North American company.

title: Congressional Action Is Near on 13Year Effort to Revise Criminal Code
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  When Congressional leaders declared last summer that they would soon finish a comprehensive revision of Federal criminal laws, an effort begun more than a decade ago, their forecast struck many listeners as overly optimistic.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Deaths
description: BLAKEAnna Reposing at Williams Funeral Home; 5628 Broadway, Bronx, until Thursday 9:15AM.@ BLATTERFE IN - Sidney. Beloved husband of Marge. Devoted fattier of Berbera Shuster and Lawrence Blettertein. Loving brother of Frances Hamilton, Rae Ferrara, Ida Blatterfein and Gertrude Blatterfein. Services today 1PM at Park West Chapels Columbus Ave. & 79th St., N.Y.C.

title: Bomb Damages Russian Mission On East 67th St.
description: A powerful bomb, apparently set by the antiCastro Omega 7 terrorist group, exploded at the Soviet Mission to the United Nations on East 67th Street last night, injuring four police officers and at least two mission employees and shattering hundreds of windows throughout much of the block beween Lexington and Third Avenues.

title: Delays Loom for Fuel Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  Congressional leaders want to send President Carter an expensive new synthetic fuels bill before Christmas, but they may not have enough legislative shaping days left.

title: NBC News Defends Interview With Hostage as Public Service
description: Criticized by both its own journalistic competitors and officials in Government, NBC News yesterday defended as an important public service its telecast Monday night of an interview with an American hostage in Teheran under conditions largely controlled by the Iranian student captors.

title: Kitchen Equipment
description: IN this country, a cook can survive without a kitchen scale. A great many recipes are written to accommodate the fact that Americans rarely do have scales on their counters. Which is to say that most of the quantities given in American recipes are in volume and not weight (when weight is indicated, it is usually in some readily sold amount). This is not the case in Europe, however, where weight, with its greater precision than volume, is widely preferred.

title: Palestinians in Libya Charge Pressure Against P.L.O.
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 11  Palestinians living here say they are being intimidated by Libyan authorities as part of a campaign aimed at splitting them from the Palestine Liberation Organization and molding them into local organizations more prone to manipulation by the Libyan leader, Col Muammar elQaddafi.

title: Opera: A New Jenny in Mahagonny
description: SOME 15 years after Julia Migenes attracted Broadway attention with appearances as Maria in a City Center revival of West Side Story and as Hodel in the then new Fiddler on the Roof, she has made her Metropolitan Opera debut as Jenny in Kurt Weill's Rise and Fall of the City of Mahagonny. The performance, given on Monday night, also brought the Met debut of Timothy Jenkins, a tenor, as Jacob Schmidt, and Lili Chookasian's first appearance as Leocadia Begbick.

title: Rare Children's Ailment Is Detected in Rochester
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 11 (AP)  Federal medical sleuths are looking into a series of cases of Kawasaki's Disease, a rare and sometimes fatal ailment that afflicts youngsters.

title: Military Reorganization Creates Dispute in Israel
description: TELAVIV, Dec. 11  A dispute has reportedly broken out within the Israeli general staff over a decision to combine all ground forces under a single command and to bring Maj. Gen. Israel Tal out of retirement to head it.

title: Former Attendant Found Guilty Of Cruelty to Retarded Patients
description: VERNON, Conn., Dec. 11 (AP)  A Superior Court jury today found a former aide at the Mansfield Training School guilty of physically abusing severely retarded patients at the state facility.

title: Iran Says U.S. Museums Hold Its Art
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 11  Several valuable paintings and sculptures lent by a Teheran museum to three American museums that were to have been returned a year ago have not yet been sent back, despite repeated written requests, according to the director of the Teheran Museum of Contemporary Art.

title: Fayette Dunn, 76, Dies; Otis Elevator's ExHead
description: Fayette S. Dunn, former president and chairman of the board of the Otis Elevator Company, died yesterday in Dorset, Vt., where he had lived since his retirement. He was 76 years old.

title: Mild Quake in Philippines
description: MANILA, Dec. 11 (UPI)  A mild earthquake shook the island of Mindoro today, causing panic but apparently no casualties or damage. Government geophysicists said the 3second temblor occurred at 3:09 p.m. and registered an intensity of 3 on the RossiForel scale of 9. Its epicenter was about 90 miles from Manila, in the sea off Mindoro, they said.

title: Oil and Metals Issues Up; Amex Index Near Peak
description: The soaring price of gold bullion sent precious metal stocks higher yesterday on Wall Street. Elsewhere, selected oil issues responded affirmatively to results of a test at a well off Newfoundland and, in the takeover sector, a new suitor for Warner & Swasey sent that stock sharply ahead.

title: Letters
description: I was interested in the Questions and Answers column about plum pudding, fruitcakes and brandy [Dec. 5].

title: WASHINGTON Is There No Pity?
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  The relations between the United States and the Soviet Union are getting worse by the day, not only over the control of strategic weapons and the emplacement of new U.S. missiles in Western Europe but also over the desperate human tragedy in Cambodia.

title: The Theater: Sorrows of Stephen
description: STEPHEN HURT, the hero of Peter Parnell's Sorrows of Stephen (at the Public Theater), is an irrepressible romantic. He is in love with the idea of love. His model is the traeic hero of Goethe's The Sorrows of Young Werther, which he carries with him as Baedeker. As a contemporary man, he remains adaptable. The end of an apparently undying love is immediately followed by the birth of a new grand passion. He finishes an affair as some might finish reading a novel. He closes the book and starts reading another one.

title: U.S. Says Marine Bolstered Belief That the Hostages Are Under Stress
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  The Carter Administration said today that the first televised interview with a hostage in Iran had added nothing to Americans knowledge of the situation but might have the effect of heightening world concern about the fate of the 50 captives.

title: Javits Says Party Would Back Him If He Seeks ReElection Next Year
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  Senator Jacob K. Javits expressed disappointment today that three Republican county leaders in New York had threatened to oppose his renomination if he decided to seek a fifth term, but he insisted that he has enough support in the party to win the nomination if he runs.

title: Regional Vote in House On Funds for Abortions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) - Following is the rollcall of votes by representatives from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut in the House's decision today to give states the right to decide whether to spend their own Medicaid funds on abortions. A yes vote represents a vote in favor of the proposal and no vote represents a vote against it; xxx means not voting.

title: Satellite, or Its Pieces, Still Lost in Space With No Clues on Radio Silence
description: Somewhere, no one knows where, there is a satellite that has been missing since Monday afternoon. It is either wandering beyond its intended orbit or turning a deaf ear to calls from Earth or drifting in hundreds of pieces after an explosion. All anyone seems to know is that at one moment, Satcom 3 was there, relaying data by radio, and then all contact was lost.

title: Virginia Superport In Final Planning
description: Virginia officials have moved into the final planning stage for a mammoth offshore tanker port, capable of receiving nearly onethird of the nation's imports of crude oil. Backers say the project, which could cost more than $1 billion, would significantly cut the cost of transporting imported crude.

title: Irish Beat U.C.L.A. By 7774
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 11  The pairing on the marquee outside Notre Dame's arena provided enough buildup tonight for any basketball fanatic: N.D. vs. U.C.L.A.

title: Canada Retail Sales Down
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 11 (Reuters) Canadian retail sales fell a seasonally adjusted 1.2 percent in October to $6.52 billion after a 2.1 percent rise in September, the Canadian statistics office said yesterday. The drop was the first since the 3.6 percent decrease in April.

title: L.I. Commuters Shake 2d Workday Blues
description: The serene countenance of Earline Garland, who was pressed sardinelike yesterday in an IRT Flushing Line subway rocking and rolling toward Manhattan, flew in the face of tradition. It was the second workday of the Long Island Rail Road strike, and, according to transportation officials and the unwritten law of transit walkouts, chaos should have abounded among commuters.

title: Russian Tanker Rescues 61 Haitians Off Florida
description: MIAMI, Dec. 11 (UPI) - A Soviet tanker rescued 61 Haitians from a sinking boat early today, and 85 other Haitians were taken into custody when they arrived in the Florida Keys aboard two sailboats.

title: GTE Telenet To Increase Offices
description: GTE Telenet said it will more than double the number of central offices in its nationwide public data communications network by late next year to 250 from the present 90.

title: Chevron And Gulf Accused
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  Energy Department investigators today announced the filing of 13 charges against the Gulf Oil Company and Chevron U.S.A., two major refining companies, accusing them of having overcharged their customers by $550 million between 1973 and 1976.

title: Chamber: String Soloists
description: ALTHOUGH few of Paganini's compositions were published during his lifetime, he left good many works in manuscript, among them some quartets for violin, viola, cello and guitar. At Abraham Goodman House on Monday night, Paul Cianci led the New York String Soloists in an allPaganini program that included four of these quartets that the conductor believes have never been performed in this country. In prospect, a stimulating evening seemed likely.

title: NATO VOTING TODAY ON NUCLEAR MISSILES
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 11  Defense Secretary Harold Brown arrived here today for a meeting of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization that was to decide on deploying new nuclear missiles in Europe, but even this issue was overshadowed at least for a day by the crisis in Iran.

title: Economic Scene
description: IS there anything on the business scene more engrossing than the ordeal of Detroit? Before our eyes, the auto industry is turning itself inside out ; it is a Mississippi departing from its ageold course. In scarcely a decade, beginning with the mandated emissions standards written in 1970 into the Clean Air Act, Detroit has fallen from among the freest, most robust and least regulated of industries to its Present highly regulated and beleaguered state.

title: Mill Your Own Flour
description: Anyone who bakes breads regularly or enjoys cooking with grains should look into the new grain mill attachment for the KitchenAid mixer. The attachment will turn two cups of whole wheat into three cups of coarse cracked wheat or fine pastry flour in just three minutes.

title: ENGINEERING ELECTRONICAL/ELECTRONIC
description: Our fantastic expansion has necessitated the need for an engineer skilled in the design and implementation of power systems up to megawatt dimensions. We require a professional capable projects and people leadership.

title: Around the Nation
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 11 (AP)  A judge ruled today that a contract offer already rejected by leaders of a striking teachers union must be submitted to the membership for a vote by mail. Both the union and the school board said the move could prolong the 55dayold strike.

title: New Count Gives G.O.P. Victory In Louisiana's Race for Governor
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 11 (AP)  Representative David C. Treen's narrow lead survived a crucial new vote count today, and the Republicans claimed victory in Louisiana's cliffhanger race for Governor.

title: Theater: Turgenev's Month in Country
description: THERE is a sudden burst of inspiration in the second scene of the second act of the Roundabout's production of A Month in the Country, and I only wish that director Michael Kahn had been able to distribute its goodies more evenly over Turgenev's lovely, lovelorn, funnysad nlav.

title: Dutch Cabinet Considers Missiles
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  The Dutch Cabinet began a crucial meeting tonight to decide its stand on a North Atlantic Treaty Organization plan to deploy a new generation of nuclear weapons in Western European countries.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Prague Carnival, Smetana ; Sonata for Two Guitars in D, Soler; Suite No. 2; Arrival of the Queen of Sheba from Solomon. Handel; Overture to Don Giovanni, Mozart; Polonaise in D (Op. 61). Schubert.

title: Intrepid and Atypical L.I.R.R. Commuter
description: Raymond Shapiro is a man of accomplishment and diversity. He enjoys the theater and a game of chess, the south of France and the shores of Fire Island, playing the violin with friends and scrambling in a mean round of poker.

title: Seizure of a Marine in Iran Unites a Town in Arizona
description: GLOBE, Ariz., Dec. 11  Like fireflies in formation, hundreds of candle flames danced through the early evening chill of these rugged highlands where the people of Gila County sweat their living from surrounding copper mines.

title: House Acts to Allow States To Bar Abortion Financing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  The House extended the prolonged controversy over abortion policy to the state level today when it adopted an amendment specifying that states could not be required to pay for all medically necessary abortions.

title: Buyer Group's Sale Reported
description: The Mutual Buying Syndicate, one of the oldest and largest independent resident buying offices in New York, is in the process of being sold to a group headed by Irwin Ruben, an outerwear manufacturer, industry sources said yesterday.

title: Army Aides Convinced Hanoi Is Poisoning Laotians
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Dec. 12 (AP)  Army investigators are expected to tell a House Foreign Affairs subcommittee today that they are convinced, but cannot prove, that Vietnam is using chemical warfare against Laotian mountain tribesmen.

title: Mets Apodaca Given Release
description: Bob Apodaca, a 29yearold righthanded relief pitcher who had not appeared in a major league game since 1977, was given his outright release by the New York Mets yesterday.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: WE salute the inexorable march of the seasonal clich: There was the first robin of spring, the first luna moth last summer, the first scarlet leaf last fall and the first Santa of the winter. Janis Hirsch, our Director of Seasonal Entertainments, reports on this month's sighting:

title: Stage Shows Will Be Taped For Film and Video Cassettes
description: The American Broadcasting Companies, the Shubert Organization and Robert Altman's Lion's Gate Films yesterday announced the formation of a partnership to make film and video cassettes of theatrical productions.

title: Letters
description: One way to keep the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation afloat is to let it alone for a while. It already has had more than a reasonable quota of captains. Its board chairmen and presidents are changed so often, they hardly get to know each other before they are cast overboard.

title: NORTHEAST REGION CHARTS FARM POLICY
description: BOXBOROUGH, Mass., Dec. 11  The agricultural commissioners of 10 Northeastern states today announced a regional farm policy intended to help revitalize the area's already reawakening agricultural economy.

title: California Congressman Denies Payroll Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 In response to reports that he is under investigation by the House ethics committee, Representative Charles H. Wilson denied today that he had accepted kickbacks from his employees or had diverted campaign funds to his personal use.

title: Careers
description: FOR the last few years there have been too many librarians, so many, in fact, that like teachers these welleducated persons have been looking at alternative fields. They have been successful in many cases.

title: HUGE WAVES RAVAGE A MIDPACIFIC ISLAND
description: MAJURO, Marshall Islands, Dec. 8 The capital of the Marshall Islands was devastated this week when huge waves swept over the heavily populated east end of the tiny, lowlying atoll.

title: Deaths
description: LIEFLawrence Howard, MD, of Jamesburg, NJ. Beloved husband of Mildred (Midi) Mendelson Lief cherished brother of J. Kermit and Evelyn, the late Muriel Ross. Devot ed father of Dr. Philip and Edna Dr. Jonathan and Barbara and Dr Peter; loving grandfather of Mi chael,Arny and Joshua. Funeral Temple Anshe Emeth New Brunswick, Thursday Noon.

title: Pittsburgh's Rating Cut
description: The Standard & Poor's Corporation lowered its rating of Pittsburgh bonds yesterday to A from AA. The onenotch reduction signified that tne rating service now viewed the securities as somewhat more susceptible to adverse developments. S. &P., citing the city's weakened financial condition caused by cutbacks in some Federal revenue, said it was concerned about the prospect of steel plant closings in the area.

title: Orchestrating a Wine Feast
description: IT happens to nearly everyone who appreciates wine. A friend or a business associate sends a bottle as a gift, often an unusual bottle reflecting special consideration by the giver or his wine merchant. You look up its lineage in a wine encyclopedia and discover that the bottle is special indeed. It may not be expensive, but it is somehow unusual, and now comes the challenge: creating an occasion special enough to serve it, for you are reluctant to drink such a wine casually.

title: Cuban Refugees Reach San Juan
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 11 (AP) Honduran freighter arrived here last night with 17 Cuban refugees picked up last week from their small boat between Cuba and Florida. A Coast Guard official said the Cubans reported they had fled Cuba Nov. 29 aboard a 19foot boat and had run out of food when the freighter spotted them last Friday 110 miles southsoutheast of Miami.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: IT'S been creeping up, but so gradually that some can't remember when it wasn't so. Sunday night is no longer washthehair, organizetheweek time. It is, in fact, quite the opposite. In the circles that count in matters such as these, it now the night to go out. Anyone who is at home after 60 Minutes disappears from the tube had better take the phone off the hook and pretend not to be there. Or what? Or paddle in waters outside the social swim, that's what.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, Dec.11, 1979 Petition Filed by:

title: Legislator Challenges Marine Bid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11  Representative Benjamin S. Rosenthal, Democrat of Queens, has challenged the bid by the Hongkong & Shanghai Banking Corporation to acquire New York's Marine Midland Bank, the nation's 13thlargest commercial bank, contending that the acquisition would violate Federal banking laws.

title: Best Buys
description: ALTHOUGH the American consumer now pays 250 percent more for beef than he did in 1950, a smaller portion of his disposable income goes to pay for that hamburger, roast or steak. According to a recent Agriculture Department report, Americans are spending less of their income for food than they have in the past, even though food prices continue to rise about 10 percent each year.

title: Judge Upholds Hutton Penalty
description: A state judge today upheld a $750,000 arbitration award that E.F. Hutton & Company was ordered to pay to Dain Bosworth Inc. for raiding employees from the rival firm. Hutton contested the award on the ground that the fivemember arbitration panel was biased.

title: State Boxing Unit Orders Ambulance at Pro Fights
description: In the first change of its regulations since the death of the middleweight Willie Classen two weeks ago, the State Athletic Commission began a strict policy yesterday of requiring all boxing promoters in the state to have an ambulance standing by for the professional fights they put on.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: The man on your Christmas list probably has a tie and a muffler, so we'll avoid those. Herewith, some other thoughts that might help match the present the man.

title: Prime at 19.5% in Italy
description: ROME, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  Italian banks today announced a threepoint increase to 19.5 percent in their prime lending rates, the interest rate on loans to their most creditworthy borrowers. The increase, effective immediately, follows a threepoint increase in the official bank rate last week and reflects a recent upsurge in Italian inflation.

title: Amateur Winemakers Know
description: TORONTO Wine names like Chateau Rowanwood, Les Quatre Cloches and Cluett's Plonk may not yet reverberate through the musty cellars of professional oenology. But, together, they are fast becoming labels to be reckoned with here. They are private brands made at home by individuals for themselves, their friends and relatives. They are rare wines; sometimes only a few bottles of each remain in existence. And according to some connoisseurs, this is lucky for everyone concerned.

title: Inventories Up by 1% In October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP)  Inventories of the nation's businesses increased in October by $4.2 billion, or 1 percent, as sales rose by 1 percent. The dual increases could indicate a rise in business confidence.

title: Notes on People
description: Since she practically built a career out of following Mary Martin in Broadway hits, Martha Wright, back on a New York stage for the first time in 17 years, is not surprised when people come backstage and talk about South Pacific and The Sound of Music.

title: 30% Rise by OPEC Is Termed Possible
description: ROME, Dec. 11 (AP)  Ren Ortiz, secretary general of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, was reported today to have said that a 30 percent oil price increase was possible at the cartel's meeting in Caracas, Venezuela, next Monday.

title: Soviet Commentary Warns NATO on Missile Decision
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  The Soviet press agency Tass said in a commentary tonight that a decision by North Atlantic Treaty Organization ministers tomorrow in Brussels to produce and deploy a new generation of missiles in Western Europe would destroy the basis for future EastWest talks on mediumrange nuclear missiles.

title: CREDIT MARKETS Bond Prices Decline Faster
description: The slide in the credit markets that began last Friday morning picked up speed yesterday, and bond prices fell sharply. Many Government and corporate issues lost a full point or more, pushed down by signs of strength in the economy and fears of higher oil prices.

title: L.I. Commuters Overcome Traffic Jams and Vandalism
description: Adapting to life without the Long Island Rail Road, thousands of inconvenienced commuters made their way to work and back again yesterday, triumphing over heavy traffic, jammed subways and vandals who cut tires on seven buses, causing one to have a blowout on the Long Island Expressway.

title: Deaths
description: COMISKEYCharles W. The membership 01 the NYAHMS mourn the loss of their Director Emeritus and express profound sympathy to his family.

title: Cholera Kills 11 in Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 11 (UPI) At least 11 people died and 45 others were hospitalized for cholera in West Java last week. The newspaper Sinar Harspan quoted a doctor at the regional Cibimbing Hospital today as having said that the 11 people died because they suffered from malnutrition caused by cholera.

title: No Default On 2 Iran Loans Seen
description: International banking syndicates, led by the Chase Manhattan Bank, have decided in London not to declare in default two major loans to Iran, according to reports yesterday from a meeting of the banks involved. Both loans had been guaranteed by the former Iranian Government of the Shah.

title: Bolivians End General Strike
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Dec. 11 (Reuters) Bolivians went back to work today after a 24hour general strike in protest against recent economic measures by the Government of the interim President, Lidia Gueiler. Interior Ministry sources said the situation was normal throughout the country, with the exception of some roads in the central highlands of Oruro and Cochabamba which remained blocked by peasant groups.

title: Recipes for a Christmas From the Kitchen
description: Craig Claiborne says that the gifts he can recall most vividly from over the years are the personal ones from friends kitchens. Here are recipes he suggests as homecooked gifts:

title: Mayor Feinstein Apparent Winner In San Francisco Runoff Election
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11 (AP) Mayor Dianne Feinstein, who was appointed after the assassination of George Moscone, appeared to have defeated Supervisor Quentin Kopp tonight in her bid to become the first woman elected to the city's highest office.

title: Khomeini's Rival, in Open Break, Says New Constitution Is Flawed
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 11 Ayatollah Kazem ShariatMadari continued today to resist pressure to disavow the uprising by Turkishspeaking Azerbaijanis in Tabriz and voiced direct criticism of the Islamic Constitution approved in a referendum last week.

title: Rigel Says Budget Gap Talk Could Lead to Strike in City
description: The chief consultant to the labor unions during the city's fiscal crisis sharply criticized the Municipal Assistance Corporation and other fiscal monitors yesterday for continually projecting budget deficits and creating what he said was an atmosphere that might force the city to accept a strike in March by municipal unions.

title: First Contracts Given for a Halley's Comet Mission
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)  The space agency took the first step today toward developing a spacecraft to rendezvous with Halley's Comet in 1985 by awarding contracts to two aerospace companies for the design of new solar electric rocket engines.

title: Blue Period For Single Parents
description: IT was the night before Christmas. And Maggie Prodo, a single parent who lives in Weston, Conn., with her three children, was just about to put a new tricycle under the tree for her youngest when she discovered, to her dismay, that the big box was a mess of jangles  I'd forgotten these things don't come assembled anymore.

title: Market Place
description: SHARES of oil companies with interests in the Avalon Basin of the Atlantic Ocean about 200 miles west of Newfoundland scored gains on the strength of oil well test results released yesterday.

title: Islanders Topple Canadiens by 41
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Dec. 11  Playing as if they were in the final series of the Stanley Cup championship, the Islanders beat the Montreal Canadiens tonight at the Nassau Coliseum, 41.

title: Japan Goal: Lead in Computers
description: MUSASHI, Japan, Dec. 10  There's talk of invading, there's talk of quality dumping  but we don't think we do these things in your markets, said Mikio Obuchi, a key executive of Hitachi.

title: A Federal Court Rules Croatians Can Be Tried on Reduced Charge
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 11 (UPI)  A Federal appeals court ruled today that two Croatian nationalists accused of seizing the West German Consulate in 1978 may be retried only on a reduced charge of imprisonment of foreign officials.

title: The Region
description: TRENTON  Emma Jane Stockton, a 37yearold socialite who was found beaten, stabbed and tortured in her home here last week, was buried yesterday in a family plot in Colonial Memorial Park Cemetery.

title: The Duty of JournalistDiplomats
description: No crisis is complete without a press flap and Iran is no exception. It was bound to happen, given the enormous burden placed on all news organizations since the hostages were seized. In the absence of formal contacts, journalists have become surrogate diplomats; foreign policy is being made live, on the tube. All the while, the cameras transmit jarring images of shrieking mobs, images often staged by Iranians unusually wise to the higher theology of using the media.

title: BMW Lifting U.S. Prices
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11 (AP)  BMW of North America Inc. said today that it was increasing list prices of its 1980 cars by an average of 9 percent. John A. Cook, president, said BMW expected to increase sales of the Germanmade cars by 7 percent to about 37,500 in 1980.

title: Bombing in a Basque Town Hall Is Laid to RightWing Extremists
description: LEZO, Spain, Dec. 11 (UPI)  A plastic bomb, apparently set by rightwing extremists, exploded early today in the doorway of the town hall of Lezo in the northern Basque region.

title: Bandits in India Kill 12 Villagers
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 11 (Reuters) Bandits killed 12 villagers, including 6 women and 3 children, in what the police today described as an apparent revenge raid on a village in India's northern Uttar Pradesh State. They said the gang was probably seeking to avenge the action of villagers who cut off the hand of a bandit leader when they caught him two years ago.

title: U.S.Owned Chateau In Bordeaux Is Sold
description: Chateau Bouscaut, one of the few major Americanowned wine properties in Bordeaux, apparently will return to French ownership under a sale agreement worked out this week.

title: Divergent Demands of 17 Unions A Major Problem in L.I.R.R. Strike
description: Early in the Long Island Rail Road contract dispute, it became clear that one of the major problems would be the divergent demands of the 17 unions.

title: U.S. Is Moving Toward a Decision On Economic Boycott Against Iran
description: BONN. Dec. 11  The United States, after sounding out its major European allies, is moving toward a decision whether to seek international economic sanctions against Iran, a high State Department official said today.

title: A Shooting in Chinatown
description: A 30yearold man was shot in the head around 2:10 A.M. yesterday in front of the Foo Joy restaurant at 13 Division Street, in Chinatown, the police said. He was identified as Wong Hing Chung of 883 Third Avenue. He was taken to Bellevue Hospital in critical condition.

title: Carey Asserts Kennedy Is Not Up to Standard
description: Governor Carey said last night he was disappointed with Senator Edward M. Kennedy's presidential campaign so far but declined to endorse either Mr. Kennedy or President Carter.

title: Pacers' English Has Poetic Touch
description: In restaurants and in hotel rooms, on matchbook covers, napkins and scratch pads, Alex English, an Indiana Pacers forward, often turns to poetry to express his moods.

title: Corporate Reports
description: For periods as shown,(N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (O) Overthecounter.

title: Chess:
description: The ending is generally the most tranquil phase of the game, but a riproaring exception is one that arose in the encounter between Grandmasters Borislav Ivkov of Yugoslavia and Jan Timman of the Netherlands in the Milan Vidmar Memorial Tournament in Bled and Portoroz, Yugoslavia.

title: Mexico's President at Midterm: Oil on Troubled Waters
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 11  Hammer and chisel in hand, President Jos Lpez Portillo stood before a large unsculptured stone titled Mexico. Well, what's going to be? asked a bedraggled peasant. That's what I'd like to know, replied the President. And to one side, a rotund businessman in a top hat added quietly, Me too.

title: 2 Given Death Penalty in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  Two young men have been sentenced to death for taking part in the murder of a policeman in the Byelorussian town of Orsha, the newspaper Sotsialisticheskaya Industriya reported today.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A picture caption in The Times on Monday incorrectly identified the nationality of Abdus Salam, a Nobel Prize winner in physics. He is from Pakistan.

title: Daniel Koshland, 87; Levi Strauss President In BlueJeans Growth
description: SAN MATEO, Calif., Dec. 11 (AP) Daniel E. Koshland, a former president of Levi Strauss & Company who helped to guide the concern in the 1950's and 1960's when blue jeans leaped in popularity around the world, died last night in Mills Memorial Hospital after a long illness. He was 87 years old.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11 (UPI)  Small groups of Soviet dissidents tried to mark Human Rights Day yesterday with silent demonstrations in Moscow and Leningrad, but the police broke up the rallies and detained 15 to 20 people.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: MANY of our food passions are directly related to our favorite childhood foods: From my earliest memory I have been addicted to things that come from the charcuterie: pts, terrines, sausages, and salamis. I believe the reason my region, Burgundy, was wellknown for such things is because pork was traditionally plentiful and cheap. Therefore, it was put to as many good uses as chicken.

title: U.S. Reform Jews to Challenge Israeli Religious Policy
description: The Synagogue Organization of Reform Judaism vowed today to challenge the policy of the Israeli Government that recognizes Orthodox practices as the only official religion and prohibits nonOrthodox rabbis from performing legitimate ceremonies such as weddings, funerals and conversions.

title: Plan for Center Reveals Effort To Adorn Mass
description: Governor Carey, Mayor Koch and officials of the New York State Urban Development Corporation yesterday made public the preliminary architectural nlans for the New York Exposition and Convention Center, the $375 million complex that is expected to rise on a fiveblock site on the West Side of Manhattan.

title: Girding To Fight For Rights Globally
description: I have not yet visited all the people and institutions that fought for my freedom for two and onehalf years. If I have not done so in spite of the fact that I left Argentina toward the end of September, it is because I was left bewildered by my first encounters in TA Aviv_ New York and Washington. I thought everyone expected to experience a moment of happiness, and I was willing to express my gratitude. But they were not interested in my gratitude and there was not much happiness. I found overwhelmingly defeated men.

title: RHODESIA PREPARES TO BE COLONY AGAIN
description: SALISBURY, Zimbabwe Rhodesia, Dec. 11  Blacks and whites met in Parliament today to renounce the rebellion against Britain that the whites declared in 1965, clearing the way for the territory to become a colony again when a British Governor arrives here tomorrow.

title: Private Lives
description: IN order to prove that he hadn't Chosen Sides, he was standing around a salmon mousse on a cold Saturday night in Greenwich Village, after three subways and one anxiety attack, among so many smokers with beards that he might have stumbled upon a road company doing Exodus: Behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed (3:2).

title: Part of Railway Finds a Buyer
description: ST. PAUL, Dec. 11 (AP)  Burlington Northern Inc. said today that would buy significant segments of the Milwaukee Road's railway lines in Montana, Idaho and Washington.

title: Money
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 11, 1979

title: Koch to Name 2 Deputy Mayors To Hospitals Corporation Posts
description: Mayor Koch intends to head off a threatened attempt to overturn his municipal hospitals closing plan by appointing two of his administration's highest officials to the board of directors of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation.

title: Sports Today
description: City College at Jersey City State, 8 P.M. Princeton at Fordham, 8 P.M.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: LEFTISTS CLASH WITH WOMEN IN EL SALVADOR: Smoke rising from a fire near a bus in San Salvador Monday after leftists attacked a gathering of some 10,000 women in a peace march to demand an end to terrorism. At least seven persons were killed during the attack as firebombs were thrown at the peace marchers.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 11 (Reuters) The Bendix Corporation has agreed to acquire the Warner & Swasey Company for cash and stock worth about $245 million, the companies announced today.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: STENMARK TRIUMPHS AGAIN: Ingemar Stenmark of Sweden during his performance in the special slalom at Madonna di Campiglio, Italy. He made up time in the second run and gained his second straight World Cup victory.

title: The City
description: The City Council voted, 34 to 1, with five abstentions, to give the Police Department three more years to reorganize along community district boundaries. The Department of Parks was also given more time to bring local recreation services into conformance with district boundaries.

title: Celeste Holm to Portray Janet Flanner in Show
description: Celeste Holm will present a onewoman show, Paris Was Yesterday, based on the book by Janet Flanner, in a limited engagement from Dec. 19 to Jan. 9 at the Harold Clurman Theater, 412 West 42d Street.

title: Close, Don't Slam, the Budget Door
description: Does Congress need a law to hold Congress spending limits that Congress has already fixed for itself? Representative Robert Giaimo, the chairman the House Budget Committee, thinks so. Why can't Congress just do what it knows it's supposed to do? Well, says Mr. Giaimo, the new budget controls are breaking down. His point is well taken but the law he offers would only make matters worse.

title: Bloomfield Service Tomorrow
description: A memorial service for Harry Bloomfield will be held tomorrow at 4:30 P.M. at the Actors Temple, 339 West 47th Street. Mr. Bloomfield, who died on Nov. 28 in Las Vegas, produced shows on Broadway and in Las Vegas and was an associate of the late Mike Todd.

title: James Buckley Says He Will Run For Ribicoff's Seat in U.S. Senate
description: SHARON, Conn., Dec. 11  Former Senator James L. Buckley of New York, stressing his ties to this picturesque village, where he grew up, announced today that he was a candidate for the Republican nomination for the United States Senate from Connecticut.

title: World Airways Says Employees Have Voted to End Their Walkout
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 11 (AP) World Airways announced tonight that it planned to resume flights as a result of the settlement of a fourmonthold strike against the airline. Details of the settlement were not immediately available.

title: Death Strikes From Dark In Tabriz TV Station Fight
description: TABRIZ, Iran, Dec. 11  Houshang Sanai was buried here last night, a mile from the simple twostory house in which he was born 20 years ago.

title: Poll Finds Carter Leads Kennedy In a Reversal Among Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 For the first time in almost two years, the Gallup poll reported today that President Carter led Senator Edward M. Kennedy in a survey of Democrats across the nation, a dramatic reversal reflecting a sharp jump in public approval of Mr. Carter's performance as President since the onset of the Iranian crisis.

title: Affirmed Takes HorseofYear Honor in a Gallop
description: Affirmed was named yesterday the winner of the Eclipse Award as the horse of the year, a verdict that opened the spigots of praise for thoroughbred racing's first $2 million nurse winner.

title: Bid Made For Canada Papers
description: TORONTO, Dec. 11  Conrad Black, a 35yearold boy wonder with vast business holdings across Canada, has initiated the first of what is expected to become a scrambled series of controversial bids for control of this country's thirdlargest newspaper chain.

title: Saudis Money Reserves Decline, Puzzling West
description: PARIS, Dec. 11  Saudi Arabia, the world's richest oilexporting country, is puzzling Western bankers and monetary officials because it seems to be growing poorer despite recent oil price increases. The country's monetary reserves appear to be steadily declining.

title: Ohio Company Has 8.3% of G.&W.
description: The American Financial Corporation, the Cincinnatibased financial services company, said yesterday that it had bought 8.3 percent of the shares of Gulf and Western Industries for $74 million.

title: Xerox Introduces Two New Systems
description: The Xerox Corporation introduced an office information system yesterday that combines both word processing and a limited amount of data processina in the same terminal.

title: DR. MARVIN IVERSON, PSYCHOLOGIST, DIES
description: Dr. Marvin A. Iverson, a psychologist and the dean of the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences of Adelphi University in Garden City, L.I., died Monday of an aneurysm at Long Island Jewish Hospital in New Hyde Park, L.I. He was 55 years old and lived in East Williston, L.I.

title: Rangers Triumph By 21
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11  In most games, when a goaltender does not allow a goal in the final two periods, he wins. In most games, when a goaltender gives the highscoring New York Rangers only two goals, he wins. Tonight's game was not most games.

title: When Steel Goes Cold
description: WASHINGTON  The permanent layoff of 13,000 workers by United States Steel is the latest reminder of the high cost to America of not having a comprehensive industrial policy. In steel, as in the Chrysler case and recent plant closings in the electronic, shoe, rubber and textile industries, Federal economicpolicy makers treat the corporate convulsions that characterize our industrial decline as separate illnesses requiring separate treatment. Many believe that the cure for steel's troubles is higher import restrictions, and for Chrysler, Government loan guarantees. The result is a choice, on the one hand, between protectionism or subsidies that can encourage inefficiency and, on the other, the wholesale destruction of major industries, their suppliers and the surrounding communities.

title: Pacers Beat Knicks In Overtime, 124122
description: Alex English, a selfprokilaimed Knick nemesis, scored a foulline jumper with 46 seconds remaining, while under pressure from Toby Knight, to provide the Indiana Pacers with a 124122 overtime victory over the Knicks last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Miners Allow Union Leader to Name His Successor
description: DENVER, Dec. 11The unity leadership of Sam Church Jr., who became president of the troubled United Mine Workers of America barely a month ago, continued to roll today like coal pouring off a conveyor belt.

title: 14 in City Relive Their Nobel Day
description: With candlelight and pleasure glowing in their distinguished faces, 14 Americans who had won Nobel Prizes over four decades celebrated Monday's Nobel Day at the Swedish Consulate on Park Avenue. They shared a traditional holiday smorgasbord and memories of warm December welcomes at their own award ceremonies in Stockholm.

title: TOKYO AIDES DEFEND IMPORTS OF IRAN OIL
description: TOKYO, Dec. 11  Japanese officials talked today of possible future cuts in oil imports from Iran, but both they and the nation's newspapers complained that the United States did not understand Japanese needs when it accused the Government here of undercutting American efforts to free the 50 hostages in Teheran.

title: British Governor Flies to Rhodesia Without a Truce
description: LONDON, Dec. 11  Lord Soames, the new British Governor of Zimbabwe Rhodesia, left for Salisbury today to take up his delicate assignment.

title: World Gold
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 11, 1979

title: Tenneco in Plan to Buy Insurer for $760 Million
description: Tenneco Inc., the diversified energy company based in Houston, will pay about $50 a share in stock, or the equivalent of nearly $760 million, for the Southwestern Life Corporation of Dallas under terms of a tentative agreement announced by both companies yesterday.

title: Efforts for Restarting Jersey Nuclear Plant Are Delayed Further
