Animated and talkative, their gestures and steps were punctuated with giggles and typical stage talk.

title: ART VIEW
description: With the opening four days ago of an exhibition called William and Mary and Their House: The Dutch Royal Collections, 15281979, the Pierpont Morgan Library has once again mounted a major show of exceptional interest both to scholars and the public. Paintings by Rembrandt, Holbein and Van Dyck; drawings by Guercino, Rubens and Annibale Carracci, and an extraordinary set of early 18thcentury silver furniture are but a few of the rare items included in this wideranging survey of works of art never before seen together outside of the Netherlands.

title: The 70's: America Learns To Expect a Little Less
description: Looking back 15 years or so, it is hard to recall the 1960's as anything but a decade of dissent and social violence. Vietnam, race riots, drugs and the youth revolt shook American society to its foundations. Yet this same decade, almost from beginning to end, saw unbroken prosperity, the longest economic expansion in the nation's history.

title: Mailbox: Balanced Schedule Hurts N.H.L.
description: To the Sports Editor: I am in direct opposition to the National Hockey League's balanced schedule as well as the expanded playoff system. It appears that the effects are militating against further progress of hockey popularity. Attendance figures in places such as Atlanta and Pittsburgh seem to bear this out.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE Europa, a restaurant in Harrison, has been a popular eating place for the last seven years. Five months ago, the owners of this Hudson County establishment, John Bezerra and Luis Leren, realizing there was need for a good Spanish restaurant at the shore, opened the Europa South in Point Pleasant Beach.

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: BLOOMFIELD (Bloomfield College, Franklin and Fremont Streets)  A Christmas Carol. Daily, 8:30 P.M. Opens Wednesday (through December). $3.50$5.50; students and the elderly, $2.50$4.50; group rates. (201) 4297662. Westminster Theater.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS
description: At 64, Norman Cousins, longtime literary figure as editor of the Saturday Review, longtime activist in behalf of world government and other causes, currently lecturer at the University of California at Los Angeles's School of Medicine, has reached the Best Seller List with a book about a very personal matter: the will to live and the role it plays in recovery from serious illness.

title: Flyers Run Streak to 26 Games
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 15 (AP) Bob Dailey and Rick MacLeish scored thirdperiod goals to lift Philadelphia to a 32 victory over the Buffalo Sabres tonight, extending the Flyers' unbeaten string to 26 National Hockey League games.

title: A Lost Comic Opera by Sullivan
description: For fans of light opera, the discovery of a lost comic opera by Sir Arthur Sullivan is cause for jubilation. After 90 years of oblivion, the manuscript score of Sullivan's The Zoo resurfaced at an auction in 1966, and now the D'Oyly Carte Opera company has recorded the first professional performance. It is coupled with Sullivan's first comic opera, Cox and Box (1866, libretto by F. C. Burnand), on a new London Records release that generously presents over 70 minutes of music on a single disk. The Zoo turns out to be a substantial score that can hold its own in the company of the willknown Savoy operas.

title: In the U.S. Virgin Islands It's Festival Time Three Times a Year
description: Visitors to the United States Virgin Islands can join In parades of dancers on 18foot stilts prancing to the beat of calypso music at three major festivals'; the Christmas Festival on St Croix, carnival time in early spring on St. Thomas and in July on St. John.

title: When the Party Said My Father Was a Spy I Believed He Must Be Guilty
description: STALIN, born 100 years ago on Dec. 21 seems now to belong to another age. More than a quarter century has passed since he died in 1953. More than 20 years have gone by since Nikita S. Khrushchev denounced his crimes in 1956 and briefly permitted the country to learn that millions of its most loyal citizens had died in two decades of Stalinist terror.

title: CONNECTICUT GUIDE
description: The Clockwork Repertory Theater, 158 Main Street, Thomaston, is offering a 19thcentury environment for its production of A Christmas Carol, playing Wednesday at 2 P.M. and Thursday through Saturday at 8:15. Adapted by Harold Pantely, the producer, from the Dickens novel, it may well be the only live treatment in Connecticut geared to an adult audience and faithful to the original story acid dialogue.

title: Future Events
description: Dec. 18  If your Russian's rusty, the above means, Bottoms Up! Quaff a glass of cheer at the New York apartment of State Senator William H. Hernstadt, a Nevada Democrat, and his wife, Judith, who open their home here to other supporters of the

title: Disaster for 2 Yachts in Atlantic
description: The two yachts were a study in contrasts. One was a sleek 57foot blackhulled sloop, a stateoftheart racing machine named Desperado. The other was a 50foot ketch from another era, built of wood in Spain 27 years ago and named Shadow.

title: The World
description: The opposition attacked his austerity proposals as the budget that stole Christmas and last week Prime Minister Joe Clark of Canada discovered the perils of running against Santa Claus in December. After only six and a half months in power, his minority Progressive Conservative Government lost a confidence vote in Parliament. New general elections will be held Feb. 18.

title: St. John's Hands Rutgers First Loss, 7564
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Dec. 15 For a little more than a half tonight, the St. John's basketball team could do little right against Rutgers, missing shots, passing inaccurately and rebounding poorly.

title: CUOMO ASKS REVIEW OF MURDER VERDICT
description: The gunfire lasted less than 10 seconds, but when it was over, a Westchester County deputy sheriff and a state prison inmate were dead. Another deputy sheriff and two prisoners lay wounded.

title: Music Notes: The Pro Arte Story
description: One of New York City's better neighboring choral groups is the Pro Arte Chorale, which has its base in Ridgewood, N.J. It developed a reputation beyond state boundaries back in 1972, when it came to Manhattan to give a concert version of Berlioz's Les Troyens, which is roughly five hours long. At that time it was under the direction of John Nelson, who is now conductor of the Indianapolis Symphony. Taking over from Mr. Nelson, Roger Nierenberg proved himself a worthy successor when he led the group in Haydn's The Creation in Avery Fisher Hall last year. They are coming back next Sunday to Fisher Hall, this time with Bach's Christmas Oratorio. As everyone knows, this is a collection of six cantatas, which makes for an overly long work in the concert hall.

title: F.B.I. Captures a Most Wanted
description: FORT SMITH, Ark., Dec. 15 (UPI) Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation surrounded a trailer court yesterday and, in a gun battle, wounded and captured a man on their list of 10 most wanted fugitives. The bureau said that George Alvin Bruton, 37 years old, a native of Swarm, Mo., was seriously wounded in the exchange of gunfire. He is wanted on a string of charges including burglary and murder.

title: Best Sellers
description: The listings above are based on computerprocessed sales figures from 1,400 bookstores in every region of the United States.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: TROUBLESHOOTING a balky doorbell or doorchime circuit, either because the unit works only spasmodically or not at all, is one type of electricalrepair job that any doityourselfer can handle safely and easily. This is because the low voltage involved poses no danger of fire or serious shock.

title: A Waste Of Farmland
description: FOLLOWING the 1979 harvest, Campbell Soups Inc., one of the state's few remaining food processors, announced that it no longer would buy tomatoes from New Jersey growers. Apparently, it is cheaper for the company to buy in Western and MiddleWestern states, process there and then ship the product to New Jersey for packaging and distribution.

title: THEATER
description: IN the history of the musical theater, one can find lyricists of greater wit and humor, those with a gift for more complicated rhyme schemes than Oscar Hammerstein 2d. And many people will name lyricists whose works they prefer to his, but I doubt that anyone can disagree with the idea of a tribute to Oscar Hammerstein. Offhand, I can think of no other lyricist whose work covered such a time span of musical theater development. His words have graced such historic works as Rose Marie and The Desert Song. He joined with Richard Rodgers to change the look of musical comedy permanently with Oklahoma! Showboat, Sunny, and The Sound of Music. All boast lyrics by Oscar Hammerstein. Such greats as Sigmund Romberg, Vincent Youmans, Jerome Kern and Richard Rodgers all added their music to his words.

title: IRANIANS ARE OUR BROTHERS
description: On Nov. 23, 19 days after hostages were seized at the American Embassy in Teheran, Oriana Fallaci, the Italian journalist, began what would be a twoday interview with Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the revolutionary Moslem leader of Libya. Believing that not only America out me wrote west is tied and blindfolded in that embassy, Miss Fallaci sought in her conversation to probe the intentions of the Arab bloc in the expanding crisis.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 9 A.M. (Channel 2) Sunday Morning: Impact of crisis on four Iranians; Too Tall Jones; Ivan Albright, artist; what really happened on the River Kwai ; report on two survivors of the Orphan Trains of the early 1900's.

title: Kennedy Library: A New Hit in Boston
description: For 150 years, history in Boston has ended with the American Revolution, captured in the stately brick and mortar Faneuil Hall, the Old North Church and the Bunker Hill Monument. But recently these tourist attractions have taken a back seat to a modern concrete and glass memorial on Columbia Point at the edge of Dorchester Bay, three and a halt miles south of the Boston Common. The John Fitzgerald Kennedy Library, architecturally a sharp

title: Robinson to Be Honored At Opera Patrons' Dinner
description: Francis Robinson, for many years associated with the Metropolitan Opera, will be honored by the Met today at the annual Benefactor Patron Dinner. The dinner will be held on the stage of the opera house in the Act II setting of Strauss's Der Rosenkavalier, a lavish white and silver reception hall.

title: U.S. Urges Iran Sanctions, But Whom Will They Hurt?
description: PARIS  As the American hostages in Teheran began their seventh week of captivity, the United States was drafting plans for international economic reprisals. However, on the record of past attempts, many experts in Europe doubted that sanctions could be made to work, even if the United Nations Security Council agreed to invoke them. Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance outlined Washington's proposals for economic sanctions against Iran  if the hostages are not released soon  when he met last week with foreign ministers of Western Europe and Japan, and a senior official said afterward that they had promised virtually universal support.

title: Connecticut/This Week
description: BETHEL  Fourth annual Christmas Show, works by artists from the area, special crafts section. Bethel Gallery, 186 Greenwood Ave. Wednesday through Sunday, noon to 5:30 through Jan. 19. Phone 7436644.

title: Rangers Blow Lead, Lose to Capitals, 54
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 15  The Rangers were supposed to know all about taking games too lightly. After finally shaking a long slump, they were supposed to have learned that it takes a 60minute effort to win a hockey game.

title: It's Not Just a Job
description: YOUNG people entering today's job market are reputed to be less idealistic and more oriented toward making it than those of a decade ago. It comes as somewhat of a surprise, then, to en

title: The Joyful Sounds of Christmas
description: TWO hundred years after the English and Dutch established themselves on America's eastern shores, the Russians began coming from the west. Through parts of China and Japan, across the Bering Strait to Alaska in the mid1800's, south to San Francisco and eastward to New York and New England they brought the Orthodox Church and its rich heritage of a cappella music.

title: A Banner Year for Batteries
description: Without them the Cookie Time Clock Radio would cease to tick and bake and the Sonic Fazer's mass inertia rays would go dead. The Incredible Hulk wouldn't have the strength to break through his rock cage and there would be a traffic jam on the Snoopy Speedway. Yes Virginia, this is a Christmas for batteries.

title: Small Colleges Shine in the East
description: Although Hugh Green is generally considered the best college football player in the East this season and one of the best in the nation, it may be wrong to say that the junior defensive lineman at Pittsburgh was any more valuable to his team than Gus Sunseri was to the CarnegieMellon squad. Sunseri, a free safety, led his team in tackles and made eight interceptions during the season.

title: Fulfilling TV's Obligation to New Jersey
description: IN 1961, when Channel 13 (WNET) in Newark became an educational television station, its new owner, the Educational Broadcasters Corporation, asked the Federal Communications Commission for a waiver to move the main studios to New York City. The corporation promised then that it also would maintain studios in Newark.

title: Courtney Anne Miller Fiancee of John Regan Rhorer Jr.
description: Mr. and Mrs. Donald James Miller of Lexington, Ky., formerly of Bronxville, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Courtney Anne Miller, to John Regan Rhorer Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Rhorer of Frankfort, Ky.

title: SHAH EXHORTS IRAN TO LET HOSTAGES GO
description: The Shah of Iran, Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, last night called on the people of Iran to immediately demand the release of the American hostages being held at the United States Embassy in Teheran and issued a blistering attack on Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, Iran's new ruler, his spokesman said.

title: Brandt Panel Weighs Pact by Rich and Poor Lands
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  An international commission headed by former Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany is weighing a proposal calling on oilproducing and oilconsuming nations to reach an accord to assure their economic stability and development.

title: Britain Ends Rhodesia Peace Talks Without Reaching CeaseFire Pact
description: LONDON, Dec. 15Britain today declared a formal end to the Rhodesia conference, without a ceasefire agreement, and the Salisbury delegation to the talks left for home to begin its election campaign.

title: Peter Holmes to Wed Elizabeth S. Schnur
description: The engagement of Elizabeth Sue Schnur to Peter Stone Holmes has been announced by her parents, Warren L. Schnur of West New York, N.J., and Dr. Harriet F. Schnur of New York and New Milford, Conn. Mr. Holmes is a son of Mr. and Mrs. William Holmes of Fayetteville, N.Y. The wedding is planned for next September.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: New York City lawyer Martin Monas spent three and onehalf uneventful hours at the St. Moritz Hotel, in midtown Manhattan, on the evening of Nov. 29, while hundreds of bidders waged a battle of bankbooks at the public auction sale of the John Work Garrett coin collection, Mr. Monas sat in the back of the room, seemingly above the storm, solving the crossword puzzle from that day's edition of The New York Times.

title: Dustin Hoffman 1 Vs. Nearly Everybody
description: The hero of Kramer vs. Kramer is an ambitious advertising executive whose wife takes off in search of independence, leaving him alone to raise the 6yearold son he hardly knows. Dustin Hoffman, who plays

title: STAGE VIEW
description: I normally dislike making any distinction between the theatergoer and the serious theatergoer. I don't truly believe in two separate breeds, though it's obvious enough that there's a larger immediate audience for musicals and light comedies than there is for somber investigations of the woes of the world. My own conviction is that the musicalcomedy buff and the man who hurries all the way to Brooklyn to see what Peter Handke's been up to are, really, one and the same person. In each instance, he's taking care of his preferences first. If he is a theatergoer, though, he does limit his horizons arbitrarily. His apetite grows. The patron who's been to Annie, and been pleased by Annie, will very probably be lured into The Elephant Man before he's through, and I can well remember seeing an avowed disciple of Brecht sneaking into a performance of No, No, Nanette. Theatergoers, like normal people, are serious some of the time and, some of the time, not. But they don't divide up into species.

title: Maura Anne Mulcahy Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. James P. Mulcahy of Short Hills, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Maura Anne Mulcahy, to Dennis Kelly Lade, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas M. Lade of Convent, N.J.

title: Births
description: Larry and Randy (nee Epstein) Austin joyfully welcome David Christopher's sister, Lauren Elizabeth, December 12, 1979. Proud grandparents are Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Epstein of Scarsdale NY and Mr. & Mrs. William Austin of Victoria BC. Proud greatgrandfather is Mr. Samuel Joseph of NYC

title: A Cottage Industry On the Distaff Side
description: WHEN Ann Williams was offered a ewe lamb as a gift in 1964, she decided she could raise it along with her 2yearold daughter. A volunteer teacher at the Westport Nature Museum, Mrs. Williams knew enough about animals to raise her lamb successfully and even to risk shearing it a year later.

title: Laborites in Commons Call For Resignation Of Churchill Grandson
description: LONDON, Dec. 15 (UPI)  Opposition Laborites today demanded the resignation of Winston Churchill, grandson of Britain's wartime leader, after he admitted involvement with the former wife of a Saudi Arabian multimillionaire arms dealer. They also demanded a security investigation.

title: Ohio State 79, Holy Cross 63
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Dec. 15 (AP)  Kelvin Ransey, a senior guard, scored in double figures for the 68th consecutive game as unbeaten Ohio State rolled to its fifth victory tonight, a 7963 romp over Holy Cross.

title: Europe Space Agency Fails to Loft a Rocket On Its First Test Flight
description: The engines fired briefly, then shut down and the new rocket went nowhere yesterday, frustrating Western Europe's plans to inaugurate its own independent space launching capability in competition with the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Iranians Outside U.S. Embassy Seem Taken Off Guard by News
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Sunday, Dec. 16 A cold driving rain fell on the United States Embassy here last night, shining on the asphalt of the floodlit compound and running in small rivers along the gutters of the street outside.

title: Five Killed in Oregon Crash
description: SALEM, Ore., Dec. 15 (AP)  Five persons were killed early today in a twocar collision on Oregon Route 22 about 10 miles east of Salem, the state police said. The identities of the victims were not immediately released.

title: Wisconsin 57, Marquette 56
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 15 (UPI)  Wes Matthews scored 17 points and blocked a shot with one second remaining as Wisconsin upset Marquette, 5756, tonight for its first victory at the Milwaukee Arena in 12 years.

title: POINTS OF VIEW
description: When an executive leaves the sanctuary of his job to find employment elsewhere, he faces a situation that he has undoubtedly heard about and almost certainly fears. He becomes part of the myth about unemployed executives; namely, if he isn't working, he isn't wanted.

title: New York Asks Connecticut Aid on Tolls
description: SEEKING an additional source of funds to pay for rejuvenating Westchester County's parkways, New York State has made an unusual request of Connecticut: It has asked that state to collect an additional 25 cents at the Greenwich toll plaza of the Merritt Parkway and give it to New York.

title: The Visitor From Iran
description: I FIRST met Hassan in the summer of 1978. The tall, gangly young Iranian with the jetblack hair and sad eyes had been sent to us because I was a counselor for a studentexchange program and he was in trouble, although he didn't know it.

title: Afghan Says No Soviet Troops Are Involved in War With Rebels
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 15 (AP) An Afghanistan official said reports that Soviet combat troops are fighting alongside Afghan forces against Moslem insurgents are a lie spread by the Western media.

title: FOOD
description: BEHIND the pink and white gingham curtains in the storefront window of Just Desserts in Glen Cove are a number of items that make for delectable holiday giving.

title: Realty News
description: Toys R Us, a retail chain, has leased a 90,000csquarefoot office building in Rochelle, N.J., for 17 years at at aggregate rent of more than $11 million.

title: A Policeman Is Slain On 2d Job as a Guard In a Jersey Restaurant
description: A police officer, off duty but in uniform working as a guard at a fast food restaurant in Hillside, N.J., died early yesterday, three hours after he was shot during a robbery attempt.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE outside of a restaurant does not always adequately telegraph what to expect inside, and that is the case at Fife n Drum in Kent. The name and sign outside the fieldstone and barnred shingled onestory building evoke the possibility of early Americana. Inside, the main dining

title: Requiem for a Middleweight: Willie Classen's Life and Death
description: IN the ancient office of the State Athletic Commission on lower Broadway, down a hall littered with containers of cold coffee and ashtrays full of cigar butts, there is a back room where green file cabinets bulge with the accumulation of paper about New York's fighters  their electroencephalograms and electrocardiograms, police records and boxing records, notices of suspension and expired licenses with dimestore photographs attached.

title: Buses Fill Void For Commuters
description: IT was last May, in the midst of the gasoline shortage, that Long Island officials got together and began planning for a transporta- tion emergency. However, it was not gasoline, but a strike on the Long Island Rail Road, that put their regional plans to the first test.

title: O.J. Goes Out With Style
description: In the autumn of his discontent, O.J. Simpson could have sulked or griped. After all, he was the celebrity who had announced he was closing out a glorious career, not the new coach. The public would have sympathized with him. But when Bill Walsh of the San Francisco 49ers benched him six weeks ago, Orenthal James

title: DANCE VIEW
description: ANNA KISSELGOFF

title: Letters to the Travel Editor
description: Paul Lewis's article, Oslo Honors the Vikings, Old and New (Travel Section, Nov. 25), provides a useful guide to Oslo's museums and other attractions. However, in his list of museums he did not mention the University of Oslo's Collection of National Antiquities, which this year is celebrating its sesquicentennial.

title: ANTIQUES
description: THE Hunterdon County woods are thick here, the glens sometimes narrow and winding. The road follows a stream between the hills, and you have a good chance of seeing deer or perhaps people on horseback.

title: Whitney Museum Plans Jan Matulka Retrospective
description: The Whitney Museum of American Art will present the first retrospective of Jan Matulka, a Czechoslovak painter whose styles ranged from Cubist abstractions to precisionist cityscapes. Approximately 65 paintings, drawings and prints made between 1916 and 1938 will be on view from Tuesday through Feb. 24.

title: Iraq Charges Iran Lied To Distract Attention From Internal Trouble
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 15  Iraq accused Iran today of waging a campaign of lies against it in an effort to divert attention from Iranian domestic troubles.

title: A Time to Sleep, A Time to Struggle
description: Now it is almost winter, the time of the long sleep for much of nature's handiwork. In the ground, under bark, sheltered in cocoons and egg cases, hibernating in burrows and crevices, many creatures are in a veritable state of suspended animation.

title: Stan Hack, 70, Played Third Base for the Cubs
description: FRANKLIN GROVE, Ill., Dec. 15 (AP)  Stan Hack, the Chicago Cubs' third baseman from 1932 to 1948 and a .301 hitter over a 16year playing career, died today at a health center here after an extended illness.

title: Citizens' Revolt
description: Nathaniel Benchley is the father of Peter Benchley, best. selling combiner of sharks and water, and the son of. Robert Benchley, bonmotting imbiber of scotch and water. He writes

title: An Idle Look at Fads to Come: Tap Water, Fat Food, Inertia
description: Bill Blass, and others, have no doubt that the decade to come will engender not only major changes in life style but also a whole crop of both serious and ephemeral fads. But Mr. Blass concedes that it's going to be pretty hard to surpass some of the things that could have happened during the 1970's.

title: Coast Hearing to Study Evidence That May Free ExBlack Panther
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 15 (UPI) Judge Kathleen Parker of Superior Court delayed a ruling yesterday on whether Elmer Pratt, a former Black Panther militant, should be released on bail, but set in motion a procedure to determine whether there should be a new trial.

title: Latter TO THE EDITOR
description: Betty Friedan's article on feminism and the 1980's was to put it kindly  strange (Feminism Takes a New Turn, Nov. 18). Feminists are indeed concerned about the family but not, as the news media constantly suggest, about turning 30 and being childless, and not, as Mrs. Friedan has been insisting for several years now, about how to maintain our wondrous equality, which we have already achieved, according to her.

title: Syracuse 31, McNeese State 7
description: SHREVEPORT, La., Dec. 15 (AP) Joe Morris, a tailback, rushed for 155 yards, a bowl record, to lead Syracuse to a 317 victory over previously undefeated McNeese State in the Independence Bowl tonight.

title: Fabienne Mander, Michael Edmeades To Be Wed Jan. 19
description: Theodore L. Mander of New York and Amenia, N.Y., and Elizabeth B. Mander of Southbury, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Fabienne Mander, to Michael David Edmeades. He is the son of Mrs. A.W. Edmeades of Oxfordshire, England, and the late Colonel Edmeades, Royal Artillery, retired.

title: United Press International
A Dr. Strangelove of the Mind
description: IMAGINE the biographer's plight: Sir Cyril Burt (18831971), Britain's most distinguished psychologist, dies, the first of his discipline ever to have been knighted. Prof. Leslie Hearnshaw of Liverpool University delivers the eulogy in customary fashion, sympathetic and respectful. The professor, solid and careful, then accepts the bereaved sister's invitation to write Sir Cyril's biography.

title: Susan Zwanger Betrothed to Dr. Steven L. Mendelsohn
description: Dr. and Mrs. Jerome Zwanger of Massapequa Park, L.I., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Susan Zwanger, to Dr. Steven L. Mendelsohn, son of Dr. and Mrs. Morris A. Mendelsohn of Pittsburgh. A wedding is planned in June.

title: Michigan 69, Dayton 54
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Dec. 15 (AP)Led by Mike McGee's 18 points, Michigan downed Dayton, 6959, today and raised its record to 51. Dayton suffered its first loss after four victories.

title: OneRoom Schoolhouse Surviving After 100 Years
description: SHILOH, Mich., Dec. lb (AP)  I Just think they learn more, says Barbara Beamon, who has sent five children to a oneroom wooden schoolhouse painted fireengine red.

title: FOUR BALLOONISTS DIE AS CRAFT BURSTS: Policemen in Davie, Fla., trying to reconstruct the events that led to the death of four balloonists who jumped from their burning craft over the Rolling Hill Golf Course. Balloon apparently brushed against power lines, exploded and plunged to earth.
State Asks For a Toll in Connecticut
description: SEEKING an additional source of funds to pay for rejuvenating Westchester County's parkways, New York State has made an unusual request of Connecticut: It has asked that state to collect an additional 25 cents at the Greenwich toll plaza of the Merritt Parkway and give it to New York.

title: D'Amato Senate Bid Puzzles Politicians
description: HIS Senate trial balloon launched, Hempstead Town's Presiding Supervisor, Alfonse M. D'Amato, has already started making appearances around the state in an effort to demonstrate that he could be a viable candidate for the United States Senate, particularly if his fellow Republican, Senator Jacob K. Javits, does not seek a fifth term.

title: Miss Austin Turns Back Mrs. King, 63, 26, 61
description: TOKYO, Dec. 15 (AP)  Tracy Austin beat Billie Jean King, 63, 26, 61, today in the semifinals of a $200,000 tennis tournament.

title: DINING OUT
description: LAMASCOTTE, in Commack, one of western Suffolk County' better restaurants, is small, solidly established, professional and thoroughly French. We first reviewed it a few years ago when it was still quite new. Several recent dinners indicate that it has satisfactorily weathered both its popularity and the passaRe of time.

title: Major News
description: When the Carter Administration allowed Mohammed Riza Pahlevi to enter the United States on Oct. 22 for medical treatment, it was with the understanding that he would leave as soon as his health allowed. Yesterday, the Shah carried out his part of the bargain, flying from an Air Force hospital in Texas to Panama, which, the White House said, had shown humanitarian and statesmanlike qualities by accepting a guest less than welcome almost everywhere else.

title: G.O.P. Jarred by '80 Phone Costs
description: DETROIT, Dec. 15  The Republican National Committee and the major television networks are fighting a proposal by the Michigan Bell Telephone Company to charge $400 for each telephone line installed at the Republican National Convention here next July.

title: Study Group on Slayings of King And John Kennedy Is Disbanding
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI)  The Assassination Information Bureau, a nonprofit investigative body that has concentrated on the assassinations of President Kennedy and the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. since 1972, says it has lost its reason for being.

title: New Drive to Find Adoptive Parents
description: THE doors of Pace University's campus in White Plains were open to two public meetings recently. One was concerned with children needing adoptive homes; the other focused on Cambodia's homeless families. Cambodia attracted the larger audience.

title: Dear Folks, It Was a Weerd Year
description: DEAR Roberta and Larry, I know you're all champing at the bit waiting for our annual holiday card. The news from here couldn't be better.

title: Gilbert Perlman Fianc Of Betsy Robin Erlich
description: The engagement of Betsy Robin Erlich to Gilbert E. Perlman, son of Annette Perlman of New York and the late Michael G. Perlman, has been announced by the future bride's mother, Mrs. Alvin L. Erlich, also of New York.

title: Billy and Bowie
description: As written by the founding fathers, the First Amendment to the Constitution of the United States provides that Congress shall make no law  abridging the freedom of speech. As written, the injunction applies only to Congress, not to Bowie Kuhn or Lee MacPhail or George Steinbrenner. However, it has been fairly well es-

title: Rockefeller Center's Big Profits
description: A 4yearold visitor from New Mexico gawked at the gigantic Christmas tree in Rockefeller Center and the gaily clad skaters gliding by behind it. Is this where Santa Claus lives? he asked his mother.

title: DINING OUT
description: GIVEN the diversity of Italian cuisine, it is good to find Westchester restaurants that specialize in the dishes of some particular part of Italy. Emilio in Harrison, newly opened and interesting, has a kitchen that focuses on the north. The names of its dishes, in fact, read like an atlas of northern Italy, with references to Florence, Portofino, Genoa, San Remo, Verona, Lombardi, the Piedmont.

title: Situation in Iran Lends a Note of Urgency
description: IT could have been just another academic conference devoted to abstract principles of foreign policy and analyses of regional economic Dower. But the events in Iran

title: Prior Restraint
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Prior restraint is alive and kicking in American universities.

title: 3,000 Flee After MillionGallon Gasoline Tank Explodes Near Detroit
description: TAYLOR, Mich., Dec. 15  An early morning explosion at a petroleum storage area in this Detroit suburb today turned a 1.2 milliongallon gasoline storage tank into a ball of flame and forced about 3,000 people to flee their homes.

title: Police and Prosecutors Will Discuss Fatality By Toy Plane at Shea
description: The death of a New Hampshire man, fatally injured when a two-foot-long model airplane crashed into a football crowd at Shea Stadium last Sunday, is to be discussed tomorrow at a meeting of Queens detectives and members of the District Attorney's office.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: ARDMORE, Ireland  In addition to coarse japes and 1 toldyouso's from male chauvinists in all political parties, serious thinking among the political professionals has been set in motion by an publicopinion poll published at midweek that certainly provides the most interesting light shed on Britain since last summer's general election. Since it concerns women in political power, it may even be scanned with interest in New Delhi and Chicago.

title: Radio
description: 77:30 A.M., WBLS: Tenant Survival Program.

title: CAMERA
description: The use of photography in the book publishing business has expanded considerably in recent years. Public taste has been cultivated  mostly by television  to the point of demanding immediate communication. As a result, photographs are used more and more as instantimpact illustrations

title: Inflation Crimps Holiday Sales
description: WITH the holiday buying season nearing its peak, many Long Island businessmen are predicting a good year, but are noting the effects of inflation.

title: Iwo Jima: Isolated Post for Americans and Japanese
description: IWO JIMA, Japan  From the air the famous island is just an iregular green blotch on an empty sea, girdled with white where the surf splashes ceaselessly over the beaches of pulverized black lava.

title: ART
description: THE New Jersey division of the Women's Caucus for Art has mounted several shows in recent times. Women in Art is the first in a projected line of annual juried exhibitions.

title: Deaths
description: BLUMBERGJanet, beloved wife of Morton. Devoted mother of Nancy and John Betuel. Dear daughter of the late Goldie and Emanuel Jacobsohn. Services Tuesday 11:30am at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Avenue at 81 Street. In lieu of flowers,contributions may be made to Saint Rose's Home, 71 Jackson Street, New York 10002

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: Massmarket paperbacks are softcover books sold at newsstands, variety stores and supermarkets, as well as in bookstores. This listing is based on computerprocessed reports from bookstores and representative wholesalers with more than 40,000 outlets across the United States.

title: Visitors Can View Yuletides of Yore
description: CRISTMAS at home in Connecticut is always something special. But this year there are special moments at public places as well  in Mystic Seaport and in Hartford.

title: ANTIQUES
description: IT is the week before Christmas and all through the rambling old ButlerMcCook homestead on Main Street, the last 18thcentury residence in downtown Hartford, there are echoes and aromas of Christmas past.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: A onewoman show by Bette Midler, the pop singer. Robert Palmer: Miss Midler has lots of lungpower and an underwhelming amount of tasteHer new show reveals some hithterto unsuspected vocal subtleties  but she still tends to reduce everything she gets her hands on to showbiz tinsel. At the Majestic, 247 W. 44th St. (2460730)

title: POSTAL WORKER DIES AFTER A JOB INJURY
description: A 25-year-old mail handler from New Jersey was killed yesterday, apparently after becoming trapped in a conveyor belt at the United States Postal Service's New York Bulk and Foreign Mail Center in Jersey City. Postal officials said the cause of death was being investigated.

title: It's Time to Solve the Playoff Puzzle
description: In the National Football League today the results of seven games will sort out most  but not all  of the playoff positions. It will take the final regularseason game tomorrow night between Denver and San Diego to complete the matches for the 10team postseason tournament that begins next Sunday.

title: Around the Nation
description: PEORIA, Ill., Dec. 15 (AP)  Negotiators came to terms late tonight on a new contract between the United Automobile Workers and the Caterpillar Tractor Company, ending the longest strike ever against the heavy machinery manufacturer.

title: Patients' Relatives Fight Nursing Home
description: THE Central New Jersey Jewish Home for the Aged sits on a quiet road in rural Somerset, in Somerset County. It appears attractive, sedate and dignified.

title: OneStop Service Is Proposed For Some FoodStamp Seekers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI)  The Department of Agriculture proposed today that onestop service be provided for elderly and disabled Americans applying for food stamps.

title: Alliance of Agencies Seeks to Aid Youths
description: EVE BLOCK, executive director of the Youth Advocacy Program, a privately financed, voluntary agency, spoke last week of a boy she called John, who, for lack of social services, repeatedly committed misdemeanors so that he could go to jail and have a bed and three meals a day.

title: Health
description: Frank Lloyd Wright called New York City a volcanic crater of blind, confused human forces. Erich Fromm said it nurtured schizoid or schizophrenic qualities. The attitude is as

title: VIEWS OF SPORT
description: IN a remote corner of a small Catholic college campus, nestled among the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, stands a huge, awkward structure. The worn, ghostly gray color outside is in direct contrast to the bustling activity it houses. The quonset but gymnasium is the home of many Mount St. Mary's teams, one of which is a women's basketball team, and I am the coach.

title: Temple Wins Garden State Bowl by 2817
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec. 15  The second Garden State Bowl, the first of 15 major college bowl games in an 18day period, was rated a success by organizers and a totally glorious happening by Temple, which made its first trip to a bowl game in 44 years a successful one.

title: Pentagon Confirms Secret Tests Of Atom Weapons in '55 and '62
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 15 (AP)  Two secret nuclear tests were conducted by the United States in the Pacific Ocean southwest of San Diego, one in 1955 and the other in 1962, the Defense Department has confirmed.

title: SEOUL USE OF TROOPS IS PROTESTED BY U.S.
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 15  Troops under joint AmericanSouth Korean command were used during a revolt within the South Korean armed forces earlier this week, and the United States has privately protested what it says was a breach of military guidelines on deployment of forces, sources close to the Korean military said today.

title: Mr. C Adds a Fillip To Soccer Laurels
description: ANOTHER plus mark has been added to the argument of those who believe that Eugene Chyzowych of South Orange may very well be the top soccer coach in the United States.

title: Bacon Tests Uphold Use Of Nitrites
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP)Nearly all bacon produced in the United States is free of traces of nitrosamines, a cancercausing chemical found in bacon cured with sodium nitrite and fried at high heat, the Government reports.

title: MUSIC
description: HOLIDAY concerts are happening all over the county, but I'd like to start by telling you about some programs that won't make the newspaper listings even though, in a very real sense, they completely embody the spirit of Christmas. These caroling sessions are held, not in the usual halls and theaters, but in hospitals, nursing homes and other treatment centers where live entertainment is something of a rare commodity.

title: CITY JOINS SUBURBS TO SEEK ELECTRICITY
description: WHITE PLAINS  Hopes for lower electrical rates for New York metropolitanarea users received a major boost recently when New York City joined the ranks of suburban officials seeking cheaper power through a bipartisan political coalition.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: TEHERAN, IranHe has degrees from French and American universities in engineering, mathematics, economics and operations research, but as the new governor of the central bank of Iran, Ali Riza Nobari takes religion as his guide.

title: World News Briefs
description: ROME, Dec. 15 (Reuters)  The Italian Government proposed today that it be given sweeping powers of search and arrest and that terrorists face increased sentences, including especially harsh penalties for attacks on Government officials, magistrates and policemen.

title: 100 Lake Placid Hotel Diners Became Ill in October
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., Dec. 14  The Lake Placid Resort Hotel, which will house royalty, foreign dignitaries and top Olympic officials during the 1980 Winter Games here, was the site of an unexplained mass outbreak of gastrointestinal illness in early October, according to state health officials.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  It's hard and even a little risky to say even one good word for the Ayatollah Khomeini around here these days, but he has finally made it possible for the highest officials of this Government to think seriously about the security of the Middle East and even about U.S. military bases in that area.

title: CAPITAL REPORT
description: SOME time ago, Sidney Glaser, director of the state's Division of Taxation, bought an Omega watch while on vacation in another country. When he returned home, he asked a member of his staff to provide him with a form to pay New Jersey's 5 percent sales tax. There was no such form.

title: Count Dracula as Early Rumanian Freedom Fighter
description: BRAN, Rumania  The castle rises above the misty Transylvanian pine forest like some malevolent specter. A path winds up the craggy promontory, past gnarled pines and sheep grazing beside a murky pond.

title: News Summary
description: SUNDAY, DECEMBER 16, 1979

title: Student Activism Today: Fighting for Rights, but Within the System
description: In the 1960's it might have led to a demonstration. But, in the style of today's campus activism, when the president of the University of Florida reallocated fees that the Student Government Association thought were under its jurisdiction, the students sued the president instead of occupying his office.

title: Plan to Put Soviet Art Show in Armory Stirs Dispute
description: The Hermitage of Leningrad, the largest traveling art exhibition ever organized by the Soviet Union, may be shown in New York next October at the Seventh Regiment Armory, Park Avenue at 66th Street.

title: GARDENING
description: TO make winter more comfortable for the birds that make the otherwise drab winter garden a more interesting place, feeders and shelters can be erected and kept filled with a suitable mixture of seeds. Chunks of suet provide a much needed energy source to enable the birds to withstand cold temperatures. When natural water sources have frozen over, it is important that water be made available.

title: New Role for the Marines  And It Comes Just in Time
description: WASHINGTON  Suddenly, the thought that a United States marine standing guard on a desert strand could be an effective instrument of American foreign policy again has currency. It has not always been so. Only someone with a short memory could forget that during the Vietnam War the idea was intensely unpopular.

title: Baseball Competition Is Still Hot in the Cold
description: WHILE many bustle about the Island dreaming of a white Christmas, a group of young men, known collectively as the Long Island Stars, continue to have visions of home runs and nohitters, the calendar and the weather notwithstanding. And today, as has been the case throughout the fall, those visions may become reality when the Stars  barring a snowstorm or subfreezing weather  hope to play a baseball game in Stamford, Conn.

title: ANTIQUES
description: RITA REIF

title: WESTCHESTER JOURNAL
description: SOCIAL services directors in area hospitals say that, because of a state freeze on the construction of nursinghome beds, hundreds of elderly people who no longer need hospital care but are not well enough to go home end up waiting in hospitals for months on end because there are not enough nursinghome beds to go around.

title: Cuban Killed in Asylum Try by 6
description: HAVANA, Dec. 15 (Reuters)  One of six Cubans who crashed a truck into the Venezuelan Ambassador's garden here in a bid for asylum died of a head wound inflicted by police gunfire, the Foreign Ministry said tonight. A communiqu asserted that the six were former convicts. The five who made it into the residence were waiting to learn whether Venezuela would grant them asylum.

title: More Men Seek Custody of Children
description: MEN throughout Westchester are being heard saying: I want custody of my children; I am the better parent; I can be a better mother than my wife. And the courts are listenine.

title: Backgammon:
description: The third annual Las Vegas backgammon tournament sponsored by American Backgammon Championships was completed recently. This recordbreaking event drew more than 1,000 players competing in three sections for over $400,000 in prize money. The chief attraction was the World Amateur Championship for the Plimpton Cup, with a first prize of $150,000. It was won by Wayne Araki, a truck driver from Vancouver, British Columbia, participating in his first tournament. In the finals, he defeated Dr. Paul DiBiase, a dentist from Steubenville, Ohio, who collected $90,000 for finishing second. Third place went to Jim Ax and fourth to John Klein.

title: Time is Money
description: Perhaps in these turbulent times, people think a better watch will somehow guide them through the gloom. Or with another decade winding down, maybe they're just more conscious of time. In any case, luxury wristwatches, those with the fourfigure price tags, are selling this season like never before.

title: Classification Of Schools: Plan Is Alive
description: FOR a number of years now, many publicschool pupils in the state have fared poorly on reading and mathematics tests designed to ascertain how much they were learning.

title: C.W. Post 81, Adelphi 67
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Dec. 15  Al Davidson scored 21 points and Mike Dias set a school record with 17 assists in leading C. W. Post to an 8167 victory over Adelphi tonight.

title: Wagner 83, L.I.U. 81
description: Wagner extended its winning streak to 21 regularseason games in scoring its sixth success of the season, 8381, over Long,Island University last night.

title: THE LIVELY ARTS
description: PATTI LuPONE, the antiheroine of Broadway's Evita, the musical about Eva Pern, who rose from trashy tango singer to notorious glamour symbol, sat in her dressing room, which was decorated like a little girl's playroom, replete with teddy bears, dolls and giant papiermch insects hanging overhead.

title: I.R.S. Seeks Chicago Taxes; School Rescue Plan Rejected
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 15  The Chicago Board of Education's fiscal crisis has worsened with a demand by the Internal Revenue Service that the board immediately pay $16 million in delinquent payroll taxes and the decision by Gov. James R. Thompson not to go along with a bailout plan worked out by Mayor Jane M. Byrne and the State Treasurer last week.

title: THE NEW BLACK POWER OF COLEMAN YOUNG
description: The day after Andrew Young resigned from his post as the Carter Administration's chief delegate to the United Nations  an event that threatened to demolish the President's support from an increasingly skeptical black constituency  Hamilton Jordan and other key White House aides huddled in a hotel suite in Washington. They were guests of When the Mayor of Detroit speaks, the White House listens  because Young has suddenly emerged as one of the most influential blacks in the United States. Coleman Alexander Young, Mayor of Detroit.

title: U.S. Aides Recount Moments of False Missile Alert
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  When the firing of Soviet missiles showed up on American monitors and set off a sixminute alert last month, President Carter was not notified because duty officers immediately suspected that they had a false alarm on their hands, Administration officials have disclosed.

title: CONNECTICUT HOUSING
description: HOME prices are finally beginning to level off and even drop back as skyhigh mortgage interest rates plus tight lending policies continue to put the brakes on the normal flow of sales. Most severely hit have been the oilguzzlers  large, expensive colonials with more than 2,000 square feet of living soace.

title: Design
description: There's probably not another New York apartment like it; in fact, it looks as if it had been designed by someone who'd never seen a New York apartment before. There are five places to sleep but no bedroom, five places to dine but no dining room. Each room  there are three besides baths and a kitchen  is designed for working, sleeping, dining and entertaining, like three separate studio apartments. Yet, for all its unconventionality, the apartment achieves the two basic goals of all wellconceived interiors: It makes its owner comfortable and explains to visitors, in language that is honest but polite, what manner of man he is.

title: U.S. Aides Say Oil Companies Act to Fill Need
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  A secret Federal review of international petroleum traffic has concluded that major American oil corporations have acted responsibly in meeting national energy needs, but not necessarily in the total interest of either smaller companies or domestic consumers.

title: A Beguiling Walk Around Old Rouen
description: The prevalent image in all Rouen is Joan of Arc at the stake. It is peculiarly appropriate, for not only did the city see the burning of the Maid of Orleans in 1431, but it also suffered a fiery martyrdom of its own from the Allied bombings of 1940 and 1944. Joan was, of course, eventually proclaimed a saint by the church that had condemned her as a heretic. And Rouen, too, has risen from its own ashes.

title: Cavaliers Sink Nets
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Dec. 15 (AP) Campy Russell scored 23 points and Randy Smith added 20 to pace a balanced attack that carried the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 117111 victory over the New Jersey Nets tonight.

title: Knight Patterson Has Nuptials
description: Knight Patterson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jere Wescott Patterson of New York and Southampton, L.I., was married yesterday to Gilbert Simrall Meem Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Meem of Bluefield, W. Va. The ceremony was performed in the chapel of the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest by the Rev. Alan Houghton.

title: Staten Island 60, Queens 54
description: The College of Staten Island remained undefeated after six games as it scored a 6054 victory over Queens College last night in a City University Conference game.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: With more than 200 books to his credit  the number may have risen since I began composing this sentence  Isaac Asimov is in.the position of the tourist who tells a travel agent, I went around the world last year., so this year I want to go somewhere else. This time Mr.

title: Put the Bear Behind You
description: What, no toasters? The Chase Manhattan Bank, in a move to attract more savings deposits, has rolled out the teddy bear.

title: Iona 75, Fairleigh 58
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Dec. 15 (AP)  With Jeff Ruland scoring 17 points and four of his mates hitting double figures, Iona posted a 7558 college basketball victory over Fairleigh Dickinson today.

title: Stephen J. Pomerantz Fianc Of Penelope Ann Kereiakes
description: Dr. and Mrs. James Kereiakes of Cincinnati, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Penelope Ann Kereiakes, to Stephen J. Pomeranz, son of Mrs. Melvin Levy of Lido Beach, L.I., and Paul Pomeranz of Plainview, L.I. A wedding is planned for the summer.

title: Philadelphia's may With New Year's
description: It happens every New Year's Day: thousands of otherwise normal Philadelphia men don extravagantly sequined and ostrichplumed satin costumes and from 8 A.M. till past dark, invariably in the bitter cold, prance, strut, sashay and cakewalk up Broad Street while half a million people cheer from the sidewalks. The Mummers Parade has been ushering in the New Year in this gaudy and jubilant fashion since the start of the century, save for a couple of wartime interruptions, and its partisans are convinced of its uniqueness.

title: History Favors Success for Board
description: If history is any guide, the emergency board appointed by President Carter on Friday to investigate and recommend a settlement in the Long Island Rail Road labor dispute has excellent prospects for success.

title: This Man Has a Million Shares of Chrysler
description: It's the sort of thing that haunts the nightmares of every investor: wake up in the morning with a massive position in a company gone bad. Edward Pisak has known many such mornings.

title: Dancing Legend
description: HIS career lasted only from 1906 to 1917. Only one of his four ballets is still performed. And yet Vaslav Nijinsky, the great Russian dancer, has lived on with brilliant clarity, and the legend grows. We have met Nijinsky the dancer, who poured himself into his roles, personifying, as Lincoln Krstein put it, rather than impersonating.

title: ART
description: BRIDGEPORT

title: Helen Neelsen Married to David Anderson
description: WEST BERLIN, Dec. 15  Helen Neelsen and David Anderson, the chief United States diplomatic representative in Berlin, were married today in the American Chapel in Dahlem, West Berlin. The Rev. David M. Couchman, a Protestant minister, performed the ceremony.

title: North Carolina 90, Detroit 72
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C., Dec. 15 (AP)  North Carolina used its fast break and fourcorners offense in the second half tonight to defeat Detroit, 9072.

title: State Agency Helping Small Industries
description: WHAT do the Abbott Exacta DC 900 currency counter, the Batrow 900 Series irrigation controller and the Automation Systems laser gauge have in common?

title: Pollution Case Penalty: Study of Turtle Sex Life
description: DANVILLE, Va., Dec. 15 (UPI)  The City of Danville will sponsor a $10,000 study of the sex lives of loggerhead turtles rather than pay a fine for polluting the air from its coalburning steam plant.

title: Horizons Expanded
description: IN THE continuation of a program designed to halt the incarceration of the minds of its inmates, the Clinton Correctional Institution for Women was the scene last week of a talk by Edwin Newman, the NBC news commentator and author of Strictly Speaking and A Civil Toneue.

title: Miss Clark Breaks Mark
description: The number of entries was down by about 600 from last year, but the 26th annual Bishop Loughlin Games at the 102d Engineers Armory, which opened the indoor track and field season for schoolboys yesterday, had no shortage of quality. Some impressive performances were recorded for this early stage of the season.

title: Rousing Albums From Guthrie And Seeger
description: By its very nature, folk music cares about continuity. Before the advent of mass communications and the mass culture they ushered in, folk songs were passed on by one generation to the next, which embroidered the keepsakes and bequeathed them in turn. Even today, when many of the few remaining folksingers compose their own material, folk music usually displays a respect for the past and a concern for the future that contrast with most other forms of popular music  with disco's eternal present on the dance floor, for instance, and with the disjunctive rhythms and lyrics of most newwave rockandroll.

title: INADVERTENCE SEEN IN FEDERAL GROWTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  A series of case studies by the Advisory Commission on Intergovernmental Relations has shown that much of the growth of the Federal Government in recent years has been accidental.

title: With Mrs. Grasso Leading the Way, a Carter Bandwagon Starts to Roll
description: HARTFORD  State Senator Richard F. Schneller was watching a Giants football game on television at his home in Essex on a recent Sunday afternoon when his wife answered the telephone. Pick up the phone, she told him. I think someone's pulling your leg.

title: IS MAGGIE THATCHER JUST MAKING THINGS WORSE?
description: When Margaret Thatcher arrives in Washington today for a twoday visit, she will do so as something more than a British Prime Minister, something even more than the first woman to head a major Western government. She will be here as the herald

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Prune evergreens and use trimmings for Christmas decorations indoors. . . . Mulch perennials, newly planted trees and shrubs and lateplanted bulb borders. . . . Secure canes of climbing rosebushes to prevent winter wind and ice storm damage. . . . Keep indoor ferns misted and soil moist. . . . Check stored pots of bulbs to be sure soil is moist.

title: Ellen S. Streeter Engaged to Jeffrey Wilmot
description: Ellen Shipman Streeter, a sales executive in the New York office of the Oberoi Hotels group of India, and Jeffrey G. Wilmot, marketing director for Newsweek International, plan to be married next May.

title: THIS WEEK IN SPORTS
description: The Knicks are at Madison Square Garden to meet the Atlanta Hawks Tuesday at 7:30 P.M.

title: White House Delay on Strike Defended
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  A White House aide said last night that President Carter had waited before appointing an emergency board in the Long Island Rail Road strike because he wanted to give collective bargaining a chance to go as far as it could.

title: The Big Houses
description: THREE big, heavy coffeetable books on three famous opera houses, chockfull of illustrations in color and black and white. But Francis Robinson's study of the Metropolitan Opera is largely confined to the new house in Lincoln Center, which the Metropolitan entered in 1966. There is some prior his

title: Senate Drops States From Windfall Oil Profit Tax
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  The Senate today cleared a major obstacle to final passage of the oil windfall profits tax by killing an amendment that would have applied the tax to revenue that states and localities receive from interests in oil Property.

title: Sunday Observer
description: The story was datelined Liverpool and said, in its entirety, Ambrose Massey and his wife, Eulalia, were surprised to return home from the movies and find a stork in their parlor. Students of Journalism will instantly recognize this as one of those singlesentence fillers with which editors pad the early editions of Sunday newspapers while waiting for their ponderousprose artists in Washington to churn out something suffocating about the gross national product.

title: Growing Energy Gap in India Is Crippling Industry
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 15  Even as India is preoccupied with the parliamentary elections, the Government is grappling with a developing energy crisis that has already hit vital sectors of the economy.

title: 2 Doctors Begin Using Cancer Drugs on Shah Just Before Departure
description: Only hours before the exiled Shah of Iran flew to Panama yesterday from an Air Force base in Texas, doctors began treating his cancer with a combination of drugs, according to a medical source close to the case.

title: U.S. to Be Asked
description: THE assistant commissioner of the state's Department of Health said last week that the Federal Environmental Protection Agency will be asked to reinspect the laboratory and procedures that the department uses to test toxic pollutants and dangerous chemicals.

title: U.S. Influence Couldn't Avert South Korean Coup
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Kim Dae Jung, South Korea's premier opposition figure, met last Wednesday with United States Ambassador William H. Glevsteen Jr. in Seoul.

title: REACAN SUGGESTING FEW NEW PROGRAMS
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 15  After the first month of his third Presidential campaign, Ronald Reagan's oratory is whipping up enthusiastic applause and provoking standing ovations from partisans across the country. But so far the former California Governor has not clearly defined any substantive programs for his Presidency.

title: A Colonial Mall
description: ONE OF New Jersey's quaintest and most unusual shopping centers has a For Sale sign hanging over it.

title: Congressman in Illinois Seeking 12Year Term for Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI)  Representative Henry J. Hyde, Republican of Illinois, yesterday proposed a constitutional amendment to limit the service of Supreme Court Justices to a single 12year term.

title: Sarah Henry Is Married
description: Sarah Payne Henry, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew K. Henry Jr. of Dedham, Mass., was married yesterday in St. Thomas Episcopal Church to William Henry Waters, a vice president of Johnson & Higgins, insurance brokers. The Rev. John Andrew performed the ceremony. Mr. Waters, whose previous marriage ended in divorce, is a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Frank A. Waters Jr. of Bedford, N.Y.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: GENE THORNTON

title: Study Suggests Efficiency Steps In Federal Programs for Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15  The General Accounting Office has recommended changes in Federal urban rehabilitation programs that it said would use funds more efficiently and save perhaps $240 million.

title: County Starts Project Of Safe Homes
description: SEVERAL northern Westchester families are preparing for some unusual house guests this holiday season. All are participating in the Safe Homes Project just launched by the Domestic Violence Unit of the County Department of Social Services.

title: Food
description: Although Americans are, by and large, a nation of sausage eaters, we are not a nation that indulges in a vast variety of them. Most sausages consumed In this country are made with pork. And yet one of the grandest of all is made not with pork but with the fine flesh of veal. This is the boudin blanc or white pudding sausage and it is traditionally served in French homes for yearend holidays, particularly New Year's Eve.

title: Ship May Have Found Vessel Missing a Year
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 15 (AP)  Investigators who believe they may have found the Holo Holo, the missing University of Hawaii research vessel, hope to get a deepsea camera to confirm their evidence.

title: GARDENING
description: TO make winter more comfortable for the birds that make the otherwise drab winter garden a more interesting place, feeders and shelters can be erected and kept filled with a suitable mixture of seeds. Chunks of suet provide a much needed energy source to enable the birds to withstand cold temperatures. When natural water sources have frozen over, it is important that water be made available.

title: Topics
description: Ayatollah Khomeini has promised his followers a return to the virtues of preindustrial society. And there's much in the old ways that does attract us moderns. The simplicity and ineffectiveness of the weapons with which men used to kill each other seem almost civilized. But we doubt that anyone today could sell scimitars and bows and arrows to the Ayatollah. Or suits of mail, even if equipped with plastic rustdeflectors and graphite spray cans to keep the links from squeaking. The Ayatollah has equipped his militiamen with machine guns.

title: SPORTS TODAY
description: Brooklyn College at City College, 5 P.M. (Radio  WNYC, 5 P.M.)

title: SPORTS
description: LET'S invent a new game. To save money we will use an existing hockey rink. To keep it American, we will use a ball instead of a puck. But no sticks. And no ice, either, for that matter. Let's keep it simple. We will put artificial turf over the ice.

title: Raphael Soyer Exhibition On View at the Hirshhorn
description: The Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington is displaying an exhibition of the work of Raphael Soyer in honor of the American figurative artist's 80th birthday. The show will be on view until midJanuary.

title: BRIDGE
description: In bridge events, as in life, one sometimes has the feeling that the fates have predetermined some result and are not above playing a few tricks to prevent their bets from losing. There were some indications of outside intervention in the Reisinger Teams last month in Cincinnati, favoring the Aces team which has dominated tournament play for more than a year.

title: Christmas Presents: Some Give and Take
description: SELECTING Christmas gifts is such fun, and the joy of doing so seems to start a little earlier each year, with Santa Claus following closely on the heels of the Great Pumpkin. So here we are, with reminders everywhere that we must get busy on our Christmas list. But what to buy for whom?

title: 7 Guerrillas Seized in Philippines
description: MANILA, Dec. 15 (Reuters)  Seven suspected Communist guerrillas were killed and 11 were captured in two clashes with troops this week on the island of Mindanao in the southern Philippines, military sources said. One soldier was killed.

title: De Paul Subdues U.C.L.A.
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 15 (AP) Teddy Grubbs, a reserve freshman forward, scored 28 points to lead De Paul to a 9994 college basketball victory over University of California, Los Angeles, today at Pauley Pavilion.

description: RECENTLY I was in New Orleans visiting an old friend from Tennessee. At one point her son raced into the room and blurted out that a kid passing through on a bicycle had stopped and beaten up a neighborhood kid. My friend's response was, What kind of bicycle was it?

title: Smith Haven Priest Sees Advocacy Role

Ronald Richardson, the newly appointed executive director of the Smith Haven Ministries, then he begins to draw up a battle plan so that every dollar spent is squeezed to its fullest.

title: Williams Eating His Words on Iran
description: LAST year, when he headed a fiveman Senate delegation that visited Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi in Teheran, Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. reported, along with his colleagues, that there are no serious threats to his power.

title: Brown Meets With Oregon Homosexual Activists
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 15  At a function that his national staff wrongly represented as a private fundraising event closed to the press, Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California met today with a group of homosexual activists and reaffirmed his commitment to eliminate hiring bias and other forms of discrimination based on sexual preference.

A memorial service will be held Monday, Dec. 17, at 4PM, at the Persky residence, 41 Glen Rd, Larchmont, N.Y. In lieu of flowers, the family requests that donations be sent to The Patient Activities Dept., Howe Avenue Nursing Home of the New Rochelle Hospital Medical Center, New Rochelle, N.Y. 10802

title: ABOUT WESTCHESTER

title: CRIME
description: Three popular authors  two of them dead  are represented by newly published books. In order of composition, they are THE NIGHTCLUB by Georges Simenon (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich/A Helen and Kurt Wolff Book. $7.95). HOLY DISOR DERS by Edmund Crispin (Walker, $9.95) and A CARIBBEAN MYSTERY by Agatha Christie (Dodd, Mead, $7.95).

title: Museum in Stalin's Hometown Guards the Shreds of His Reputation
description: GORI, U.S.S.R., Dec. 9  The tiny whitewashed Georgian house was encased in an ornate pavilion, like a sacred relic set in tinsel. In this room, said a research official, on Dec. 21, 1879, was born Iosif Vissarionovich Stalin.

title: U.S.A.'S TWIN HOPES
description: It's called Alpine skiing and it's a simple sport. All you have to do is go up the mountain and then come down again. It's as simple as that.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: Life without vertebrae was bleak for 33yearold Jessie Thomas early last summer. She had to lie motionless in a special stretcher day and night. Her spine had been removed after the discovery of a rare bone tumor that had caused paralysis from the waist down.

title: The Women Talk and the Candidates Listen Hard
description: WASHINGTON  Laura Murphy is a lobbyist for the American Civil Liberties Union, and earlier this month she was invited to hear a speech by Senator Edward M. Kennedy. As she was waiting for it to begin, Miss Murphy said that she was far more concerned about issues than about sex appeal.

title: Christmas to Sound Through County
description: CHURCHES throughout Westchester County have prepared wide variety of musical programs for the Christmas holidays. In a spirit of ecumenism, choir directors and pastors have issued an invitation to people of any religious persuasion to come and hear the performances.

title: Canada's Largest Museum Begins 2Year Closure
description: TORONTO, Dec. 15Question: How do you close Canada's largest public museum, gingerly move to safety more than six million artifacts from dinosaurs and beetles to porcelain and prints, preside over $50 million in renovations and reopen 30 months later without having damaged the museum's national reputation as a shrine of wonder and learning?

title: Rojas Defeats Rodgers In 10,000Meter Race
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 15  Ric Rojas, a 27yearold runner from Boulder, Colo., beat Bill Rodgers today in capturing a 10,000meter race that closed out a 13race national series.

title: Another Milestone for Symphony Hall
description: THE return of Eugene Ormandy and the Philadelphia Orchestra to Symphony Hall here Tuesday night  they last performed there 15 years ago  may stir memories of the time when the theater played host to some of the world's greatest musicians.

title: On Saving Time Before Taking Off
description: Two of the nation's biggest air carriers have undertaken to persuade travelers that there are ways to circumvent the long lines so common in major airports these days. American Airlines advertises: We can't promise you faster airplanes. Just faster airports. Trans World Airlines counters with: No airline gets you through the airport faster than T.W.A.

title: TEHERAN CONDEMNED BY PANEL IN HAGUE
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 15The International Court of Justice ordered tonight that Iran immediately release all American hostages being held at the United States Embassy in Teheran or elsewhere. In a unanimous opinion granting temporary measures of relief pending a final

title: Pictures Conceal Opium Seized From 3 Iranians
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 15 (UPI) Three Iranian citizens have been arrested for allegedly smuggling about 35 pounds of opium by concealing the drugs in pictures of the Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini and other Iranian religious leaders.

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
description: There was once a small, grimy terrier who viewed his world through the whirling spokes of a turnspit wheel, which was wheel and cage in one. So begins a remarkable

title: Wine
description: The Rheingau is a 20mile stretch of lush vineyards in the heart of the Rhine Valley of West Germany, and it is said that the greatest of all German wines are made there. It is a section of the Rhine where the river pauses in its rush toward the North Sea and briefly turns west, exposing the vineyards along its northern bank to the full impact of the sun. The few additional moments of sunshine that the native riesling grapes receive each day add to their ripeness, raising the sugar levels and creating magnificently rich white wines of uncommon natural sweetness.

title: The Queen in Drydock: A Big Job in Bayonne
description: AFLOAT, she is the world's largest and, many say most glamorous ocean liner. Out of water, a: she is now, the Queen Elizabeth 2 looks like a great beached whale.

title: Hamtramck Is Losing a Plant  and More
description: HAMTRAMCK, Mich., Dec. 14  On a winter morning before light has come, the New Palace Bakery on Joseph Campau Street is redolent of the smells and sights of oldworld Christmas baking, plum cookies, apricot kolaczki, Mazurka rum tortes, poppyseed cakes, crown cakes, and a seemingly inexhaustible variety of brown, thickcrusted breads.

title: Dance: Ailey Revives Butler Eve
description: For the record, the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater has revived John Butler's According to Eve this season. At Thursday night's performance at the City Center55th Street Theater, it seemed hardly worth the effort.

title: Princeton 41, Manhattan 28
description: Randy Melville scored 18 points yesterday to lead Princeton to a 4128 victory over Manhattan at Draddy Gymnasium. Twelve of his points came in the second half as Princeton extended its 2214 halftime advantage.

title: Elizabeth Carroll Boynton Becomes Bride Of Lawrence Allen, Head of Film Concern
description: Elizabeth Carroll Boynton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carroll A. Boynton of Pottersville, N.J., was married yesterday in Middletown, R.I., to Lawrence Allen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Allen of Barrington, R.I. The ceremony was performed in St. Columba's Episcopal Church by the rector, the Rev. Edward S. Winsor.

title: Mrs. Carter to Campaign in Iowa
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP)  Rosalynn Carter and a group that includes two of her daughtersinlaw will campaign at coffees Thursday in Iowa, her office announced. Mrs. Carter will be accompanied by Pat Marshall, wife of Labor Secretary Ray Marshall; Annette ana Juay Carter, the daughtersinlaw; Edna Langford, Judy Carter's mother, and Juanelle Edwards, president of the Georgia Federation of Democratic Women. President Carter's mother, Lillian, also is expected to make the trip.

title: Kentucky Five Deals Indiana First Defeat
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 15  With a crowd of 23,000 chanting Go Big Blue, the University of Kentucky rallied from 13 points back tonight and gained a 6958 basketball victory over previously undefeated Indiana.

title: Two Artists Who Avoid Trends Share a Show
description: PORT WASHINGTON

title: Oil Producers Cartel Meets Tomorrow in Caracas to Set 1980 Prices
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  When delegates from the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries convene in Caracas tomorrow to set oil prices for 1980, they will try to agree on a figure that is neither too much, to avoid crippling the economies of their key customers, nor too little, to avoid losing purchasing power because of the West's inflation and the dollar's downward course. Foremost in their minds will be a truism they have learned hard and well this year: They can make more by producing less  less, at least, than the industrialized nations expected.

title: Holiday Music: A Seasonal Guide
description: MUSIC is an integral part of the tradition of the Christmas season, and the calendar that follows is only a sampling of the special presentations planned around the state during the coming weeks.

description: They sit around the locker room and look at one another and wonder which friends will be back and which ones will not, certain only that today will be their last game together as Giants.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI)  Food stamp benefits for elderly, blind or disabled persons with high medical expenses will increase Jan. 1.

title: Jury Duty And Conscience: A Conflict?
description: I HAVE just finished serving a call to jury duty. I know that I shall never be on a jury because I can never qualify. 1 am unfit to be a juror. Logic and conscience prevent me from complying with the rules of the game.

description: PIANCAVALLO, Italy, Dec. 15 (AP)  Annemarie Proell Moser of Austria, who excels in the downhill and has won the World Cup six times, scored her first cup special slalom victory in eight years today.

description: Dear Santa Claus: I realize it's been a while since my last letter  what is it, 15 or 16 years?  but I have been sort of busy. You know, with school and everything.

title: Legal Technicalities, Morality And the Indian Point Trials
description: ON Nov. 26, I had my day in court as the first of 140 defendants on trial for the Aug. 5 Indian Point demonstration. I had hoped to be able to raise significant issues. Instead, Judge Joseph Manes refused to hear evidence of nuclear dangers. I was convicted of trespass and given an unconditional release. In effect, the court said that I was legally wrong but morally right.

title: From Broken Toys, a Christmastime Hobby Grew
description: PITTSBURG, Kan., Dec. 15 (AP) Late at night, when all children are supposed to be asleep, Henry McNeill hums along with the Seven Dwarfs as he paints Barbie Doll's smile and fixes the Cookie Monster's crunch.

description: With the prospects of endlessly rising energy costs worrying the real estate industry, a vanguard of owners and managers is reevaluating old technology and trying out new concepts, including some from Europe and Asia.

title: Is Rock the Music of Violence?
description: ELeven young men and women died at a Who concert in Cincinnati on Dec. 3. Most of the responsible commentary  and refreshingly enough, most of the commentary has been responsible  has dealt with questions of how rock concerts can be better organized and controlled. It would seem that socalled festival seating of the sort used in Cincinnati  unreserved tickets that lead to a buildup of impatient fans at the gates followed by a mad dash for the best positions when the hall finally opens its doors  will be curtailed. And legislation may be enacted to ensure a proper degree of concert security.

title: Working at Joking
description: IT'S like having the inmates take over the asylum, said Bob Nelson of the comedy workshops held here on the campus of Nassau Community College. Mr. Nelson is a lanky, 21yearold, rubberyfaced comedian who serves as master of ceremonies of the twiceamonth workshops, which feature aspiring local comedians performing original material.

description: THE campaign for the United States Senate next year has only begun, but already some themes are being sounded that promise to be part of the political rhetoric for months to come.

description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 15  A Turkish extreme left terrorist group claimed responsibility today for the murder of four Americans from a Turkish-American defense installation near Istanbul yesterday.

title: Nancy J. Friberg, Banker, Fiance Of Robert L. Pope
