description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Dec. 26 William E. Davis, president of the University of New Mexico, said today that a university investigation of the general problem of athletes eligibility and academic status was under way by Oct.

title: Utah Town Plans for a Geothermal Heating System
description: MONROE, Utah, Dec. 26 (AP)  Before the hole, there wasn't much to be excited about in Monroe. Mostly, it was just known as the thirdlargest town in Sevier County.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Market Place
description: THERE was intense interest in the Outboard Manne Corporation in the investment community yesterday after members of the Briggs family, owners of 10.8 percent of Outboard Marine's shares, announced plans to sell.

title: Steel Output Off for Week
description: Steel production fell to 2.3 million tons in the week ended last Friday, a decrease of 1.9 percent from the previous week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Veteran Farmers Guide the Young in Feeding U.S.
description: BISMARCK, N.D., Dec. 26 (AP) dozen North Dakota farmers, most of them over 70 years of age, are visiting hundreds of farms to give newcomers to farming a sympathetic ear and advice on how to keep going through the uncertainties of feeding the nation.

title: C. William Borchers, 80; Retired Bank Chairman
description: C. William Borchers, retired board chairman of the North Side Savings Bank in the Bronx and a leader in civic affairs, died last Friday in the Community General Hospital in Syracuse. He was 80 years old and had been associated with the bank for more than half a century.

title: Israeli Oil Deposits Cited
description: TELAVIV, Dec. 26 (Reuters)  A report prepared by an American oil exploration expert has found that Israel probably has large deposits of oil, Energy Ministry officials said today. According to the report, prepared for the ministry by James Wilson, an American geologist, there is a 75 percent chance that the Dead Sea area contains two billion barrels of oil and a similar quantity probably exists in other regions.

title: Hawley Wins on Favorite At Santa Anita's Opening
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Dec. 26 (AP) Sandy Hawley took Beau's Eagle to the front early and kept him there today to win the $55,250 Palos Verdes Handicap on opening day of the Santa Anita meet.

title: U.S. Urging Mortgage Flexibility
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  The agency that regulates federally chartered savings and loan associations, the nation's principal mortgage lenders, will propose a major change in regulations that is intended both to strengthen the financial structure of the lenders and to protect home buyers from being locked in at high interest rates over 25 and 30year mortgage periods.

title: Japan Cuts Iran Trade Backing
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26 The Government announced measures on trade with Iran today that shippers here said would lead to a sharp decline in Japanese exports of consumer goods to Iran.

title: 295,000 Datsun Cars Recalled
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26 (AP)  More than 295,000 Datsuns built from 1975 to this year have been recalled because of a potential defect related to coldweather driving, the automobile manufacturer announced yesterday. Nissan U.S.A., which manufactures Datsun cars, said it was recalling 295,710 of its 197579 280ZX and 197779 810 model cars to correct the problem. Officials at Nissan's headquarters in Carson, Calif., said that subzero temperatures, coupled with high moisture from the cars blowby ventilation system, could offset throttle system components, causing a prolonged high idle.

title: Higher Prices for Beef Cited
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (Reuters) Consumers will pay 10 to 15 percent more for beef in 1980 following the surge in prices this year, a prominent t rade group predicted today.

title: 32School Plan Seeks Gains by Pupils
description: Acting on new research, New York City is selecting 32 schools as part of a pilot program to see if it can improve pupil achievement by reproducing the characteristics of successful schools at ones where pupil performance is lagging.

title: China to Set Up Business Zones
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26 (AP)  China will extend preferential treatment to all foreign companies setting up enterprises or joint ventures in special economic zones in South China's Shenzen and Zhuhai areas in Guangdong province, the official New China News Agency reported today.

title: Newsweek Names New Chairman
description: Peter A. Derow, who left the presidency of Newsweek Inc. for seven months and then returned to it, will also become chairman on Jan. 1 after Robert D. Campbell, 62 years old, retires.

title: McGinnis Penalty Is Cut to 3 Games
description: In a compromise apparently designed to save face on both sides and keep the dispute out of the courts, Larry O'Brien, the commissioner of the National Basketball Association, yesterday reduced the penalty he had imposed on George McGinnis.

title: Houghton Buys Coast Publisher
description: Houghton Mifflin, the independent Bostonbased publishing house, is establishing what its executives call a West Coast presence in the tradebook field. This week an agreement was reached for the acquisition of J. P. Tarcher Inc., a small independent publishing company based in Los Angeles. Houghton Mifflin also owns Parnassus Press, a children's book publisher in the San Francisco Bay area, and it has a medical publishing operation headed by Dr. Morton K. Rubinstein of the U.C.L.A. School of Medicine.

title: U. S. Reducing Staffs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  The United States has decided to reduce its embassy staff and other official missions in El Salvador because of violence and threats by leftist revolutionary groups, Administration officials said today.

title: 5 Killed in Colorado Plane Crash
description: EAGLE, Colo., Dec. 26 (UPI) A twinengine airplane from California crashed at the end of a runway in this mountain town today, killing all five persons on board. None of the victims were identified, but officials said that the plane was owned by a San Diego company, Design for Living Inc.

title: Deaths
description: JOSEPHSONAnn on Dec 25, 1979 Wife of the late Joseph of Providence, Rhode Island Interment Thursday, Dec 27, 1979 in family Plot

title: Terrorism Spurs New Products
description: PARK FOREST, III., Dec. 26 (AP) Worldwide terrorism, distressing as it may be to many businessmen, has brought new opportunities to the Chicago Bullet Proof Equipment Company. Among its new product lines are special casings for computers at nuclear power plants.

title: Raytheon Lifts Payout
description: LEXINGTON, Mass., Dec. 26 (Reu. ters)  The Raytheon Company said today that it was increasing its quarterly dividend to 50 cents a share from 40 cents, payable Jan 24 to shareholders of record on Jan. 11.

title: TV: New CBS Series, Knots Landing
description: SOAP opera, sometimes referred to as daytime drama, has finally snared evening prime time's ultimate status symbol  a spinoff.

title: Begin Heckled by West Bank Jews
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 28 Prime Minister Menachem Begin visited the occupied West Bank today, where he was interrupted repeatedly by rightwing Jewish militants as he tned to give a speech supporting continued Jewish settlement in the Arab territories.

title: Four More Join Cast Of TV The Shadow Box
description: Valerie Harper, James Broderick, Melinda Dillon and Ben Masters have been cast in the madefortelevision film adaptation of Michael Cristofer's 1977 Pulitzer Prizewinning drama The Shadow Box, to be shown by the ABCTV next spring.

title: Sound
description: HAVING spent childhood winters in the Styrian Alps, I remember times and places where one celebrated all the 12 traditional days of Christmas until the Feast of Epiphany. So I still feel in a holiday mood and can think of no better way to mark the occasion than to heed the request of several readers and revive and update what I wrote for this season in another year.

title: Theater: Bob Carroll's Short Pieces
description: BOB CARROLL'S refreshing oneman Salmon Show told us far more than we ever thought we wanted to know about salmon. On the other hand, his new show, Short Pieces, tells us a little less than we ought to know about a diversity of subjects from W. C. Fields to the Chinese Revolution.

title: Disks: Nova Convention That Saluted Burroughs
description: ONE of the more characteristic sociological manifestations of the lower Manhattan arts community in recent years has been the allstar benefit, wherein artists of all sorts gather together and present short performance bits in sequence for some worthy cause. The an

title: Williamson Put on Crash Diet
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Dec. 26 John Williamson, the New Jersey Nets overweight guard, who has sat out the last nine games after failing to meet a 215pound limit mandated for him by the club, was given a last chance today

title: News Summary
description: Soviet intervention in Afghanistan is rising sharply, according to Washington, which said that a military airlift had been under way round the clock. The Carter Administration is increasingly concerned over mounting signs of a direct Soviet combat role in Afghanistan's civil war. Officials said that the number of Moscow's troops in Afghanistan had quadrupled from 1,500 to 6,000 and that increasing numbers of Soviet troops were moving toward the Afghanistan border. [Page Al, Col. 6.]

title: For Many Americans in Panama, Enemy Is the US.
description: BALBOA, Panama, Dec. 22  When Panama took over control of the Canal Zone from the United States on Oct. 1, many Americans working on the waterway fled the area for a few days, convinced that their homes would be attacked and their families threatened by revengeful Panamanians. But no such incidents have occurred.

title: Revenue Service Begins Mailing First of 1979 Income Tax Forms
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP)  The Government began mailing today the first of 85.4 million income tax forms, and a spokesman for the Internal Revenue Service said most taxpayers would have their forms by Jan. 8.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: American Bakeries Company, Chicago, has elected Joseph V. McGinley executive vice president; W. Ralph Holltman vice presidentoperations, and Robert Terrence Galvin vice presidentfinance.

title: Howard Kaplan, Original Partner Of a Legal Firm on Park Avenue
description: Howard Kaplan, a founding partner of Young, Kaplan, Ziegler & Zisselman, a Manhattan law firm, died Monday at his home in Mamaroneck, N.Y. He was 63 years old.

title: How Much Sodium, How Much Fat?
description: A trip to the supermarket can be confusing now that fully half the food consumed in this country is processed and packaged for sale. What does the package really contain? Many products list only some of the ingredients and most provide no nutritional information, like the amount of protein or fat. Even those that do tell are often daunting. A shopper has to be quick with numbers to convert grams of fat or sugar into figures that can be compared with expert advice on what constitutes a healthy diet.

title: Mother and 2 Girls Killed in Car
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 26 (UPI) woman and her two young daughters were killed today when their car was hit by a city bus. According to the police, bus passengers reported that the crash occurred after a car driven by Mary Meagher, 23 years old, ran a stop sign. The children were identified as Heather, 4, and Shannon, 2.

title: TWO SOVIET MITERS APPEAL TO BACKERS
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26  Two young Russian writers who were expelled from the official Soviet Writers Union for taking part in a group effort to bring out an anthology of uncensored writing urged their older collaborators on the project today to reconsider their threat of resigning from the union in protest.

title: TV: A Tribute to Edison After 100 Years of Light
description: L EGACY of Genius, a tribute to Thomas Alva Edison at the end of the centenary year of his invention of the incandescent light, provides a reasonably interesting glimpse of the great tinkerer.

title: Old House Plans, Revised for Today
description: FRANK LLOYD WRIGHT'S lifelong dream  mass production of his residential designs  may yet come true. And houses designed by other famous architects (who might have considered reproduction their designs a nightmare) may also start dotting the landscape if the hunches of Russell Swinton Oatman and Evan PoHitt, two modernday architects, are correct.

title: Issue and Debate
description: The Defense Department has begun to search for a site for a United States military base in the Middle East. Such a base would be used by elements of the Rapid Deployment Force and by naval and air units in the area. It would serve in an emergency as a staging area for American intervention in protection of American interests, particularly the security of the oilfields and the oil shipping lanes out of the Persian Gulf.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION .

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Regine, in Her Paris Home
description: PARIS

title: Deaths
description: ROTHNathan 85, of Miami Beach Formerly of New York Passed away Tuesday Beloved husband of Dora Devoted father of Vhian Golden of Great Neck Cherished grandfather of Judy Neuhaus and Jill Hertzberg, loving grandfather of Rhonda Neuhaus, dear brother of Sam Roth of Astoria, N Y Mr Roth was a past master of James W Husted Lodge $1068 F and A M of N Y C , past president of the West Side Jewish Center, 34th St N Y C. Past president of Club 23, N Y C past vicepresident of the North Shore Lodge B'nai B'rith, member of Temple Menorah of Miami Beach and a life member of the Hebrew Home for the Aged, Miami Beach Services Thursday 10 30AM from Schwartz Brothers Chapel, 11403 Queens Blvd with interment at Washington Cemetery Shiva will be observed at the home of Mrs &Mrs Irving Golden, 70 Beach Rd , Great Neck

title: IDB Stock Split
description: Shareholders of the IDB Bankholding Corporation, at a meeting in Tel Aviv yesterday approved the declaration of the 40 percent stock split recommended by its board of directors.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: In a day of light, inconclusive trading, bond prices drifted lower yesterday while shortterm fixedincome securities declined and then recovered to close little changed for the day. It was a typical day between Christmas and New Year's, with many institutional investors out of the market.

title: EXPLANATION ASKED
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 26  The State Department said today that it continued to believe that 50 Americans were being held hostage in Teheran and called upon Iranian authorities to explain why four visiting clergymen were shown only 43 persons.

title: Chinese Know Which Came First: The Brown Egg
description: PEKING, Dec. 26  To the Chinese, there is no question about it: the brown egg came before the white chicken, and the white egg's time has not yet come.

title: SECURITY REVIEWED FOR U.N. DIPLOMATS
description: Prompted in part by recent bombing attacks on the Cuban and Soviet missions to the United Nations, United States authorities have quietly begun an intensive review of the security measures used to safeguard New York City's diplomatic community.

title: Flyers Tie; Streak Hits 31 Games
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Dec. 26 (AP)  Thirdperiod goals by Mark Howe and Brian Hill rallied the Hartford Whalers to a 44 tie with Philadelphia tonight, but they failed to stop the Flyers from extending their record unbeaten streak in the National Hockey League to 31 games.

title: Advertising
description: IN the late 1960's and early 1970's, general campus unrest and prevalent antiestablishment attitudes were threatening the very existence of the advertising program at the School of Visual Arts.

title: Hers
description: WHEN Belle Cogdell walks the Upper West Side of Manhattan, the streets part. They wait for her, the swollen. footed diabetics and the fugitive teen mothers, the discards with rheumy eyes or a whisky list. Word passes among the wobbly minded ones, emptied out of the state's huge mental institutions, who haven't yet crawled into a corner to rot. She looks for them and they look for her, the one they call Ma Belle

title: About Jones Beach
description: WANTAGH, L I., Dec. 25  Jones Beach is empty these days of the sunning masses that cover its sands in summer, but the central sector of the beach draws many offseason visitors, nature walkers and joggers. However, at West End 2  as far from downtown Jones Beach as you can get and still be on the beach itself  the winter attendance, particularly on Christmas morning, is sparse.

title: Exchange Averts Squeeze in Copper
description: Action taken by New York's Commodity Exchange to avert a speculative squeeze play that would have hobbled the vital copper industry proved successful yesterday with the expiration of the spot December copper futures contract.

title: Associated Press
description: AMERICAN RELEASED FROM TURKISH JAIL: Loretta J. Dooley, an 18yearold exchange student charged with drug smuggling, walking from Sagmalcilar prison Istanbul after release on Christmas Day. Miss Dooley, of Tracy, Calif., was released on $1,500 bail pending a court hearing in February, and cannot leave Turkey until then.

title: Money Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) Sales of money market mutual funds totaled $13.1 billion in November, down from $14.2 billion in October but still the secondlargest monthly volume ever, the Investment Company Institute reported today.

title: Q &
description: Q. We have a chronic mildew problern in our stall shower that is sometimes evident on our plaster ceiling However, the condition is much more serious in the grouting between the tiles. Fungicidal growths that look like mushrooms, and that grow to as much as a halfinch across, sprout from time to time from the grout joint where the floor and the wall meet. I can get rid of this mildew for a while by washing with a diluted Clorox solution, but the mildew and the growths always seem to come back. The shower stall seems reasonably well ventilated in that it dries out reasonably well when not in use. Can you suggest anything?  R.S., Longmeadow, Mass.

title: China's Trade Plan Has Capitalist Tinge
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 26  In Shanghai, a group of former capitalists has pooled its resources to form a construction company that advertises that it will build factories for new joint ventures anywhere in China.

title: Dpaths
description: De NEUFVILLEOtto Of Falls vit law, CT, on December 24, 1979 Father of Nadia Clark, brother of Alpert, Hugo, Robert, Mrs Olga von: Bredow and Mrs Elisabeth Lehmann Services Friday, December 28th, at 2 PM at the Christ Episcopal Church. Canaan, CT Burial private There are no calling hours Memorial gifts to the Music Mountain inc. Falls Village, CT in his memory would be appreciated

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Yesterday 5 Weather at 1 P M National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration UPI

title: Shelter on L.I. Destroys 106 Dogs in Virus Illness
description: PATCHOGUE, L.I., Dec. 26 An intestinal virus that can kill dogs within two days of their exposure swept through the Brookhaven Town Animal Shelter last week, forcing authorities to destroy all 106 dogs that were in the shelter. Doctors said the virus was not communicable to other pet animals or humans.

title: GARDENING
description: NO longer magical with ornaments or lights, the postholiday Christmas tree usually goes out on the street, mute testimony to Christmas past. But if you have a city terrace, balcony or garden, that tree could continue to serve you well for many more months.

title: Soviet's Best Team Plays Rangers Tonight
description: Members of the Soviet Union's Central Red Army team, a group that has dominated hockey at home the last four years, have been looking like just another tourist group in New York City the last two days. Tonight, their sight will be the the Rangers.

title: 9 Youths Seized in Assaults For Money in IND Rampage
description: The Transit Authority police had to make arrests at three different stations to stop youths from robbing and assaulting passengers early yesterday on an IND A train as it went from 42d Street to the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: Cambodian's Ouster Is Confirmed
description: PEKING, Thursday, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  The ousted Government of Cambodia has replaced Pol Pot as Prime Minister and called for general elections supervised by the United Nations, the regime's Ambassador to China said today.

title: MSGR. WILLIAM L. DOTY
description: Msgr. William L. Doty, an author and pastor of St. John's Rectory in Pauling, N.Y., died Sunday at Northern Westchester Hospital in Mount Kisco after a long illness. He was 60 years old and lived at the rectory.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Pappis, Miss Horvath Gain In Junior Tennis Tourney
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Dec. 26  Hermann Pappis of Morris Plains, N.J., a qualifier, upset 11thseeded Suresh Menon of Malaysia, 75, 63, today in a secondround match of the boys 18 years division of the Rolex international junior tennis tournament at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: Ski Conditions
description: Figures in parentheses show total trails and number open at each area Skiarea forecasts appear on the weather page For information New York,(212) 7558/00; New Jersey, (609) 2928456 Thursdays and Fridays from 2 to 4 P.M.; Pennsylvania, (717)4215791; New Hampshire, (603)2242525, Vermont,(802) 2290531, and Massachusetts, (800) 6285030

title: Reporter's Notebook: Ethnic Unrest in Iran
description: ZAHIDAN, Iran, Dec. 24  Four of Iran's minorities are in this capital city of the Province of Baluchistan and Seistan: the Baluchis, the Seistanis, the Sikhs, and the Government administrators assigned to this dusty mountainous region by the central authority of Ayatollah RuhoRah Khomeini.

title: Technology
description: IT is the fourth day of a sweltering August heat wave in Detroit, and as the afternoon wears on the demand for electricity begins to climb in tandem with the temperature and humidity. By 6 P.M., the Detroit Edison Company finds itself with a peak load situation on its hands. But instead of switching on the kind of expensive generator needed to meet excessive demand, the utility simply transmits a coded radio signal that selectively begins cycling, or turning off and on, some 200,000 home water heaters.

title: Athletes in Action Win
description: MADRID, Dec. 26 (AP) Athletes in Action defeated Juventud of Badalona tonight, 8986, for third place in a fourteam Christmas basketball tournament. The victory was the first in three tournament games for the American team, based in Tustin, Calif. The Soviet Union allstar team defeated Real Madrid, 106102, in the final.

title: Some Facts In Outbreak
description: Veterinarians with the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals and the Animal Medical Center advised dog owners to act cautiously and to avoid panic in the current outbreak of hemorrhagic gastroenteritis.

title: Kitchen Chic: Status Appliances
description: IN these designconscious days, even the kitchen stove cannot escape that modem preoccupation  status. And the status kitchen (it's taken over from the living room as the show case of a designer's talents) must be furnished with the right appliances.

title: Fisher, No. 180, Tops Alexander
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 26 (UPI)  Rick Fisher of the United States defeated secondseeded John Alexander of Australia today, 76, 76, 64, highlighting a flurry of upsets on the second day of the $350,000 Australian open tennis championships.

title: 16 in Prostitution Ring Seized by Peking Police
description: PEKING, Dec. 27 (UPI)  The police have arrested a gang of 16 prostitutes and pimps doing business with foreigners in Peking's bestknown nightspot, the Peace Cafe, a Peking newspaper said today.

title: Book Characters Come Alive
description: Once, the characters in illustrated books were just that  twodimensional figures who disappeared when the book was closed. But now book publishers, heedful of the success of products based on Snoopy and Mickey Mouse, are discovering there is a gold mine in licensing their characters and turning them into objects for an avidly acquisitive, predominantly adult buying public.

title: Marchibroda Is Dismissed as Colts Coach
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 27 (AP)  Ted Marchibroda, who fell from favor when the Baltimore Colts could not win without Bert Jones, their oftinjured quarterback, was dismissed as head coach today by Robert Irsay, owner of the National Football League team.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Dec. 27 (UPI)  The Anaconda Copper Company announced plans today to build a $200 million molybdenum mine and milling operation about 25 miles north of Tonopah in central Nevada.

title: Venezuela, Refiners Near Pact
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 27 (AP)  Venezuela and multinational oil companies, including Exxon, are close to signing new marketing and technical assistance contracts that would assure a steady flow of Venezuelan oil to the United States.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: The Nikolais Dance Theater, known for its dazzling multimedia performances and just back from a tour of the Far East, is appearing at the City Center on West 55th Street through Jan. 6  with choreography, electronic music, complex lighting and costumes, as usual, by the company's founder, Alwin Nikolais. Evening performances are at 8; matinees, today and tomorrow, at 2. Tickets are $8 to $15. Reservations: 2468989.

title: Dole Says Carter Bears Heavy Responsibility For the Iran Situation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  Senator Bob Dole, a Republican Presidential candidate, said yesterday that President Carter bore a heavy responsibility for the problems in Iran and was not doing all he could to break the impasse.

title: Jazz: Jack Dejohnette Returns With New Band
description: JACK DeJOHNETTE was one of the most influential jazz drummers of the 1960's, when he went with Charles Lloyd and Miles Davis. The 70's found him lead ing a variety of bands, some of which were very good indeed and a number of which addressed the fusion of jazz and rock elements in an original manner. But now Mr. DeJohnette seems to be broadening his musical associations, working hard on his original compositions, and getting involved with the new ideas and new energies of the present- day avantgarde. These new directions have resulted in some of the most powerful music of the last year.

title: Photography. The World In Gisle Freund's Lens
description: IN the volume of memoirs Gisele Freund published in the United States in 1974 under the title, The World in My Camera, she gave us a very graphic account of the origins of her photographic career. As a student in her native Germany, actively opposed to the new Nazi regime, she had been obliged to flee to France to escape arrest. With her she took only a single suitcase, her camera and some film recording the early stages of Nazi violence.

title: Kurt Weill Cabaret Is Back
description: The sound of Kurt Weill's music is suddenly everywhere in the city, from the Metropolitan Opera's The Rise and Fall of the City of Mahagonny to the Chelsea Encore Cabaret's parody of the BrechtWeill style in Dreck/ Vile! (The Opera That Bert and Kurt Never Wrote). Next Friday, Weill would have been 80 years old and the Whitney Museum will mark the occasion with a program of his songs and choral works performed by Teresa Stratas and the Gregg Smith Singers at which Weill's widow, Lotte Lenya, will speak. And on Jan. 10 another cabaret parody, Das Lusitania Songspiel, with Sigourney Weaver and Christopher Durang, will open at the Vanities Theater, 407 West 43d Street.

title: Stand By for Good Cable TV
description: Residents of Queens must be wondering if their borough will ever be wired for cable television. They already have waited a decade longer than Manhattan. Now there is word that, due to procedural irregularities with the first round of bids, the city's Bureau Franchises may have to start the bidding all over again. Meanwhile, the bureau must also decide among the two dozen or so firms that want to wire the Bronx, Brooklyn and Staten Island, all at a time when its Office of Telecommunications, which is supposed to advise it on such matters, is under attack.

title: Cracked Ribs Sideline Shero
description: While his team was playing the Central Red Army team last night at Madison Square Garden, Fred Shero, the Rangers' coach and general manager, was at home nursing four cracked ribs.

title: Deaths
description: CHANG  Tien. Regarding obituary placed Wednesday Dec 19. Tien Chang. An error was made in that only one daughterinlaw, Alice should have been in notice. We agoliglze for the error.

title: A Boxing Day Fte for Retired Actors
description: Joe Smith was looking pretty dapper in gray pants and a navy jacket and it was, he said, kind of nice to be back in the old neighborhood.

title: U.S.Soviet Truck Deal Held Legal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  A Commerce Department inquiry has found no illegal diversion to Soviet military use of trucks produced at the Soviet Union's Kama River plant, which was built with substantial American participation.

title: Books of The Times
description: OF F Guy Burgess and Donald Maclean, Cyril Connolly once observed: Nobody could take them quite seriously: they were two characters in a late Russian novel. Laurel and Hardy engaged

title: Article 3 -- No Title
Socialists Urging Spain to Seek Recognition as Nonnuclear Zone
description: MADRID, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  Spain's opposition Socialist Party has introduced a resolution in Parliament urging the Government to do everything possible to declare Spain a nuclearfree zone.

title: Big Board Firm Is Fined $3,500
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday that it had fined Daniels & Bell, its first black member firm, $3,500 in the wake of a threeyearold clerical mixup involving $150,000 of the firm's own cash that was never officially acknowledged by the exchange.

title: Haig Bars Role in Defense Contracts
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 27  With a greeting of Welcome, Mr. President, a beaming Harry J. Gray, the acquisitionminded chairman of the United Technologies Corporation, today introduced his latest catch  Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr.  to the hometown of the company. which is Connecticut's largest employer.

title: News Summary
description: A coup in Afghanistan, reportedly backed by Soviet troops, resulted in the ouster and execution of President Hafizullah Amin. Babrak Karmal, a former Deputy Prime Minister, who has been living in exile in Eastern Europe, is the new President. Both men were viewed as proSoviet, but Mr. Karmal has been regarded as more to Moscow's liking. Witnesses had reported heavy fighting in the capital of Kabul involving Soviet forces. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: Moscow's Backyard Quagmire
description: By intervening so strongly on behalf of a wobbly Afghan client, the Soviet Union appears to be sinking deeper into a backyard quagmire. Doubtless there was an earnest Kremlin debate over airlifting some 4,000 additional troops into northern Afghanistan. Americans can readily imagine the arguments about the need to sustain Soviet credibility around the world and to protect Soviet interests in the region. But, as with Americans in Saigon, Moscow is having problems in Kabul.

title: Simmer Scores 2; Record Now at 13
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 27 (AP)  Charlie Simmer extended his goal scoring streak to 13 consecutive games tonight with his 33d and 34th goals of the season and led the Los Angeles Kings to a 30 National Hockey League victory over the Quebec Nordiques.

title: Saving the Web of Life
description: If you don't think McCarthyism still lives  in the manipulation of public fears through false and reckless charges  then read this excerpt from a recent editorial in The Wall Street Journal:

title: Deaths
description: GOLDBERGER  EmanuelBeloved husband of Frances. Devoted father of Sally Lowenthal and the late Janet Heller. Loving brother of Pauline Hatter. Cherished Grandfather. Services Riverside Chapel, 76 St & Amsterdam Ave, Friday 10AM.

title: Bonn Opposition Wants to Link Claims of Jews and Former Nazis
description: BONN, Dec. 27  The West German Parliament has agreed in principle to pay new reparations to Jewish victims of Nazism, but the awards have become entangled in parallel efforts to discuss restor- ing the pension rights of civic servants of the Hitler era who were never cleared by deNazification tribunals.

title: Child Star of Kramer Takes Role in Stride
description: THE house is a modern Westchester Colonial, and the room, most assuredly, is an eightyearolds. A class portrait of the local public school's third grade lies on the tiny desk, and the bookshelves are filled with dinosaur books, halffinished model ships and cork guns. Having spent his Saturday morning playing Army with his friends, Justin Henry sat down on his bunkbed and mused about his life. I have a family and lots of friends, he told a visitor, as he organized his stuffed animal collection. I also have a doggiewoggie, a cat, some fishywishys, and a lawyer in L.A. to handle things for me.

title: 4 Policemen Suspended in Death
description: MIAMI, Dec. 27 (AP)  Four police officers have been suspended as a result of an investigation into the death of a motorcyclist after a police chase, the authorities said.

title: Soviet Transcript of New Afghan Leader's Appeal Over Kabul Radio
description: Longsuffering countrymen, soldiers, officers, workers, youth, intelligentsia, peasants, virtuous clergy, believers, honest Moslems, Sunni and Shiite, heroic men and women of our country, craftsmen, merchants and representatives of national capital,

title: Wall Warning to East Berliners
description: EAST BERLIN, Dec. 27 (Reuters) East Berliners were told today that they can drink through the night on New Year's Eve, but they were warned in a police notice published in newspapers not to set off firecrackers near the Berlin Wall.

title: Steven Schecter Marries Amy W. Beckjord
description: The Textile Museum of Washington was the setting last evening for the marriage of Amy Wendell Beckjord, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eric S. Beckjord of Washington, to Steven Crane Scheeler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jerrold L. Schecter, also of Washington. Cantor Siegfried Rowe of the Columbia (Md.) Jewish Congregation and the Rev. Theodore Eastman of St. Albans Episcopal Church in Washington officiated.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. Indiana Pacers, at Rutgers Athletic Center, Piscataway, N.J., 8 P.M. (Radio WVNJ)

title: Events and Openings
description: Friday

title: 2 Species of Crocodiles Put on Endangered List
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI) Two more species of crocodiles, the saltwater and the American, have been placed under protection of the Endangered Species Act, a spokesman for the Interior Department said today.

title: Gas Supplies For January
description: Exxon U.S.A. announced yesterday that it expected to supply motorists next month with 90 percent of the gasoline it made available in January 1979, while the Sun Company said it would have 93 percent of last January's supplies available next month.

title: 10.4% Ceiling Set On Savings Notes
description: The Treasury announced yesterday that commercial banks would be allowed to pay 10.15 percent on new smallsaver certificates and savings institutions, 10.9 percent, beginning next month. The new certificates have no minimum denomination.

title: N.F.L. Attendance Mark
description: The National Football League reported yesterday that during the 1979 season it topped the 13 million mark in total attendance for the first time. The total of 13,182,039 fans also registered the secondhighest pergame average in league history  58,848.

title: Carter to Receive Israeli On Issue of Aid Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (Reuters) President Carter has agreed to meet tomorrow with Defense Minister Ezer Weizman of Israel, who is here on a mission seeking a large increase in United States aid, diplomatic sources said today.

title: Art: Library Shows Treasury of 19thCentury Prints
description: SOME of the best of all 19thcentury prints are now on view at the New York Public Library on Fifth Avenue at 42d Street. If shown anywhere else, they would cause a stir, but at the Public Library they have gone up with minimal fuss, along an Lshape corridor on the second floor. In date, they range roughly from Delacroix in the 1820's to Bonnard and Kathe Kollwitz in the 1890's. In quality. they are almost uniformly high. What binds them together, for all the differences in their countries of origin (France, Germany, Spain, England, Sweden, Poland and the United States are all represented), is that they were in the collection of Samuel Putnam Avery (18221904), the founding father of the library's print collection.

title: Pfister Joins Upset List
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 27 (AP)  The Australian open tennis tournament today lost another of its seeded players when Syd Ball defeated Hank Pfister, 75, 46, 64, 63.

title: CREDIT MARKETS Bond Prices Continue to Drift
description: The credit markets continued to drift in a yearend torpor yesterday. Prices declined modestly early in the day and then recovered to close little changed from Wednesday's final levels.

title: Sarah E. Duffy, 82, First Woman Named a New York City Marshal
description: Sarah E. Duffy, the first female city marshal for New York City, died Thursday at the Nassau County Medical Center. Mrs. Duffy, who lived in Levittown, L.I., was 82 years old.

title: Barbara de Portago, a Real Doer With a Flair for Parties
description: At a recent Manhattan benefit honoring Princess Grace of Monaco, a striking young blond woman in a gold sequined Scaasi dress almost upstaged the Princess. The young woman, whom everyone seemed to know, went around hugging and kissing the guests and making the kind of gracious small talk that made them feel at home. She was Barbara de Portago, chairman of the party, which she ended with one of her trademark dramatic touches: the firing of feathers from a small cannon.

title: Basis of the New Moslem Fervor Seen as Rejection of Alien Values
description: CAIRO, Dec. 21  A mounting religious fervor has been sweeping the lands of Islam in the wake of the Iranian revolution. Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini's dramatic appearance on the world scene did not begin the trend, nor has it developed a cohesive force. Its intensity, its goals and its tactics vary as widely as the geography and the history of the world's 700 million to 800 million Moslems.

title: Saudis Lend I.B.M. $300 Million
description: The International Business Machines Corporation disclosed yesterday that it had borrowed $300 million from the Saudi Arabian Government in what constitutes one of the largest  if not the largest  Saudi investments in an American corporation.

title: Old New York for Sale in Village
description: New Yorkers who complain that the city is forever changing, that the old streets, buildings and views disappear, can make time stop for a moment by visiting Welcome to New York City. a store at 26 Carmine Street, in the heart of Greenwich Village, whose specialty is city memorabilia: photographs, picture postcards, prints, buttons, medallions, posters, maps and much that will seem to some firstclass ephemera.

title: Nominee Opposed by Businesses Gets Temporary Job at N.L.R.B.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  In an action designed to circumvent opposition in the Senate, President Carter announced today the temporary appointment of William A. Lubbers as general counsel of the National Labor Relations Board.

title: Russians Vanquish Rangers By 52
description: There is a swirling at center ice, blurs dressed in red circling furiously like a gonemad kaleidoscope. The Soviet skaters spin until anyone close is either sucked in by the sheer speed, or dazzled by the intricacy of their whipquick passes. Then, when everything is in motion, the science that guides the chaos emerges.

title: All 30 Crewmen Are Feared Dead In Ship That Capsized Off Alaska
description: KETCHIKAN, Alaska, Dec. 27 (AP) An ore freighter that had capsized ran aground off the Alaska coast today as winds near hurricane velocity whipped up waves to 25 feet. Little hope remained for any of the vessel's 30 Taiwanese crewmen.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Robert K. Swanson, who recently resigned as executive vice president of General Mills, has been named president and chief operating officer of the Greyhound Corporation, effective Feb. 1. He succeeds Gerald H. Trautman, 67 years old, who continues as chairman and chief executive officer of the diversified conglomerate.

title: Notes on People
description: When Nesbert (Stir) Hooper, a drummer; Joe Sample, a keyboard player, and Milton Felder, a saxophonist, left their native Texas in the early 1950's to try for their break as jazz musicians in Los Angeles, many of America's youngsters were trying out a new knockkneed dance called the chicken as their elders danced to the bigband sounds.

title: New City Judges Take Office
description: Mayor Koch with new city judges after swearingin. Bottom, from left, Aloysius J. Melia, Criminal Court; John A. K. Bradley, Civil Court; Francis X. Egitto, Civil Court; Livingston L. Wingate, Criminal Court, and Emanuel Haber, Civil Court. Standing, from left, S. Her- man Klarsfeld, Civil Court; Leon Deutsch, Family Court; Lester Sacks, Criminal Court; the Mayor; George D. Covington, Criminal Court; Anthony F. Marra, Criminal Court, and Nicholas Coffinas, Criminal Court. They are by an oil of Washington Hunt, Governor from 1851 to 1855.

title: 3 Judges Promoted by Carey to the Appellate Division
description: Governor Carey promoted three judges to the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court yesterday, appointed 10 others within the division to new posts and nominated new judges for Westchester and Rockland County Courts.

title: Two Concerns Cited on Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP)  The Council on Wage and Price Stability, which oversees the voluntary inflation control program, said today that two Dallasbased companies appeared to be in violation of the price guidelines.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 27 (AP)  The teachers union, whose members were not paid last week, filed a lawsuit today seeking back pay for school board employees and an immediate lien on school board property.

title: Teachers in Cleveland Reject Pay Proposals; Long Strike Continues
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 27 (AP)  Cleveland teachers have overwhelmingly rejected the school board's latest contract proposals, thus continuing their 71day strike.

title: Patrons Bemoaning Loss Of Woman's Exchange
description: Beth McKay of Chatham, N.J., and Frances Delaney of Bronxville, N.Y., have been dear friends for more than 50 years now. Yesterday, as is their holiday custom, they met for lunch in the restaurant of the New York Exchange for Woman's Work, 541 Madison Avenue. Mrs. McKay had the fillet of sole and Mrs. Delaney had the shirred eggs.

title: Utility Spending Up 100%
description: Capital appropriations for plant and equipment by publicly owned gas and electric utility companies soared more than 100 percent in the third quarter from a depressed second quarter, the Conference Board reported yesterday.

title: Victims of the PovertyLaw Strike
description: Lowincome New Yorkers with legal problems are having to fend for themselves these days because their lawyers are carrying picket signs instead of briefcases. For six weeks, Community Action for Legal Services, the Federally funded program for the poor, has been struck by its 300 employees, including 160 lawyers. The issues include salaries and fringe benefits, and the employees' role in running the agency. The stalemate has persisted because the agency cannot possibly meet the lawyers' wage demands and is resisting the idea of shared responsibility. Meanwhile, the people who suffer most from this strike  unlike most strikes  are those who are both innocent and vulnerable: the poor.

title: Czech Juniors Top U.S.
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Dec. 27 (AP) Czechslovakia scored five goals in the final period and defeated the United States, 73, as the World Junior Hockey championships, Tor players 19 years and younger, began today. In other games, Finland beat Canada 21; the Soviet Union, the defending champion, beat Switzerland, 60, and Sweden defeated West Germany, 51.

title: Dance: Nikolais Opening
description: THE Nikolais Dance Theater, with choreography, music, slides, lighting, ideas, conceptions and inspiration by Alwin Nikolais, opened last night at the City Center 55th Street Theater. The compa- ny's season, running through Jan. 6, is the latest entry in the City Center's Masters of American Dance series.

title: Two Lawyers Appointed To Aid in Jordan Inquiry
description: Arthur H. Christy, the special prosecutor, announced yesterday that he has appointed two New York City lawyers to assist in the investigation of allegations that Hamilton Jordan, the White House chief of staff, used cocaine.

title: Sturz Going In With Modest Confidence
description: Herbert Jay Sturz, whom Mayor Koch named City Planning Commission chairman yesterday, handled the announcement in a way that suited him perfectly.

title: P.D.Q. Bach's Liebeslieder Polkas Is Unearthed
description: When he was 10 years old and living in Washington in the mid1940's, Peter Schickele, like any other reasonable fellow his age, despised crooned love songs. Hearing one in a record shop one day and responding with loathing, he was astonished when two gunshots erupted and the song veered into Dixieland.

title: Accountant Found Slain In 'Village' Town House
description: An accountant for a subsidiary of the International Telephone and Telegraph Company was found slain in the bedroom of his Greenwich Village town house Wednesday night, the police said.

title: Seton Hall Wins, 8470
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Dec. 27 Seton Hall University never trailed as it snapped Florida Southern's fourgame winning streak with an 8970 victory tonight. The loss spoiled the return of Hal Wissel, Florida Southern's baskletball coach who formerly was Fordham's mentor, to the metropolitan area after five years.

title: Opera: Met Offers Der Rosenkavalier
description: NO one can complain that the Metropolitan Opera is taking things easy in its current performances of Richard Strauss's Der Rosenkavalier. With portions of the score that used to be cut now restored. the three acts and two intermissions now fill up four hours and make for a lot, perhaps even too much, of a good thing. Beautiful though much of it is, Rosenkavalier, like many an opera, benefits from pruning in that its true glories are thereby enhanced.

title: Obituary 1 -- No Title
description: ALLEN V. WILLIAMS JR.

title: Civil Guards Attacked in Spain
description: Civil Guards Attacked in Spain

title: Kheel Libel Suit Names Murdoch
description: Theodore W. Kheel, the labor mediator, has brought suit for libel, charging that an article about him in New York Magazine last Jan. 8 was false, malicious and defamatory and had been motivated by a desire for revenge on the part of Rupert Murdoch, the magazine's owner.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 11:30 A.M. to elect a member of the Security Council

title: Article 2 -- No Title
Head of Regents Plans to Resign At End of Term
description: Declaring that in the last five years the Board of Regents has turned education around in New York State, Theodore M. Black announced yesterday that he planned to resign as the 30th Chancellor of the 195yearold board when his term expired in March.

title: Broadway
description: NOT long ago Lanford Wilson wrote a play and officially called it Talley's Folly. Unofficially, he called it a valentine. So, you can readily guess the heartsandflowers date that has been picked for the play's first performance on Amadway in February.

title: Restaurants
description: IF stars were awarded to restaurants on the basis of charm, Hubert's in the Boerum Hill section of Brookyn would certainly deserve four. It is a gracious and romantic jewel of a place in what was an old neighborhood bar. Conven- ient to the Brooklyn Academy of Music, Hubert's also is well worth a visit for its own sake, given the appeal of the surroundings, the friendly personnel and the original, very good food served there.

title: Television
description: TOP WEEKEND FILMS

title: Deaths
description: STERN  Elsie. Beloved mother of Howard; adored grandmother of Mark, David and Ellen. Services Friday 12:15PM at Schwartz Brothers Forest Park Chapels Queens Blvd & 76th Road, Forest Hills.

title: Governor Seeks Loan for Peabody Institute
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 27 (UPI)  Gov. Harry Hughes has approved a plan that would give the financially troubled Peabody Institute, the nation's oldest music conservatory, an interestfree $7.5 million loan.

title: 4 Law Firms Working on Hostage Defense
description: Lawyers from four leading law firms, with encouragement from the White House, have started preparing for what they describe as the contingency that the hostages in Iran will be put on trial.

title: Heirs of Viola da Gamba Master Perform
description: You won't find listings for the Sieur de SainteColombe in any of the standard music encyclopedias, but there are responsible musicians who believe he was a living, breathing composer in France in the 17th century and that he had two daughters who delighted European audiences with their concerts of music for violas da gamba. High on the list of believers are Les Filles de SainteColombe.

title: Books: American Gothic
description: A WOMAN at a washboard, sitting in a rocker, collecting the eggs her hens have laid, saving up to buy linoleum for the kitchen: this is the sort of image

title: Videotape of Gunfight With Police Is Shown At Trial of 9 Radicals
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27 (AP) Three flashes on a videotape were gunshots that came from the barricaded headquarters of a radical group called Move in a 1978 gunfight in which a police officer was killed, a police cameraman testified today.

title: Publishing: The Odyssey of Samurai
description: HISEKO MATSUBARA'S Samurai, a first novel that Times Books will publish next month and for which has very high hopes, is a book with an interesting publishing twist. It was written by a Japanese, the daugnter or a Shinto priest who is herself an ordained priestess of the same faith, and it deals with an old Samurai house fallen on evil days. But if you glance at the title page, you will notice that the book has been translated from the German by Ruth HeM. More than one book from the East has come into English through a European language, but Samurai was written in German to begin with.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TransAtlantic

title: Where You Can Still Give A Toot for the New Decade
description: IN Manhattan, where there is always something for everyone, the people who devise ways for us to observe New Year's Eve have, inspired perhaps by the coming new decade, outdone themselves this year.

title: Turkish Military Is Censoring TV and Radio News
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 27  After a week of increased political violence around the country, Turkey's Martial Law Command announced today that reports on security matters broadcast by the state radio and television were now being censored. Martial law authorities also arrested seven leftist union leaders.

title: Koch Picks Sturz to Be Chairman Of the City Planning Commission
description: Mayor Koch drew on his administration yesterday and appointed Herbert J. Sturz, his Coordinator of Criminal Justice, as chairman of the City Planning Commission.

title: Analysis of A.F.C. Contenders in Playoffs
description: In preparing this week to play the Chargers, the Oilers had to make do without Ken Burrough, the team's top receiver; Earl Campbell, the league's leading ball carrier, and Dan Pastorini, for nine years the firststring quarterback. All were realistically listed on the N.F.L. injury report as doubtful, which means the athlete has only a 2575 chance of playing. None have practiced, and the Oilers drilled hard with Gifford Nielsen at quarterback, Rob Carpenter at halfback and Mike Renfro at wide receiver.

title: Choice in Indian Vote Seems to Narrow Between Ram and Mrs. Gandhi
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 27  I want to be the Prime Minister not because I am a harijan, but because I am the ablest.

title: Dr. Gilbert Dalldorf, A Researcher Known For Work on Viruses
description: Dr. Gilbert Dalldorf, former director of the New York State Division of Laboratories and Research and a biomedical researcher, died last Friday at Old Forge, N.Y., after a twomonth illness. He was 79 years old.

title: Celebrating The Golden Age
description: A PROGRAM that brings together jazz musicians and singers like Dizzy Gillespie and Joe Carroll with some of tap dancing's major performers  including the Nicholas Brothers  does not turn up every day.

title: A Reprieve for Mortgage Money Reality
description: Some mortgage money may begin to flow again in New York State, at least for 90 days. For that length of time, Congress has suspended all state laws imposing limits on the interest charged on mortgage loans. The action supersedes the 10 percent ceiling that stopped all New York savings institutions from making mortgage loans in a period when depositors demanded over 11 percent on time deposits. Although many state legislators love to be recorded in favor of low interest rates, they now have three months in which to deal with the real world  by repealing all ceilings on mortgage interest rates.

title: Critic's Notebook
description: WITH two decades still to go in the 20th century, it is too soon to guess what historians will deem to have been the most decisive factor in its musical development, but the phenomenal influence of recording and electronic transmission of sound will surely have to be taken into account.

title: Lawyer Admits Client Tried to Sell Machine Guns but Calls It Legal
description: The lawyer for one of two men who have been described by investigators as major international gun runners conceded yesterday that his client had intended to sell 10,000 machine guns to two New York City detectives posing as revolutionaries. But he asserted that his client was innocent of any crime.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: URNIETA, Spain, Dec. 27 (UPI) Suspected Basque guerrillas made an abortive attack early today on two members of the paramilitary Civil Guard outside a bar, the guardsmen told authorities. They said they saw the hooded gunmen sitting in a car as they were leaving the bar, where they had been drinking.

title: Woodson, Indiana Star, Undergoes Back Surgery
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 27 (AP) Mike Woodson, a star on the Indiana University basketball team, underwent surgery today for repair of a ruptured disk in his back. He probably will be lost to the highly ranked Hoosiers for the rest of the season.

title: Business Records
description: BANK RUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Thursday, Dec. 27,1979

title: AN EXILE TAKES OVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  President Hafizullah Amin of Afghanistan was ousted from power and executed today in a coup reportedly supported by Soviet troops.

title: Firefighters in Kansas City Replaced by Guardsmen
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 27  Gov. Joseph P. Teasdale declared a state of emergency here today and dispatched 500 National Guardsmen to man fire stations. The city's 906 firefighters were continuing a work slowdown to protest a deadlock in contract negotiations.

title: Yamani Denies Oil Rise Report
description: PARIS, Dec. 27 (AP)  Saudi Arabia's oil minister, Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, today denied published reports that his country had decided to raise its $24abarrel oil price by $2 in February. Sheik Yamani said that no decision has been taken.

title: Economic Scene
description: ATLANTA THESE are dismal days for the dismal science, according to those who practice economics. The economists who have assembled here to attend the annual convention of the Allied Social Science Associations say that their profession's selfesteem appears to have fallen to a new low.

title: Dividends
No Snow, No Profit in the East
description: BOLTON VALLEY, Vt., Dec. 27 In the ski business the rule of thumb is that you either make it Christmas Week or you are not going to make it at all. And here in the heart of Eastern ski country, a region already hurt by a slow summer tourist season and rapidly rising fuel prices, the verdict is as plain as the grass showing through on the slopes: Profits in the multibilliondollar ski industry are melting away under nearrecord high temperatures.

title: The Region
description: ATLANTIC CITY  Atlantic City policemen set up information centers yesterday morning at five major roads leading into the city in a wage protest that caused hourlong slowdowns on Routes 30 and 40 at the city limits.

title: Court Permits F.T.C.Chief to Act In Inquiry on Children's Ads
description: WASHINGTON,Dec. 27 (AP) Michael Pertschuk,chairman of the Federal Trade Commission,won the right in court today to participate in an agency inquiry into whether television commercials aimed at children should be banned.

title: OwensIllinois Lifts Prices
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 27 (AP) OwensIllinois Inc. said today that it would raise prices on most of its plastic bottles by 6.5 percent on Jan. 15.

title: Marine General Named to Head Rapid Deployment Task Force
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP)  A Marine general was picked today to head a special task force developing plans that would allow for rapid deployment of United States military forces to remote crisis areas such as the Persian Gulf.

title: Deaths
description: ANDREWS  Jim, artist, photographer's representative, leaving his wife, Lynn, son Jim, 13, mother Josephine, 91, sister Lisa Daugherty, brother Joe, niece and grandnephew Angel & Billy, spiritual sister and brother Shirley West and Joe Stapleton, devoted cat Orangy, the mountains of Dela Mallorca which he dearly loved and Steve Dixon who gave quality to the end of his life, and many other friends who loved him. Memorial in January.

title: Judge, 79, Challenging Forced Retirement Law
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 27 (AP)  A 79yearold judge forced off the bench by a state judicial retirement law has filed suit, saying judges should be protected from age discrimination as other workers are.

title: Iranian Minister Now Seeks Trials, Seeming to Drop Plan for Tribunal
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 27  Foreign Minister Sadegh Ghotbzadeh, apparently abandoning his attempt to find a way out of the impasse over the hostages held at the American Embassy through an international tribunal, called tonight for their trial on charges of spying.

title: Deaths
description: JENNINGS  Edward Arthur. Of Raleigh, N.C. died December 26. Funeral December 27 in Raleigh, N.C. He was a retired Senior Officer for Edison Savings and Loan Association in New York. Survived by his wife Gladys P. Jennings of Raleigh, one daughter Nancy Cochrane of Dix Hills, N.Y. and three grandchildren.

title: Light Plane Blocks Jet Landing
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 27 (AP)  A light plane taxiing onto a runway today forced the pilot of a Pacific Southwest Airlines jetliner with 145 persons aboard to pull up sharply and overfly Lindbergh Field. The Federal Aviation Administration said that the unidentified pilot of the light plane had moved onto the runway after the jet had been cleared for the landing. He was not authorized to be there, a spokesman said,

title: Cavaliers Subdue Knicks
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Dec. 27 (AP) Mike Mitchell poured in 34 points, 12 during a pivotal thirdquarter rally, and led the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 125110 victory over the New York Knicks tonight

title: Athletic Council Supports New Mexico's President
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Dec. 27 The University of New Mexico's athletic council today gave its support to William E. Davis, the university's president, over his handling of a complaint raised by a professor about possible irregularities in a basketball player's academic transcript.

title: Dock Workers in Spain Protest Plan to Transfer Control of Ports
description: MADRID, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  Spanish ports were paralyzed today by a national dock strike called to protest Government plans to put them in private hands.

title: Schooner Sinking Off L.I
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 27  The twomasted schooner John J. Leavitt, the nation's first sailing cargo ship in 40 years, foundered on her maiden voyage 260 miles off Long Island tonight after the Air National Guard rescued her five crew members and four members of a film crew.

title: Contrasts in Federal Aid: Chrysler vs. New York
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  The $3.5 billion financial rescue package Congress approved last week for the Chrysler Corporation requires fewer concessions from workers and creditors than the aid plans devised for New York City in 1975 and 1978, in the opinion of both New York and some Federal officials.

title: Islamic Faith Embraces More Than Arab World
description: The Arab world and the world of Islam are distinct, but they overlap in several senses.

title: Carter May Not Join the Iowa Debate Because of Iran
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  President Carter, confronted with a sharp argument between his political and foreign policy advisers about the wisdom of participating in the scheduled Jan. 7 Presi- dential debate in Iowa, is seriously considering withdrawing from the event because of the crisis in Iran, White House sources said today.

title: Letters' Authenticity Doubted
description: HOMER, Ill. (AP)  The relatives of Paul Lewis, who is being held hostage in Teheran, do not believe that letters they received the day after Christmas were jwritten by the 22yearold Marine sergeant.

title: U.S. Plans New Appeal On Virginia HighRise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  Cecil D. Andrus, the Secretary of the Interior, has directed Federal lawyers to search for a decent lezal areument on which to base a Supreme Court appeal of the Government's case against four highrise office buildings across the Potomac River from Washington, a spokesman for the Interior Department said yesterday.

title: Percy Atwood Shay Dead at 84; An ExConsul General in Monaco
description: BAY SHORE, L.I., Dec. 27 (AP) Percy Atwood Shay, consul general to Monaco from 1949 to 1954, has died of cancer. He was 84 years old.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Allied Chemical Corporation, Morris Township, N.J., has elected H. Dorn Stewart Jr. to the newly created post of senior vice president, operations.

title: Ike Wins by a Landslide In the Atlantic City Slots
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 27  The Susan B. Anthony dollar is even less popular with slot machine gamblers than with the general public.

title: Rizzo Era at End for Philadelphia's Troubled Police
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Philadelphia police are in a state of limbo these days. After eight years under Mayor Frank L. Rizzo, a former police commissioner and a tough lawandorder man, they face a new Mayor. William J. Green 3d. who has promised to appoint a new police commissioner and alter the department's old ways of operating.

title: Nile Rowing Is Won By U.S. Eight, Egypt
description: CAIRO, Dec. 27  The ninth annual Nile International Rowing Festival ended today with the United States capturing the feature race and Egypt providing the biggest surprise.

title: COURT BACKS CARTER ON IRANIAN STUDENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  A Federal appeals court ruled today that the Carter Administration had the right to conduct special immigration checks of Iranian students in the United States and to begin deportation proceedings against any who were here illegally or who did not report to immigration officials as ordered.

title: Islanders Win, 73, As Bossy Scores 3 Against Canadiens
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 27  So who said the Montreal Canadiens were alive and well again?

title: 5 Democrats and 7 Republicans To Be on New Hampshire Ballot
description: CONCORD, N.H., Dec. 27 (AP) Senators Howard Baker, Republican of Tennessee, and Bob Dole, Republican of Kansas, today entered New Hampshire's Presidential primary, bringing the number of candidates who will appear on the ballot to 12.

title: Manager of Pilgrim Hospital Store Ousted for Selling Dangerous Items
description: BRENTWOOD, L.I. Dec. 27  The manager of the commissary at Pilgrim State Psychiatric Hospital was discharged today for selling powerful slingshots, hunting bows and arrows and ex- pensive cameras, perfume, watches, golf clubs and other dangerous or totally inappropriate items in the modest store connected to the hospital cafeteria.

title: Deaths
description: REILLY  John J.(Retired NYCPD) on Thursday, December 27, 1979. Beloved husband of the late Mary E. Loving father of Rosemary Coster, Helen Hostek and William F. Also survived by 11 grandchildren. Reposing at Martin A. Gleason F.H., 14920 Northern Blvd., Flushing. Mass of Christian Burial Saturday, December 29 at 10:30 AM St. Mary's Nativity RC Church.

title: Advertising
description: WHEN his agency began to acquire general accounts, David R. Altman, with a career in fashion advertising behind him, found some things that did not please him.

title: Court Says Koch May Vote On Revisions in City Budget
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court ruled yesterday that the City Charter allowed Mayor Koch to vote on changes in the city budget after its initial approval.

title: Cruise Missile Fails Test Flight, Crashing 800 Miles From Target
description: LOMPOC, Calif., Dec. 27 (AP)  A cruise missile failed a test flight today, the second such failure this month, Air Force officials said.

title: Court Rules Lieutenant Governor Runs California If Brown Is Away
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 27 (AP)  The state Supreme Court ruled today that the Lieutenant Governor can exercise all powers of the Governor while the chief executive is away from California.

title: China Tells Its Farmers to Brace For Long Period of Dry Weather
description: PEKING, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  The farmers of China were told today to take precautions against a long dry spell forecast by the Central Meteorological Observatory.

title: Carter Entered in Illinois
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Dec. 27 (AP) President Carter was entered today as a candidate for the Illinois Democratic primary election March 18.

title: Chorus Line Trip Halted
description: Dancers in A Chorus Line won't be kicking up their heels in Moscow next spring. A cultural exchange proposed by Joseph Papp, the producer, has been called off because Mr. Papp could not raise the money  about $1 million  to send about 50 cast and crew members to the Soviet Union for an eightweek, threecity tour. Last week Mr. Papp had still to make the tour a reality.

title: Arguello to Defend Title
description: Alexis Arguello of Nicaragua will defend his World Boxing Council superfeatherweight title against Ruben Castillo of Bakersfield, Calif., in a 15round bout in Tucson, Ariz., on Jan. 20.

title: At the Movies
description: ALTHOUGH Chapter Two ostensibly describes the courtship, marriage and postmarital problems of Neil Simon and his second wife, Marsha Mason,

title: About Real Estate
description: The year 1980 will mark a turning point in New York City's use of tax incentives to improve its housing supply. The new direction is charted in changes of the socalled J51 law, sought by the Koch administration and enacted after some revision by the City Council.

title: Dallas Surges in Ratings
description: Two episodes of Dallas were aired by CBSTV last week, the regular Friday night episode and a special Thursday night offering, to set the stage for the new spinoff series Knots Landing. Both outings were among

title: Letter by Marine Hostage Indicates Opposition to U. S. Foreign Policy
description: One of the marines being held hostage in Teheran told his father in a letter that if and when he returns home, he wants to work to change some United States foreign policies, like playing father to leaders of other countries at all costs, like they do with the Shah of Iran.

title: Carolina Blaze Kills 10 Inmates Of Historic Jail
description: A fire broke out yesterday evening in the 150year old jail in Lancaster County, S.C., killing 10 inmates and injuring eight other persons, the authorities there said.

title: No Confirmed Dog Virus Cases in City
description: There have been no confirmed cases in New York City of the intestinal virus that led the Brookhaven Town Animal Shelter on Long Island to kill 106 dogs in the last few days, veterinary authorities in the city said yesterday.

title: Satellite Photograph
Money
description: Prime rate: 1515

title: From Exile to Afghan Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  Babrak Karmal has experienced political power and electoral success but also imprisonment, purges and exile during a tumultuous career in the service of Marxism in Afghanistan that has ab- sorbed 30 of his 50 years.

title: Soviet Greeting Cards Upset British
description: LONDON, Dec. 27  The greetings may be quickly forgotten, but what will be recorded as the great Christmas card flap of 1979 lingers on. Britain found the Christmas spirit lacking in cards produced in the Soviet Union, thanks to the efforts of a harddriving American company, and has elevated it to an international incident.

title: New Face: John Shea The joy of Sorrows
description: STEPHEN is wild with love, befuddled and bedazzled with love. Yesterday he was consumed with an undying passion for Liz, who lived with him. But she just moved out, and today his yearning gaze has alighted upon a waitress who chanced to serve him a hotfudge sundae, one Sophia Pickle. Sundae forgotten, he is instantly enamored. By tomorrow, however, he will be inflamed over Christine, his best friend's girlfriend. My perfect woman! he will proclaim triumphantly  shortly after which she, too, will abandon him.

title: Clerics Were Told 6 Hostages Refused to See Them
description: Three clergymen who paid a Christmas visit to the American hostages in Iran returned to the United States last night and said the Iranian militants holding the hostages had told them that six of the prisoners had declined to attend Christmas services conducted by the ministers.

title: Thurmond and ExGov. Edwards Turn to Connally
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Dec. 27 (UPI) John B. Connally, a Republican Presidential contender, won endorsements today from Senator Strom Thurmond, Republican of South Carolina, and James Edwards, a former Governor. Both supported Ronald Reagan in 1976.

title: Parker-Hannifin Buys Growth
description: CLEVELAND  Patrick S. Parker, chairman and chief executive of the ParkerHannifin Corporation, spent a recent morning preparing himself to welcome yet another acquisition into a company that has grown in two decades into one of the giants of the fluid power field.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 28, 1979

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: The City
description: There will be 40 percent more policemen assigned to New Year's Eve duty in the Times Square area this year in an effort to improve crowd control and contain any violence or outbreaks of crime, the police said.

title: Arthur A. Peters, Writer Of Psychological Novels
description: Arthur Anderson Peters, a novelist who wrote under the name of Fritz Peters, died on Dec. 19 in Las Cruces, N.M., of heart disease. He was 66 years old.

title: Woman Dies in California Plunge
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 27 (UPI)  An unidentified woman has become the 697th confirmed suicide from the 42yearold Golden Gate Bridge. Her body was recovered from the water near Fort Point shortly after she leaped to her death from the span yesterday, the Coast Guard said.

title: Israel Reports Rising Terrorist Incursions From Jordan
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 27  On the surface, it was an unremarkable incident for a country that has endured dozens of terrorist incidents this year. Last night, according to an Israeli Army spokesman, a small explosive charge went off near a farming community.

title: Donations for the Neediest Cases Take the Place of Christmas Gifts
description: In the spirit of the holidays, a couple from Flushing, Queens, sent a $25 contribution to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund in the name of others.

title: Market Place
description: IT rarely happens that the small investor steals a march on the institutions, but the market action in the stock of the Freeport Minerals Company seems a case in point. The case suggests not only that the small investor can win, but also that the stock market does not always reflect what's happening this even though the perfect market theory suggests that news and developments are almost instantly reflected in market price.

title: HENRY FRIED, HELD PRISON BOARD POST
description: Henry Fried, a former member of the New York State Correction Commission who was convicted of bribing a New York City Water Commissioner in exchange for lucrative city contracts, died yesterday in Memorial Hospial in Manhattan. He was 79 years old and lived in Mount Kisco, N.Y.

title: Gen. Mikhail Kazakov; ExWarsaw Treaty Aide
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  Gen. Mikhail I. Kazakov, a former chief of staff of the Warsaw Pact forces, has died at the age of 78, the press agency Tass said today.

title: Syrian Resigns as U.N. Delegate
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 27 Hammoud elChoufi, thin, baldish, perspiration gleaming on his forehead, sat in the Delegates' Lounge tonight, fingering his worry beads and sipping straight scotch. He had just told reporters he was resigning as Syria's representative at the United Nations and, for good measure, denounced the regime of President Hafez alAssad as a police state.

title: CORRECTION
description: A picture caption in The Times on Dec. 13 incorrectly identified a member of the Pittsburgh Board of Education. She is Helen Miscimarra. The caption also misspelled the name of the Board's president, Elinor Langer.

description: MANHATTAN

Admission to a storytelling and magic session. $3; stories or magic alone, $2; both prices include light refreshments. Reservations: 8386878.
